      importutils.import_object_ep(xxx)
  except:
      warn
      importutils.import_object_ns(xxx)

@kevin well the issue is they aren't actually supported on trunk today, so this patch would add back options that were already removed."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-10-29 17:47:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Yeah, I read your inline too quickly.  That said, if we're going to move to entrypoints anyway, it would make sense to me that we add back short names anyway.  Yeah, it's a little confusing to someone who's been following OpenStack—we're essentially backtracking—but short names are also easier to use, and they're one of the advantages of an entrypoints-based system."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-10-29 19:38:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

@kevin I think if we're talking about reversing course on the config values, we should do that separately from this patch. Land just the entry points change, and not change the behavior for now."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-10-29 19:43:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

I think that's a reasonable compromise position…"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-10-30 08:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Ok, I can see that. When you say "short names" - do you  mean libvirt or libvirt.LibvirtDriver (or both)?'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-10-30 11:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

By short names I mean this chunk:

26	    "baremetal = nova.virt.baremetal:BareMetalDriver",
27	    "fake = nova.virt.fake:FakeDriver",
28	    "hyperv = nova.virt.hyperv:HyperVDriver",
29	    "libvirt = nova.virt.libvirt:LibvirtDriver",
30	    "powervm = nova.virt.libvirt:PowerVMDriver",
31	    "vmwareapi = nova.virt.vmwareapi:VMWareESXDriver",
32	    "xenapi = nova.virt.xenapi:XenAPIDriver",

as those were just removed a couple weeks ago when the connection_type field was removed.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-10-30 13:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-08 15:09:15.000000000', 'message': 'Straw-man thought for entrypoint drivers.

If we did drivers like this for virt instead of with import_object_ns,
then out-of-tree virt drivers should be much easier for people to develop.

Change-Id: Ia57ea4c5de7c1a5c2ac445ea9b9f49a013487f9b
'}, {'created': '2012-08-08 15:18:48.000000000', 'message': 'Straw-man thought for entrypoint drivers.

If we did drivers like this for virt instead of with import_object_ns,
then out-of-tree virt drivers should be much easier for people to develop.

Change-Id: Ia57ea4c5de7c1a5c2ac445ea9b9f49a013487f9b
'}, {'created': '2012-08-10 23:31:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for entrypoints virt drivers.

Manage them via entry point loading. If the driver cannot be found via
entrypoint, then fall back to old-style import mechanism in case someone
else was relying on the old behavior.

With this, things like "pip install nova-virt-hyper-v" could be expected
to work.

commit_message:
Add support for entrypoints virt drivers.

Manage them via entry point loading. If the driver cannot be found via
entrypoint, then fall back to old-style import mechanism in case someone
else was relying on the old behavior.

With this, things like "pip install nova-virt-hyper-v" could be expected
to work.

Part of blueprint entrypoints-plugins.

Change-Id: Ia57ea4c5de7c1a5c2ac445ea9b9f49a013487f9b

commit_message:
Fixes AttributeError of FloatingIPPollster

Currently FloatingIPPollster is using Nova client to get floating
IP metrics instead of accessing OpenStack DB directly. So there are
some attributes can't be accessed from Nova /os-floating-ips REST API.
In this fix, those attributes usage will be removed temporarily.
And they will be back after fix the Nova bug 1174802.

Fixes bug 1173845

Change-Id: I61572c50db6f90c26bbdb7da5f0e9a249b405e58

'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-05-02 00:48:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Ahh, pardon my ignorance. I did not realize ordereddict is a 3rd party module.

We've tried to keep heat-cfntools free of most dependencies to limit complications when installing it on many different platforms. Currently only boto and psutil are needed, and psutil is only for cfn-push-stats.

If we decide to add it as a dependency, one needs to add ordereddict to tools/pip-requires anyway, so at that point, just using the same approach on 2.6 and 2.7 seems quite logical. Alternatively we can move the requirements generation to setup.py and make it conditional on 2.6 vs. 2.7. That also sounds overly complicated.

Given these facts, fixing the test suite so that it does not depend on ordering would probably be the preferred approach. We don't care about ordering in the code, and it should not be difficult."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-05-02 15:05:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-02 15:07:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

In Python 2.6, SafeConfigParser defaults to "dict", which
does not preserve section order. At least the testsuite
depends on a specific section order. Use ordereddict for
those Python versions. Starting with Python 2.7,

'}, {'created': '2013-05-02 15:05:44.000000000', 'message': 'Rework testsuite to be section order agnostic

In Python 2.6, SafeConfigParser defaults to "dict", which
does not preserve section order. The testsuite was expecting
insertion order to be preserved, which is the case with
Python 2.7. According to Clint Byrum the actual code does
not worry about section ordering, so I reworked the tests
to sort sections into a welldefined order and run tests
then, which makes it pass for all Python versions.

commit_message:
Rework testsuite to be section order agnostic

In Python 2.6, SafeConfigParser defaults to "dict", which
does not preserve section order. The testsuite was expecting
insertion order to be preserved, which is the case with
Python 2.7. According to Clint Byrum the actual code does
not worry about section ordering, so I reworked the tests
to sort sections into a welldefined order and run tests
then, which makes it pass for all Python versions.

Change-Id: Ia4e14018ae70c465b0b56d406d29fbb3c2ea280c

commit_message:
Import latest log module from oslo

Deprecates log_format in favor of the formatting options used by the
context aware formatter, such as logging_default_format_string.

Changes the default logging formatter back to a colorful and context
aware formatter.  The default was inadvertently changed in the great
oslo sync at the start of Havana, this returns it to what was in at the
end of Grizzly.

Adds support for lazy instantiation of the logger.

Bug 1167081
Bug 1165211

Change-Id: Ibe41afc6e9d7b432453785819821b3c8f0078613

I would expect you to have to modify:

(1 inline comment)

@Vish: It looks to me like this change will re-order the networks returned from the database to the order they were in the list passed to the function.  It's sorting based on the network_uuids.index of the UUID, not the UUID itself.

However, I have concerns about the tests, most notably that I don't see anywhere that the order of the networks returned from the function is ever checked.  In fact, I left a comment inline that I don't think this function should even be called in the test cases where it currently is.  The list it returns is being ignored anyway.

Note that if I'm correct about that and everyone agrees that we should remove the unnecessary call, a new test case will be needed to exercise this code.  I think that's a good idea anyway so we can verify that the order returned is what we expect."}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-04-28 05:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

All it does is add unnecessary lines of code."}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-05-02 02:20:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Make nova-network support requested nic ordering

The nova-network did not honor nic ordering, so nics were attached in db
natural order. This patch sorts the networks honor requested nic
ordering when Nova calls the nova-network API.

Fixes bug: #1170725

Change-Id: I7dd04ac7bdda95c626cbb0fe35be0aadacb4bd2a
Signed-off-by: zhiyanl-cn <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

When a function that returns a list of extension classes is registered
in the entrypoints and in the nova config, the BaseFilter and BaseWeight
should be able to load get the list of classes out of it.

commit_message:
Filters and Weights should be able to load a function

When a function that returns a list of extension classes is registered
in the entrypoints and in the nova config, the BaseFilter and BaseWeight
should be able to load get the list of classes out of it.

This is to make it compatible with nova, so that oslo-incubator's
filters and weights system can replace nova's

It also breaks out the common functionality of both BaseFilterHandler
and BaseWeightHandler into a shared base class: BaseHandler

Fixes Bug 1175811
blueprint entrypoints-plugins

Change-Id: I329580ff517334bf082357908c7d0bc41073cc9e

Remove unnecessary code from create_pool_health_monitor method

Remove incorrect database object fetch and update.
Get rid of unnecessary query for pool object.
Make code that creates monitor list more pythonic

commit_message:
Ensure correct polkit config written for RHEL6

Ensure the correct polkit config is written for RHEL6, or nova-cpu
will fail to start with libvirt permission errors

Change-Id: I871ef4e03157883db15be41222b7338765fbb843

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-05 07:05:44.000000000', 'message': 'Adds POST method support in the metadata service

Fixes bug: #1092311

The password generation feature introduced in Grizzly requires POST
support in the metadata service.

Support has been added to both the metadata agent and namespace proxy.
Due to the usage of a Unix socket between the namespace proxy and the
agent, the original HTTP method is forwarded to the agent by using the
X-HTTP-Method header.

Change-Id: If7ef6bede1775ad682822cb868518ec732b90805
'}, {'created': '2013-05-05 07:05:44.000000000', 'message': 'Adds POST method support in the metadata service

X-HTTP-Method header.

Change-Id: If7ef6bede1775ad682822cb868518ec732b90805

Change-Id: If7ef6bede1775ad682822cb868518ec732b90805
'}, {'created': '2013-05-05 07:05:44.000000000', 'message': 'Adds POST method support in the metadata service

Fixes bug: #1092311

The password generation feature introduced in Grizzly requires POST

Support has been added to both the metadata agent and namespace proxy.
Tests have been added and updated accordingly.

Change-Id: If7ef6bede1775ad682822cb868518ec732b90805
'}]
commit_message:
Adds POST method support in the metadata service

Fixes bug: #1092311

The password generation feature introduced in Grizzly requires POST
support in the metadata service.

Support has been added to both the metadata agent and namespace proxy.
Tests have been added and updated accordingly.

Change-Id: If7ef6bede1775ad682822cb868518ec732b90805

commit_message:
vmwareapi: Add supported_instances to host state

The VMWareVCDriver uses the VCState class to report host state,
but VCState.update_status() does not include supported_instances.
Add supported_instances to the data returned by update_status(),
similar to HostState.update_status().

Change-Id: I15c0f930dd9e540f6fdb0d7246661a0c98e35ed4

[{'created': '2013-05-03 21:29:25.000000000', 'message': 'Deleting a backup removed the backup record from database

Instead we should be marking the backup as deleted so that we have an audit
of all the backups. Backups are now marked deleted in the way that volumes
are.

Fixes bug: 1169943
Fixes bug: 1169857

Change-Id: I52c603be138c0f1d6d411d167977041255ac9053
(cherry picked from commit a4ba17b668bd893d50fd4f3a5453da89966a77e3)
'}, {'created': '2013-05-03 22:17:27.000000000', 'message': 'Dont delete backup record from database

Instead we should be marking the backup as deleted so that we have an audit
of all the backups. Backups are now marked deleted in the way that volumes
are.

Fixes bug: 1169943
Fixes bug: 1169857

Change-Id: I52c603be138c0f1d6d411d167977041255ac9053

'}]
commit_message:
Dont delete backup record from database

Instead we should be marking the backup as deleted so that we have an audit
of all the backups. Backups are now marked deleted in the way that volumes
are.

Fixes bug: 1169943
Fixes bug: 1169857

Change-Id: I52c603be138c0f1d6d411d167977041255ac9053
(cherry picked from commit a4ba17b668bd893d50fd4f3a5453da89966a77e3)

commit_message:
Add stats reporting to Nexenta Driver

Nexenta driver was never updated to report stats.
This change doesn't include support for backend_name assignment
via configs, there's some other work that will need to be
done to enable that.

Fixes bug: 1166607

Change-Id: Id9cfff24df8815a67e42393aa18fd41ac1b9e6b3
(cherry picked from commit 781055bc1f30cebe08848130f3a40764f7f1bb4f)

[{'created': '2013-05-03 21:10:14.000000000', 'message': "Add capabilities reporting to ThinLVM driver

ThinLVM driver was missing the newly required capabilities reporting
and inheritance from the parent LVM driver doesn't work because the
capacity reporting methods between regular LVM and Thin LVM are not
compatible.

This patch add the basic requirements needed in the capabilities reporting
to make it usable by the filter scheduler.

Fixes bug: 1166572

Change-Id: I471dcc31d07516e71bcd2d3ae03e0405e0594697
(cherry picked from commit a95a2149a5ba805451a6d961b792ccd5b9984bea)
"}]
commit_message:
Add capabilities reporting to ThinLVM driver

ThinLVM driver was missing the newly required capabilities reporting
and inheritance from the parent LVM driver doesn't work because the
capacity reporting methods between regular LVM and Thin LVM are not
compatible.

This patch add the basic requirements needed in the capabilities reporting
to make it usable by the filter scheduler.

Fixes bug: 1166572

Change-Id: I471dcc31d07516e71bcd2d3ae03e0405e0594697
(cherry picked from commit a95a2149a5ba805451a6d961b792ccd5b9984bea)

(2 inline comments)

The test case seems to conflate compute.host and compute.hypervisor_hostname (aka. nodename). The former is the `hostname` of the host running nova-compute; the latter is the unique identifier assigned to the node it is controlling. Most hypervisor drivers have a 1:1 relationship here, but some (eg, baremetal) do not.

In baremetal, the hypervisor_hostname is a UUID identifying the physical server being managed by nova-compute."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-04-30 19:51:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

commit_message:
Update hypervisor_hostname after live migration

After a live migration, the OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:hypervisor_hostname
attribute of the instance is not updated correctly.  This change
adds a parameter to the call to _instance_update that fixes the
problem.

Fixes bug 1173376

Change-Id: I40f1ead2d93c7a9979a914e0fb96e3e5bb287b48

Before when iterating using this object, the call to the underlying file object
was made without a chunk_size.  This is bad because this would cause the entire
contents of the file to be read.

Change-Id: I9956e5d2d693a6260252fff331d4f78f70179a6c
'}]
commit_message:
Adds chunk_size to CompressingFileReader.

Before when iterating using this object, the call to the underlying file object
was made without a chunk_size.  This is bad because this would cause the entire
contents of the file to be read.

Change-Id: I9956e5d2d693a6260252fff331d4f78f70179a6c

The use of 999.99 is kind of a hack anyway. I'd rather see a flag value like None or float("inf") come out of the RingBuilder and convert that to something displayable right at display time. I understand if you don't feel like doing all that work, though. This'll do for now.

However, there is one thing you need to address (IMHO): while it's good that you defined a MAX_BALANCE constant, there's still some hardcoded uses of 999.99 over in swift.common.ring.builder.RingBuilder, so those values could drift out of sync. Would you please move MAX_BALANCE over into builder.py and just refer to it from swift-ring-builder? That way, the values can't get out of sync.

Note to other reviewers: I wrote a script that exhibits the bug; it's just a little more complicated than described in the bug report. You may find it useful.

Script: http://paste.openstack.org/show/36615/'}, {'account_id': 6689, 'date': '2013-04-26 05:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-26 05:54:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Fix rebalance for zero weighted devices.

If we set device's weight to zero, currently balance will be set
special value(999.99) until zero weighted device return all
its partitions. So we cannot check balance has changed.
Thus we need to check balance or last_balance is special value.

Change-Id: I5b7db8b8e48db0c4771c51a764bda689869817d5
Fixes: bug #1171731

commit_message:
Clean up the exceptions hierarchy.

 - Reuse code from openstack.common.exception
 - Merge QuantumClientException with QuantumException
 - Ensure that all exceptions define a default message
 - Remove the 'Client' qualifier from the name of all exceptions

Fixes bug 987586 and bug 1131724.

Change-Id: I553ae99859a0243e3fbdd6229f32566656a950cd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-13 10:34:27.000000000', 'message': 'Adds db migration testcase 009

Adds a db migration testcase with data for migration 009.

Fixes bugs in downgrade_user_table and downgrade_tenant_table in the 010
migration which erroneously caused the enabled parameter booleans to be coverted
to strings before they were dumped in JSON format. This resulted in a state
where a future upgrade to 010 would fail with the SQLite engine
because the value of the enabled extra parameter would be interpreted as a string
instead of a boolean (MySQL and PostgreSQL were fine and handled the data correctly).

Change-Id: I8b76207bf00fd4b84a65ab2935118e918dc39ca5
'}, {'created': '2013-03-14 02:08:16.000000000', 'message': 'Adds db migration testcase 009

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-02 19:03:56.000000000', 'message': 'Being more defensive around the use_ipv6 config option

fixes bug 1175725

Will allow for the flag to be set to filter out ipv6 if
configured but will not add ipv6 to net_info if ipv6 is not
configured in quantum. This will allow spwan to continue
working in the case where ipv6 is not configured but flag
use_ipv6 is set in nova.

Change-Id: I26ebdff81efcdeff827521cec247d2c443a5e0ad
'}, {'created': '2013-05-02 19:48:16.000000000', 'message': 'Being more defensive around the use_ipv6 config option

commit_message:
Being more defensive around the use_ipv6 config option

fixes bug 1175725

Will allow for the flag to be set to filter out ipv6 if
configured but will not add ipv6 to template if ipv6 is not
configured in quantum. This will allow spwan to continue
working in the case where ipv6 is not configured but flag
use_ipv6 is set in nova.

Change-Id: I26ebdff81efcdeff827521cec247d2c443a5e0ad

Fixes: bug #1170529

commit_message:
Adds --addn-hosts to the dnsmasq arg list

When using multi_host=True and update_dns_entries=True DNS entries from other compute hosts were not able to be resolved.  The --addn-hosts arguest was constructed but not appended to the cmd list.

Change-Id: I91067eb09e6cfd27fe32a0d9081b7e69b658eb42
Fixes: bug #1170529

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-01 08:03:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix EC2 instance bdm response

Make the bdm response respect Amazon EC2 spec:
 * use ec2 volume id instead of uuid
 * use volume attach_status instead of status

References:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-ItemType-EbsInstanceBlockDeviceMappingResponseType.html

Resolves bug 1165973.

Change-Id: Ib68397b79f63e01e92ed4bebbc245ba5e0a3ad11
'}]
commit_message:
Fix EC2 instance bdm response

Make the bdm response respect Amazon EC2 spec:
 * use ec2 volume id instead of uuid
 * use volume attach_status instead of status

References:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-ItemType-EbsInstanceBlockDeviceMappingResponseType.html

Resolves bug 1165973.

Change-Id: Ib68397b79f63e01e92ed4bebbc245ba5e0a3ad11

commit_message:
Improve Fedora support for nova element

- on systemd based distros create a .service file for dnsmasq
- check and create the libvirtd group if it doesn't already exist
- handle distro-specific location for the pxelinux.0 file

Change-Id: If24e061701c48df08342642199e765c61dca8a75

commit_message:
Improve Fedora support for boot-stack and openstack-db elements

- distro-specific DNS resolution configuration
- handle distro-specific location for the my.cnf file
- prevent from blindly running the apt-get command

Change-Id: I6f334913dedf5c3678fa8385226ee9c0c256a319

subject: Remove glance-control from the test suite
messages: [{'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-05-03 22:42:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-03 22:29:00.000000000', 'message': 'Remove glance-control from the test suite

This patch removes the use of glance-control from the test suite. Instead
of forking out glance-control and letting it fork out the other programs,
we will now fork out the other programs directly. The file which tested
glance-control has also been removed. While we will still have
glance-control as part of the distribution for a bit and thus it should
still be tested, that test was doing so in a way that depended upon the
forking behavior previously found in the test suite.

This patch also requires the patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26076/ on which it is dependent. As a
side effect it tests for the problem found in bug: 1068051

Additionally, this fixes a race condition. Previously each functional
test called cleanup() in tearDown(). Cleanup would open a pid file and
send a SIGTERM to the processes (api, registry, scrubber). However,
it did not wait for this process to die and get cleaned up. The signal
handler in the processes is over ridden so the death is not instant.
This leaves a chance for server from a previous test to be actively
listening on a port when the next test starts.

fixes bug: 1173415
blueprint: refactoring-better-faster-stronger-functional-tests

Change-Id: Ia4f433c6e536ad2405410070ced308b5aeebd8e1
'}]
commit_message:
Remove glance-control from the test suite

This patch removes the use of glance-control from the test suite. Instead
of forking out glance-control and letting it fork out the other programs,
we will now fork out the other programs directly. The file which tested
glance-control has also been removed. While we will still have
glance-control as part of the distribution for a bit and thus it should
still be tested, that test was doing so in a way that depended upon the
forking behavior previously found in the test suite.

This patch also requires the patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26076/ on which it is dependent. As a
side effect it tests for the problem found in bug: 1068051

Additionally, this fixes a race condition. Previously each functional
test called cleanup() in tearDown(). Cleanup would open a pid file and
send a SIGTERM to the processes (api, registry, scrubber). However,
it did not wait for this process to die and get cleaned up. The signal
handler in the processes is over ridden so the death is not instant.
This leaves a chance for server from a previous test to be actively
listening on a port when the next test starts.

fixes bug: 1173415
blueprint: refactoring-better-faster-stronger-functional-tests

Change-Id: Ia4f433c6e536ad2405410070ced308b5aeebd8e1

configuration.rst file lists all the configuration parameters for ceilometer
configuration. However, for logging, these parameter names should be log_dir
and log_file, but currently it is logdir and logfile.

The table also misses log_config.

There should be a link in configuration.rst file to point a user to the
sample configuration file.

Change-Id: Ic96f303ee7e30faf23c0a6433af5cb5111d35616
fixes: bug #1171905
(cherry picked from commit 09fec9d837e8d2fb5d451c50b2fe3e468e5f8acc)
'}]
commit_message:
Ceilometer configuration.rst file not using right param names for logging

configuration.rst file lists all the configuration parameters for ceilometer
configuration. However, for logging, these parameter names should be log_dir
and log_file, but currently it is logdir and logfile.

The table also misses log_config.

There should be a link in configuration.rst file to point a user to the
sample configuration file.

Change-Id: Ic96f303ee7e30faf23c0a6433af5cb5111d35616
fixes: bug #1171905
(cherry picked from commit 09fec9d837e8d2fb5d451c50b2fe3e468e5f8acc)

commit_message:
Set hbase table_prefix default to None

...table_prefix default value was empty string which fails the connection to hbase thrift server. it should be set to None instead...

Change-Id: I1339c7dad09d311f0a4e3b16d67057e3471e8c5b
Fixes: bug #1173205
(cherry picked from commit 8bcc3773ac0153f69e56508a17abf465d90492a0)

commit_message:
Measurements documentation update

Nova measurements:
- add cpu_util
- del disk.io.requests, disk.io.bytes
- add instance unit to instance:*

+fix some errors on type and unit

for all measurements add new column 'Origin' :
notification|pollster|both

tag : DocImpact
Fixes: bug #1164032

Change-Id: I0046032b8835168772fc7fff6c34a9be99ddbd56
(cherry picked from commit 6f7efd1efedbc4baa7c2263d1536a985f0895fc0)

commit_message:
Fix usage of Query.all() and NoResultFound

SQLAlchemy Query.all() method doesn't raise NoResultFound
exception in case if no result is found but rather returns
an empty list. So this pattern which is common for our code
doesn't make sense and should be fixed:

    try:
        dns_qry = context.session.query(models_v2.DNSNameServer)
        return dns_qry.filter_by(subnet_id=subnet_id).all()
    except exc.NoResultFound:
        return []

Fixes bug 1173131.

Change-Id: I19b64eecd6edac0dba7dd0bf2ab32690c46e4f8b

commit_message:
delete servers in setUpClass if ecxeption raised

this catch the exception in setUpClass of test_images_oneserver
and delete the server. Every exception should be catched
so hasn't specify what kind of exception after except.

fix bug 1158843

Change-Id: I4ea4f6b4bc97a514393c0d0cb6236dcc720fd1a0
(cherry picked from commit bf88a63c8edb08f03a96b91e76eb4630fe4a3426)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-02 21:45:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes 3par driver methods that were double locking

There were many cases where the 3par drivers(FC and iSCSI) were double
locking, e.g. we were locking in the individual driver and in ‘common’.
This patch set removes all the locks in ‘common’ except the one on
‘create_cloned_volume’.

The methods ’_get_volume_state’ and ‘_copy_volume’ are only called in
‘create_cloned_volume’, so those locks were removed as well. All the other
methods in ‘common’ are only called by the driver which provide the lock,
except ‘create_volume’ which is also called by ‘create_cloned_volume’.

Change-Id: I660fbd04824bd2837e06480c8298ea5a709fc82a
Fixes: bug 1175791
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes 3par driver methods that were double locking

There were many cases where the 3par drivers(FC and iSCSI) were double
locking, e.g. we were locking in the individual driver and in ‘common’.
This patch set removes all the locks in ‘common’ except the one on
‘create_cloned_volume’.

The methods ’_get_volume_state’ and ‘_copy_volume’ are only called in
‘create_cloned_volume’, so those locks were removed as well. All the other
methods in ‘common’ are only called by the driver which provide the lock,
except ‘create_volume’ which is also called by ‘create_cloned_volume’.

Change-Id: I660fbd04824bd2837e06480c8298ea5a709fc82a
Fixes: bug 1175791

(2 inline comments)

First, you added dnspython to pip-requires, not test-requires.

Second, why add dnspython at all? I don't see any place where it's used."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-04-27 08:18:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

agreed on using inet_aton you can even have ips being 127.0.0 (parsing IP is one of the craziest brainf** ever).

For dnspython I was thinking the same as well but this is actually used by the module :

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/middleware/cname_lookup.py#L73

I am not sure why we do that :

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/middleware/cname_lookup.py#L35

when simply having it as deps for building the doc should be good enough.'}, {'account_id': 7186, 'date': '2013-04-27 16:25:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Samuel Merritt:

I did add dnspython to tests-requires in patch 3, only to have it rejected by Jenkins. After checking out openstack-requirements I found out that dnspython was a requirement but only registered with pip-requires, which is why I moved it there.
Turns out cname_lookup unit tests were skipped by tox due to the missing dependency before my patch; I don't know if there was a reason for that but I thought it wouldn't cost much to turn them on.
Should I just remove dnspython from the requirements and leave the tests skipped just like before ?"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-04-29 17:38:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Well, here's my opinion on what should happen here.

First, I think that openstack-requirements should be fixed. If you can't declare a test-time dependency in Swift on an existing run-time dependency in other projects, then something in the requirements gate is broken. I'd say that you should either fix it, or if you don't feel up to fixing it, at least file a bug.

Second, please mention the reason for adding dnspython somewhere in the commit message. From my viewpoint, I see a working test suite (because I don't know that cname_lookup's tests are being skipped), some well-tested changes to cname_lookup, and then some new requirement that doesn't get used anywhere else in the diff. Without something in the commit message, I have to assume it was accidentally added.

Finally, once the openstack-requirements bug is fixed, put dnspython in test-requires. Since Swift doesn't need dnspython at runtime, having it in pip-requires is wrong."}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2013-04-29 19:37:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Just adding a comment.  dnspython has always been a requirement *if* you want to use the cname remapping middleware.  Since it was optional and a very small piece, dnspython was never added as an official requirement, and the tests set to skip if it isn't available.  I would be fine leaving it as is, and not making it an official requirement for such a small piece that is likely only used on a small number of installs."}, {'account_id': 7186, 'date': '2013-04-30 08:21:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-30 09:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27428/6/check/gate-swift-requirements/12 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27428/6/check/gate-swift-pep8/2244 : SUCCESS
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/27428/6/check/gate-swift-docs/2072/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27428/6/check/gate-swift-python26/2320 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27428/6/check/gate-swift-python26-rhel6/232 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/27428/6/check/gate-swift-python27/2322 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27428/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/13982 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27428/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/20015 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27428/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/13697 : FAILURE (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/27428/6/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/1820 : FAILURE (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-04-30 16:24:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-04-30 17:36:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I agree with Sam that this should be in a test-requires but not a pip-requires (ie required for testing but not for deploying).

I'm waiting to hear from the CI people to see what the best course of action is (and therefore not merging yet). Beyond that, the patch lgtm."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-04-30 18:44:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Everything I said earlier was based on the assumption that dnspython was only a test-time dependency, so please ignore it.

Seems to me that if a part of Swift depends on dnspython, then we ought to put dnspython in the dependency list. Yeah, it's a small piece of middleware, but it's annoying to get Swift installed, then stumble across some undeclared dependencies while you're setting it up.

It sort of reminds me of the bad old pre-yum days of Red Hat distros; you'd find some RPM that you wanted to install, and then the installer would tell you that dependency X was missing. Then you'd go find X.rpm, but that depends on Y and Z, so go you dig up Y.rpm but it depends on W, so...

I think we should just declare all our dependencies and let dependency resolvers do their work."}, {'account_id': 7186, 'date': '2013-05-02 08:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7186, 'date': '2013-05-02 08:40:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Since dnspython is imported in cname_lookup.py (although the whole middleware is skipped gracefully if the import fails) and following Samuel's comment, I left the dependency in pip_requires but uncommented it."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-05-02 08:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

If we are putting this in test-requires should we uncomment the try: except(ImportError) of the middleware? 

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/middleware/cname_lookup.py#L34'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-02 09:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

commit_message:
Skip cname_lookup when host is an IP address

cname_lookup cannot resolve IP addresses as CNAME records, and therefore
should not attempt to resolve the host in that case. The middleware is
skipped when the host is an IP address.

Change-Id: I6961ec205e771116ace1ebcb8c088f3116eb38f0
Fixes: bug #1172289

commit_message:
Fix LHN driver to allow backend name configuration

The LHN driver wasn't allowing custom volume_backend_name to be set
via multi-backend configuration input.  In addition there were some
issues with the updating that are also addressed in this patch.

There are other drivers that are going to need updated/fixed for
this same problem, but those will be addressed in a separate patch/bug.

Fixes bug: 1173037

Change-Id: Iae247a500739d02e145511ebe96dddaff8966419

commit_message:
Remove old_name from kwargs when using IET helper.

The IET driver passes the input kwargs from export
directly to the IET driver, but one of the keys here
is specifically for migration and a bug associated with
going from nova-vol to cinder-uuid's.

This patch just checks in the IET code if we have the key set
and if so pops it out before passing through to iet.

Fixes bug: 1175207

Change-Id: I965bdfbe078d61b906aebc48961c1806a9fb0c59

commit_message:
Check that volume is at least minDisk size.

The Image service (such as Glance) provides a minDisk parameter to
indicate the minimum required disk size for the image. This change
ensures that the guidance is followed in the case of bootable
volumes.

Added unit test and fixed PEP8 issue.

Fixed issue with docstring.

Added a comment.

Fixes Bug #1175532

Change-Id: I505af53db70b5b286dbca2eaca4fc1f30a8c0b2a

commit_message:
Adds --addn-hosts to the dnsmasq arg list

When using multi_host=True and update_dns_entries=True, dns records from
other compute hosts were not able to be resolved.  The --addn-host arg was
constructed but not appended to the cmd list.

Change-Id: I9cafb59256e92bdad0df3e9166e0afd079ae0c09
Fixes: bug #1170529

commit_message:
Add linuxbridge plugin support

* Add quantum_plugin_linuxbridge custom type
  Custom type used to configure linuxbridge plugin
  in linuxbridge_conf.ini

* Add quantum::agents::linuxbridge class
  Setups linuxbridge quantum agent.

* Add quantum::plugins::linuxbridge class
  Setups linuxbridge plugin for quantum server.

Change-Id: I864745d6b5acd8203cf32c371fc2967e3566ae6c

commit_message:
heat tests : separate Autoscaling and CW alarm tests

Currently the AutoScaling test also tests the CloudWatch Alarm
resource, so separate out the CW Alarm test to simplify things

commit_message:
heat tests : convert most tests to inline templates

Convert to inline minimal templates, to remove dependency on
in-tree templates which we plan to remove.  Note there are still
some more tests remaining which need similar changes (shardy todo)

Change-Id: I0864d1f15ea3b815d449277387440157f104bbf3

commit_message:
nova coverage creates lots of empty folders

With nova coverage extension disabled as a default behaviour,
nova will create lots of empty folders under /tmp folder. And also
with each time the nova service reboot, it will create a new
directory with name like nova_coverage_*. There will be number of
the empty folders accumulated.

Patch-Set 3: Rebase for merging code
Fixes: bug 1169005

Change-Id: I26d1037eb66d781ac6ef6b600cca04a709bff3f7

Update our import of oslo's processutils.

I've just synced nova's processutils back to oslo and this is now
the sync back in the other direction.

Change-Id: I8389bdd85ed3dacbb02aec043dfd0f84ef07b18b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-03 15:13:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error reporting in @stack_delete_after unit tests

If a unit test decorated with @stack_delete_after (to ensure that a stack
being tested is cleaned up) fails in such a way that the stack cannot be
cleaned up, the original error was suppressed, making debugging very
difficult. In this case, we should re-raise the original exception.

Change-Id: I2b0c326f819cd8a6bc772fe52deb14fb1c41bf93
'}, {'created': '2013-05-03 15:36:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix error reporting in @stack_delete_after unit tests

If a unit test decorated with @stack_delete_after (to ensure that a stack
being tested is cleaned up) fails in such a way that the stack cannot be
cleaned up, the original error was suppressed, making debugging very
difficult. In this case, we should re-raise the original exception.

Change-Id: I2b0c326f819cd8a6bc772fe52deb14fb1c41bf93
'}]
commit_message:
Fix error reporting in @stack_delete_after unit tests

If a unit test decorated with @stack_delete_after (to ensure that a stack
being tested is cleaned up) fails in such a way that the stack cannot be
cleaned up, the original error was suppressed, making debugging very
difficult. In this case, we should re-raise the original exception.

Change-Id: I2b0c326f819cd8a6bc772fe52deb14fb1c41bf93

commit_message:
Set Stack id to None when deleted

If a Stack object has been removed from the database, we should reset its
ID to None so that if the object is used further, it will not be assumed
that it is represented in the database.

Change-Id: Iaa7e9327324f101487847362973bd7f8386ce44b

commit_message:
Remove race condition (in FloatingIps)

Soft delete all duplicate rows with the same address except one with
the biggest value in `id` column.

Create UC on columns (address, deleted)

Fix floating_ip_create
  Replace Select then Insert -> Try to Insert.

Fix floating_ip_bulk_create
  Replace get all and locally compare -> Try to Insert

Fix floating_ip_update
  If we update floating_ip with existing address, raise
  rollback and raise FloatingIpExists

Add missing test for floating_ip_update to duplicate

Fixes bug 1145216

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: Idd0c8305ca348700235f757a29fc7998edca576b

commit_message:
Add missing tests for db.floating_ip_* methods

There was no tests in test_db_api for db.floating_ip_*
methods.

Add tests to ensure that all works.

Remove tests for db.flating_ip_* from DbApiTestCase.

Change return value of db.floating_ip_create()
This method is used only for tests. To simplify testing we
should return floating_ip_ref (all columns) instead of address.

blueprint db-api-tests

Change-Id: I37ee93c1d054ad736aa02a43be867f809448b172

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-26 18:09:10.000000000', 'message': 'Fix key error when create lpar instance failed

In function spawn in file nova/nova/virt/powervm/operator.py:
try:
    host_stats = self.get_host_stats(refresh=True)
    lpar_inst = self._create_lpar_instance(instance,
                network_info, host_stats)
    #TODO(mjfork) capture the error and handle the error when the
    # MAC prefix already exists on the system (1 in 2^28)
    self._operator.create_lpar(lpar_inst)
    LOG.debug(_("Creating LPAR instance '%s'") % instance['name'])
except nova_exception.ProcessExecutionError:
    LOG.exception(_("LPAR instance '%s' creation failed") %
               instance['name'])
    raise exception.PowerVMLPARCreationFailed()
=============================================================

With the existing code above, when create lpar instance
failed, it throws a key error because the parameter
is not being passed to PowerVMLPARCreationFailed(exception.NovaException)
function in exception module

The fix for this is simply passing the 'instance_name' to the called function.

Change-Id: I688eecf7b649b67ca62f72d6d33fd7cd774047c3

commit_message:
Fix key error when create lpar instance failed

With existing code, when create lpar instance
failed, it throws a key error because the parameter
is not being passed to PowerVMLPARCreationFailed
function in exception module.

The fix for this is that in module operator, passing
the 'instance_name' to the called function in exception
module.

Fixes bug 1173303
Change-Id: I688eecf7b649b67ca62f72d6d33fd7cd774047c3

commit_message:
Cut over to grizzly -> havana

* change BASE_RELEASE and TARGET_RELEASE in grenaderc
* remove work-arounds from devstack.localrc.target
* remove upgrade steps from the upgrade-* scripts
* change references to release names in variables to BASE_ and TARGET_
* remove Javelin check from check-sanity, will return in verify-javelin
  in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26257/

Fixes bug 1175340

Change-Id: If1523c73ebefeaf3d3e3efdfbc053f47365d123a

commit_message:
Lock down test dependencies on nova & glance tarballs

Use the grizzly final versions of the nova & glance tarballs
to avoid issues with testing ceilometer stable/grizzly against
the havana master tarballs.

Change-Id: I6829fba1cd426d8998e95e38518b95bfc80e6360

'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-05-03 10:31:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I like the idea, but I am opposed with the fact that we try to delete right after the build attempt. What if I wanted to see what's happened for debugging purposes? Wouldn't be a better approach to delete instances at the beginning of the test(s)? False negatives such as failures in quota tests can be prevented if quota tests were made more robusts. For instance they can assert certain preconditions (i.e. no VM's running, and delete if they are) before they execute."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-05-03 10:50:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Do not merge

(2 inline comments)

Adding more cleanup is a fine goal, but it needs to be done systematically, by getting us away from needing teardown and using addCleanup instead. Just throwing it in here is going to cause more problems than it solves.

If you are interested in working on the largely problem let me know, we can layout the blueprint for what would be needed there.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-05-03 14:11:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Just found out that what I wanted fixed is already fixed in havana under bug 1158843. We need this for grizzly testing so I'm just going to cherry pick it into stable/grizzly."}]

commit_message:
Clean up instances which fail to build

This commit attempts to clean up an instance which fails to build so it
is not left in the database and potentially cause false negatives for other
test cases, e.g. quota tests.

Fixes bug 1175851

Change-Id: I81155c532858f0c458179be2c3ba77c252e3a3a2

The return code is documented as 200 in https://github.com/openstack/identity-api/blob/master/openstack-identity-api/src/markdown/identity-api-v3.md'}, {'account_id': 2238, 'date': '2013-02-14 14:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 2238, 'date': '2013-02-14 14:45:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-02-14 15:01:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I don't see how this is using the v3 API spec:

https://github.com/openstack/identity-api/blob/master/openstack-identity-api/src/markdown/identity-api-v3.md

See inline comments. I still see use of the term "tenant" which has been replaced with "project". I still see use of camelCases keys, which are now all consistently underscore_separated. Are you sure you are executing these tests against a real V3 API?

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-14 15:11:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see http://wiki.openstack.org/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-02-20 15:18:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't see any obvious errors but this code still does not run. We should not be submitting code into a gating context unless it is actually being run. My concern is that when some one enables v3 in devstack, tests that are not running all the time may break. What is needed to make v3 available so these tests can run?"}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-02-20 16:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

According to dolphm, v3 auth is going to be merged very soon. But what is the plan for testing both v2 and v3? Right now there is a single global config variable. We need a way to run tests with different Manager objects based on different auth_urls, right?'}, {'account_id': 2238, 'date': '2013-02-21 06:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Yes David you are absolutely right. Even I had this thought of configuring manager so as to run tests against v2/v3 based on the auth_url in tempest.conf. But as v3 is still in progress we thought of keeping these tests ready before v3 is merged.

Also I have run these tests against V3 by changing url to point to V3 only for these tests (As V3 is implemented for the functionality in this testscript though not completely). Hence I think we need not worry about errors this script may produce once v3 is merged.

Please correct me if I am wrong.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-02-21 15:27:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

It's not a matter of being wrong but of being more complicated. If you want to push this test in, for now you should change it to always skip, and not start being a gate as soon as the v3 api exists. The larger issue is that we can't just change the auth_uri in the config to v3 because then tempest will stop testing the v2 api. We could set up another gating job to test v3 but that is not really scalable. I am not sure if the current architecture supports an alternative."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-02-21 19:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

There was a discussion about this at the QA meeting. The consensus was that we should test both v2 and v3. The conf file auth_url should not have /v2 or /v3 but the code should get the v2 and v3 API root endpoints from the returned 301. Then the appropriate client can add the v2 or v3.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-02-21 19:09:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

See http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/qa/2013/qa.2013-02-21-17.02.log.html for details.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-01 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-01 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Abandoned

[{'created': '2013-01-29 14:26:09.000000000', 'message': "Added 2 user related testcases for Keystone V3API

This submission adds two test cases namely 'test_user_update' and
'test_list_user_projects' in script test_users.py. The suporting
methods are added to identity_client.py for JSON and XML calls.
In order to call V3 API, the base url is replace with V3 instead
of V2.0 while these calls are made.
Also a method called 'patch' is added to rest_client.py for the sake of V3
which is equivalent to 'put' call in V2.0.

commit_message:
Added 2 user related testcases for Keystone V3API

This submission adds two test cases namely 'test_user_update' and
'test_list_user_projects' in script test_users.py. The suporting
methods are added to identity_client.py for JSON and XML calls.

Change-Id: I0a66b0c40bc275f4c0da3f57ea9c9d33cdeea455
Implements: blueprint keystone-v3-users-api-test

[{'created': '2013-05-02 11:13:46.000000000', 'message': "Fixes a bug in test_register_get_deregister_ami_image

The test fails with following error
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'state' referenced before assignment
fix: variable state is no longer required.
Change-Id: Ifec9a813ea9e24eb07476883c55e6d19c083ac6e

commit_message:
Fixes a bug in test_register_get_deregister_ami_image

The test fails with following error
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'state' referenced before assignment
fix: variable state is no longer required.
Change-Id: Ifec9a813ea9e24eb07476883c55e6d19c083ac6e

commit_message:
Only map nicira_nvp_plugin module if installed

When starting any quantum plugin agent service, only map the
nicira_nvp_plugin module if nicira is installed and configured for
quantum.

fixes bug 1175750

Change-Id: I7f2c40011363e2579d4c35716f5a7d413663a698

i hadn't considered pagination of meter links. i could place meter links as a sub list of links... that said i'm not sure how handle pagination of sublists. to paginate the resources as well as it's meter links, that query/url could get quite long if we use something similar to nova: http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-compute/2/content/Paginated_Collections-d1e664.html"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-05-01 15:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: (1 inline comment)

I think it is safe to assume we do not need to paginate the list of links on a given resource.

See comment inline"}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-04-22 16:23:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-04-22 16:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-22 17:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27152/2/check/gate-swift-pep8/2168 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/27152/2/check/gate-swift-python27/2246 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27152/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/13178 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/27152/2/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/1069 : FAILURE (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-04-22 19:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-04-23 10:59:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

(Failed to press review)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-04-26 02:45:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I think the explicit zero with no body test is fine.

But the other one is bad, it should not be merged.

If I tell you I'm going to send 0 bytes, and then put 5 on the wire - the server would never read them.  Or they would think I'm starting a new pipelined request...

e.g.
http://paste.openstack.org/show/36619/

I think the unittest just works like that because it's mocking the network reads with a generalized iterable.

Perhaps a functional test would be more reasonable, or if we don't already have a unit test for it - maybe more interesting would be a real disconnect where the client says he'll send 6 bytes and then hangs up after sending 5.  (I actually think we may need better upload timeout there, can't trust those stinking proxies...)"}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-05-02 02:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is morphing a bit into a fix for content-length and transfer-encoding header interactions. Basically, according to  rfc2616, sec. 4.4 Message Length, if transfer-encoding header is present, then content-length is ignored. We are not doing that today.

So a bad client can include content-length:0 with transfer-encoding:chunked, which will cause us to respond with 499.

Weird case, but there it is ...'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-05-03 11:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I actually have seen that with some weird content inspection proxies.'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-05-03 11:02:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

oops just seen that sam did a +2 already, approving.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-03 11:02:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-03 11:47:19.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-03 11:47:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/27152/2/gate/gate-swift-docs/2111/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 00:00:58
- http://logs.openstack.org/27152/2/gate/gate-swift-pep8/2283 : SUCCESS in 00:00:36

@Clint perhaps we should land this as a temporary step? Is it itself harmful, or just showing up the issues with sudo -E ?'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-05-03 10:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-05-03 10:27:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm happy to be overridden if we think having this fixed is more important than the refactor to not need sudo -E."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-05-03 10:27:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I feel like this is only half the battle and the other half would be pretty simple. Rather than depending on sudo -E's behavior and the problems it brings, perhaps we should explicitly pass in all of the variables we want. I don't think putting them all on the cmdline is the right way though, but instead we should write them to a file that we source in the shell we are executing with sudo."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-05-03 10:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-03 10:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

It's close. Thanks for this. One small nit to fix."}, {'account_id': 6449, 'date': '2013-05-03 10:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Improve Fedora build host support.

Sudo command (even using -E) resets $PATH for security reasons, Fedora
and other distos might have to explicitly add /usr/local/bin to $PATH
in order to run the commands in the chroot environment.

Change-Id: I95068ecf1e7437152e11c6d6789f59bcfd6ae9cc

commit_message:
heat api: ec2token remove unnecessary jsonutils retry

Remove the try/catch around jsonutils dumps, since this is
handled internally by jsonutils via the dumps default parameter

Change-Id: I66c63b441f61cde506ef40e3eace60c3c41e90ca

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent --debug messages on image-update

image-update --debug message no longer adds '-d "None"' to the curl command that
is output. This keeps the curl output consistent with the client
request.

Fixes bug #1172702

Change-Id: I34ceeb6f4a67c753ca3a805ec11240a99ce38ec4

'}]
commit_message:
Use testtools for better Python 2.6 compatibility

Testsuite uses assertDictEqual and a few others
which do not exist for Python 2.6. Use testtools
for those instead, which works the same for
all Python versions.

Change-Id: I7c6cba7c032a721f2ade0055066b9ddfac6a35c9

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 1828, 'date': '2013-04-08 10:15:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored'}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2013-04-22 18:45:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-04-28 00:25:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Hi John,

Thanks for noticing and looking into this issue. Sorry it has taken so long to get around to looking at your patch.

I've been trying out this patch against swift running on devstack, and I can't quite get it to work. There might be some conflicts with recent functional tests changes for how servers select their ports. But I was able to find a few things that, when fixed, got me further along in the process before failure.

Have a look at my notes, maybe try them out in your testing, and let's regroup to figure out what we can do to get this test working again!

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-04-29 08:44:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Note for future discussions:

Why does Glance needs swift for testing copy_from ?

I'd rather use plain HTTP as default tests and move this to the store test_suite. It doesn't feel right to depend on "external services" to test a specific functionality.

If we agree, this can be added as part of the functional tests re-factor blueprint.

Also, is there a way we can make tempest test this stuff? /me will ask in #openstack-infra

Sorry for the sort of Off-Topic.'}, {'account_id': 1828, 'date': '2013-04-29 13:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1828, 'date': '2013-04-29 14:00:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Mark,
I made the changes you suggested after rebasing to master today. The test is working for me with the latest patch set. 

I didn't use devstack when testing so perhaps there are some differences between that environment and what I tested.

commit_message:
Fix functional test 'test_copy_from_swift'

This test fails if a real swift system is specified in a config file
and passed to the tests via the GLANCE_TEST_SWIFT_CONF environment
variable. The fix is to quote the creds in the uri and also to
fix get_swift_uri() to handle uris of the form '@https://'.

Fixes bug 1158404

Change-Id: Ic091f77a83696e6413aea047e805ac11487aba39

commit_message:
Sometimes use quantum for SecurityGroup

This implements the following properties in AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup
- VpcId
- SecurityGroupEgress

If VpcId is specified, completely separate code paths
are used which make quantum calls instead of nova calls.

This implements blueprint quantum-security-group

This is based off https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22280/
with a few enhancements:
- Quantum firewall rules translated to acceptable format for ICMP
- remote_ip_prefix used for security group rule creation

Change-Id: I8f1953cb559da0e97821ae0072dfb01dc8267c0c
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

Minor nit in the comments.

I'm surprised by comstud's comments as I'm sure you can pass in options via --scheduler_hints (that's how the group option is passed into the filter_scheduler for example, as well as various filter options).  The "special" syntax on --availability_zone is only used AFAIK because it was an existing Rackspace hack.

However I think its more logical in this case to expand that then to introduce a new option.

az:host:node would seem more logical than az:host node to me for the syntax, but I'm not going to die over it'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-05-01 20:25:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add force_nodes to filter properties

Add support for "force_nodes" to filter properties, following the example
of force_hosts. In doing so, fix an issue where the presence of either
force_hosts or ignore_hosts would have squashed a host with multiple nodes.

A node can be passed in via the --availability_zone
option, separated from the hostname with a colon. Eg,
  nova boot --availability_zone=zone:host:node
Note that "host" is optional here, and "zone::node" also works.

DocImpact

Implements bp baremetal-force-node

Change-Id: Icfee63c80eb355c29594f8badde4183496b395ac

commit_message:
Deprecate show_host_resources() in scheduler manager

This method does not at all belong in the scheduler. Its only use is
from being remotely called by nova-manage to whom it returns data
fetched from the db. I think nova-manage is better of fetching this
data on its own instead of making this extra round trip to the
scheduler.

Change-Id: I435300cdd15bdd041cbe5718ae064b98cec4cceb

commit_message:
Add test coverage for sqlite regexp function

Add some tests which for the regexp function which we install for
sqlite.

Need test coverage to catch e.g. a regression of the fix for
bug #1031846.

Change-Id: I4bd77d0d93c4fc85588e6e6d5a559e68133dbf73

logging_context_format_string = %(asctime)s.%(msecs)03d %(levelname)s %(name)s [%(request_id)s %(user_name)s %(project_name)s] %(instance)s%(message)s


I just took this patch and put it into a running copy of nova (about a week old) in devstack and restarted nova-api and looked at the output'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-04-18 00:24:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

Joe, set log_formatter=nova.openstack.common.log.LegacyFormatter and things should work.  The context log line isn't used in the default logger, and I'm hesitant to make LegacyFormatter the default for the reason listed in my inline comment."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-04-18 16:23:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Andrew,  by requiring me to set a new flag we are breaking the default logging behavior (and using something almost useless instead).  I would like to see the previous default log behavior return without having to set an additional flags."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-04-20 00:49:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Joe, 

This is change is in oslo-incubator. We need to follow up this change with changing the nova.conf to set the logging_formatter to LegacyFormatter to get what you need. 

We need to do the pluggability stuff in oslo and fix nova.conf to get what you need. So can you please reconsider the -1? 

thanks,
dims'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-04-20 21:51:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Joe, I agree with dims.  I don't think it makes sense to go back to a Nova specific formatter, which LegacyFormatter almost is.  But I do agree that a context and exception aware formatter could make sense as a default.  I will try to put something together that will work as a sane default in oslo and will only require a slight override in Nova.

I say LegacyFormatter is Nova specific because it has logic for instances in the message.  While it shouldn't affect another project like Glance or Cinder if they use it, it also doesn't help them in any way.  I'd like for each project to work similarly to Nova without embedding that all in oslo."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-04-20 21:53:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Work In Progress

Going to try to make a context and exception aware formatter the default while allowing projects to override specific keys that could be optional in a message.  Like legacyformatter does with instance.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-04-25 22:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: No score

Andrew, sounds like a plan!'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-04-30 22:17:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-04-30 22:19:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I've been pulled in a lot of directions recently, so this is lagging, but here's my latest attempt.

I'd like to deprecate/remove log_format and have log formats be customizable through the options on ContextFormatter(formerly LegacyFormatter).  And set things up to move customization within the projects themselves if they'd like to, for things like optional params in formats.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-30 22:20:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-04-11 20:12:36.000000000', 'message': "Allow overriding the formatter used for logging

Adds a new config option 'logging_formatter' which allows overriding the
formatter added to all logging handlers.  By default a DefaultFormatter
will be used which pulls its format from CONF.log_format.  This avoids
the current behaviour of needing to explicitly set log_format='' in
order to use the LegacyFormatter.  And it opens the way for projects
using this module to specify their own formatters.

Bug 1167388

will be used which pulls its format from CONF.log_format.  This avoids
the current behaviour of needing to explicitly set log_format='' in

Change-Id: I281ed7fe3448403f27a4cd318fc21915027906cc
"}, {'created': '2013-04-30 22:17:28.000000000', 'message': "Allow overriding the formatter used for logging

This patch attempts to reconcile two currently incompatible ways of
configuring log formatting.  Because log_format had a default set it was
always used in favor of the context aware formatter.  In order to
deprecate the option it now defaults to None so it is overridable, but
it should be removed at some point.

Adds a new config option 'logging_formatter' which allows overriding the
formatter added to all logging handlers.  By default a ContextFormatter
will be used which pulls its format from current logging options.  This
method of choosing a formatter should allow each project to customize
it to suit their needs with minimal duplication.

Bug 1167388

Change-Id: I281ed7fe3448403f27a4cd318fc21915027906cc
"}, {'created': '2013-04-30 22:27:27.000000000', 'message': "Allow overriding the formatter used for logging

This patch attempts to reconcile two currently incompatible ways of
configuring log formatting.  Because log_format had a default set it was
always used in favor of the context aware formatter.  In order to
deprecate the option it now defaults to None so it is overridable, but
it should be removed at some point.

Adds a new config option 'logging_formatter' which allows overriding the
formatter added to all logging handlers.  By default a ContextFormatter
will be used which pulls its format from current logging options.  This
method of choosing a formatter should allow each project to customize
it to suit their needs with minimal duplication.

Bug 1167388

Change-Id: I281ed7fe3448403f27a4cd318fc21915027906cc
"}, {'created': '2013-05-01 18:39:53.000000000', 'message': "Deprecate log_format and change default to None

Commit 3e71cc4c8c7e08784f44c2e337a585e562b93ec5 fixed an issue with
ignoring log_format, but changed the default logging formatter.  This
led to being unable to use the former context aware formatter without
configuring log_format='' explicitly.

This change sets log_format to None so that the default is a context
aware formatter, but setting log_format works as intended.

Additionally, since log_format is mutually exclusive with some of the
other config formatting options, such as logging_default_format_string,
it should be deprecated.

Bug 1167388

Change-Id: I281ed7fe3448403f27a4cd318fc21915027906cc
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate log_format and change default to None

Commit 3e71cc4c8c7e08784f44c2e337a585e562b93ec5 fixed an issue with
ignoring log_format, but changed the default logging formatter.  This
led to being unable to use the former context aware formatter without
configuring log_format='' explicitly.

This change sets log_format to None so that the default is a context
aware formatter, but setting log_format works as intended.

Additionally, since log_format is mutually exclusive with some of the
other config formatting options, such as logging_default_format_string,
it should be deprecated.

Bug 1167388

Change-Id: I281ed7fe3448403f27a4cd318fc21915027906cc

commit_message:
Update processutils.

This is another example of something which was imported from nova
but where nova was never moved across to use the oslo version. The
code has since diverged. This review syncs up the two versions,
and will be followed by a nova review to move nova across to the
oslo implementation.

Unit test coverage for this new version is 83%. I want to improve
that, but I'll do it in a later review.

I will also need to update cinder, quantum and nova to this new
version of the code once this merges. I will do moniker as well
because I am a nice guy.

Change-Id: Ie0731c56c9aab547b5d5b905bf4ed8eff3eae3bd

* Add basic rspec tests
* Add required fixtures: mysql, vswitch.
* Fix relationship between Package['dnsmasq'] and
  Package['quantum-dhcp-agent']. RedHat does not have such package and
  catalog compilation would fail on RedHat platforms.
* Restore Ruby 1.8 compatibility by removing trailing comma
  on the final element of hash.

Change-Id: I7cfc2f9b308116fe9c8b7f242f794792be0be678
"}]
commit_message:
Add basic rspec tests to ensure catalog compiles

* Add basic rspec tests
* Add required fixtures: mysql, vswitch.
* Fix relationship between Package['dnsmasq'] and
  Package['quantum-dhcp-agent']. RedHat does not have such package and
  catalog compilation would fail on RedHat platforms.
* Restore Ruby 1.8 compatibility by removing trailing comma
  on the final element of hash.

Change-Id: I7cfc2f9b308116fe9c8b7f242f794792be0be678

subject: rpc: allow to cast to other any control exchange
messages:
[{'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-04-23 15:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is a reasonable request / addition, but this change will break the zeromq driver, if only because this patch fails to patch impl_zmq. Patching the zeromq driver won't be incredibly difficult, but I'm not sure we're going about this the right way.

This patch should really be merged with the request/desire to create a destination as a replacement for the topic mangling and the _to_server() methods.  Then, we'd use "get_queue_for()" or its effective replacement, possibly passing in a control_exchange.  This is something we discussed in the RPC API discussion at the summit, and something I've been discussing with Doug Hellman.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-23 15:41:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27351/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/1475 : SUCCESS
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/27351/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/1250/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27351/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pyflakes/1101 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27351/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/1434 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27351/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26-rhel6/123 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/27351/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/1435 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-04-23 16:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The API redesign is going to take a while. Perhaps we should allow this change, with the ZMQ patch, until we can get the broader changes going?'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-04-24 11:22:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Eric,

Raah, you got me and once again spotted the Ceilometer team attempt to sink the ZMQ driver! ;-)

I'd be happy to patch the ZMQ driver to add support for something like that, however, but I didn't really spot where/what I was supposed to change in its driver, so I'd appreciate any hint!"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-04-24 13:23:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You'd add the new kwarg to _multi_send. Unfortunately, the zeromq driver has no present knowledge of control exchanges, as they're known to AMQP, so this would probably be a noop unless someone adds deeper control exchange awareness.

To support control exchanges as a namespace separator, this method would pass something to the matchmaker via _get_matchmaker().queues() and would also pass something to _call() and _cast(), likely changing the zeromq wire protocol in the process... requiring a version bump from impl_zmq_v2 to impl_zmq_v3 (line 231) ?  Unfortunately, changing the message format would be something that could only be done on a rolling upgrade - messages with a control_exchange specified would only be understood in the India release. Ultimately, doing this we'll gain very little.

Again, I'm hesitant to do something that will dictate a wire protocol bump if we're already talking about changing how message destinations are determined and passed into the drivers.

Finally, I caution that the whole idea of supporting control_exchange in the abstraction is really leaky. This is an AMQP-ism. We *do* have a concept of this with ZeroMQ that I'd (un)happily leak into the abstraction as well - we call it a TCP port number. If I suggested we add that to call/cast/notify, there would be riots. However, doing that would be surest and easiest way to get this functionality, it would also be a perfect functional analog - because presently, Ceilometer wouldn't be able to send messages to services listening on different ports (and in another thread we're talking about how necessary this really is, in real deployments)

We can't easily map the TCP port number to the string values of our amqp control exchanges, unfortunately... or this would be both a lot better and a lot easier."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-04-24 13:54:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

What's the use case for cross project rpc calls?  I have always considered rpc private for a given project."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-04-24 21:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

discussion moved here: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-April/007827.html'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-04-25 15:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-03 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-03 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-23 15:31:52.000000000', 'message': 'rpc: allow to cast to other any control exchange

If we want to do cross-projects RPC calls, we need to be able to publish to
topic that are placed on a different control exchange. This patch does
exactly that.

Change-Id: I0bcb0d978531f49e07cebeb8a8482d3aa1988bd6
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
'}]
commit_message:
rpc: allow to cast to other any control exchange

If we want to do cross-projects RPC calls, we need to be able to publish to
topic that are placed on a different control exchange. This patch does
exactly that.

Change-Id: I0bcb0d978531f49e07cebeb8a8482d3aa1988bd6
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

Resources were not initialized, so all tests would fail. Calls the same

'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_validate to run by itself

Resources were not initialized, so all tests would fail. Calls the same
method which is called internally to load all plugins.

Change-Id: I696f1d40499bb9a3ca6fde5d08101e9ddabc4369

Well... I wrote that once, but took it out cause it was just one more thing.

It always drives me nuts when like for example - cron - doesn't run a file in /etc/crontab cause it has a dot in the name or some weird esoteric restriction I didn't know about.  I hadn't thought about the editor swap files tho, so maybe at least omitting files that start with a '.'?  I'll probably code that up just clear the -1 and see what you come back with :P

Personally, I think it'd be confusing to have files in the config directory that aren't ment to be part of the configuration, more so to have files you put in the config directory not be parsed as part of your configuration!  I sorta expect most of the time they'll be symlinks anyway.  I'm happy to make the change if you feel assured it's the right thing to do - I'm certainly waffling."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-03-26 20:14:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-03-26 20:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-03-26 20:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Here's what I did:

 * created a directory /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf.d
 * split my proxy-server.conf into 3 parts, and then stuck them into the conf.d as 1.conf, 2.conf, and 3.conf
 * ran "swift-init main start"

Output is here: http://paste.openstack.org/show/35165/

Looks like it tried to start up 3 proxies for some reason. Hm, with the split proxy setup as before, I now have a file `/var/run/swift/proxy-server.pid.d`. Is that intentional? I mean, it does indicate which config is being used...'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-04-03 00:25:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Yes?  No?

If it's a directory you may need to remove it, that's probably an artifact of the earlier bug where I was finding too many proxy conf's

If it's just a file, yup, that's the pid for your server.

The naming might not have been what I would have come up with if I was rewriting swift-init from scratch with conf.d support in mind, but that's what fit in the existing code with the least work.  It's probably suboptimal, but really all of that "translate a conf filepath to a pid filepath and back again" is totally made up crap anyway.

I didn't mention that particular wart in the commit message or anything... but only cause i figured most of the time no-one would care?  maybe it deserves some more thought?  how bad do you think it is?'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-04-03 00:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-03 00:36:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Doesn't seem to work
