revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-26 01:12:45.000000000', 'message': "conf.d support

Allow Swift daemons and servers to optionally accept a directory as the
configuration parameter.  Directory based configuration leverages
ConfigParser's native multi-file support.  All files in the given directory
are parsed in lexicographical order.  A mixture of file and directory
configuration paths is not supported - if the configuration path is a file
behavior is unchanged.

 * update swift-init to search for conf.d paths when building servers
    (e.g. /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf.d/)
 * new script swift-config can be used to inspect the cumulative configuration
 * pull a little bit of code out of run_wsgi and test separately
 * fix example config bug for the proxy servers client_disconnect option

Implements: blueprint confd
Change-Id: I89b0f48e538117f28590cf6698401f74ef58003b
"}, {'created': '2013-03-26 01:19:09.000000000', 'message': "conf.d support

are parsed in lexicographical order.  A mixture of file and directory

behavior is unchanged.

 * update swift-init to search for conf.d paths when building servers
    (e.g. /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf.d/)

commit_message:
conf.d support

Allow Swift daemons and servers to optionally accept a directory as the
configuration parameter.  Directory based configuration leverages
ConfigParser's native multi-file support.  Files ending in '.conf' in the
given directory are parsed in lexicographical order.  Filenames starting with
'.' are ignored.  A mixture of file and directory configuration paths is not
supported - if the configuration path is a file behavior is unchanged.

 * update swift-init to search for conf.d paths when building servers
    (e.g. /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf.d/)
 * new script swift-config can be used to inspect the cumulative configuration
 * pull a little bit of code out of run_wsgi and test separately
 * fix example config bug for the proxy servers client_disconnect option
 * added section on directory based configuration to deployment guide

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint confd
Change-Id: I89b0f48e538117f28590cf6698401f74ef58003b

Do not attempt to kill already-dead dnsmasq

Fixes bug 1080846

The fix is following comments by Thiery Carrez (ttx) on the bug.

Change-Id: If4f6baad4212c23845c46703140e15f1ffcfe558

commit_message:
Set defaultbranch in .gitreview to stable/grizzly

This allows people run git-review without any arguments.

commit_message:
Set messages ttl to claims ttl

Make sure messages being updated have the same ttl as claim. This update
happens when claimed messages have a ttl lower than claim's.

Implements blueprint storage-mongodb

Change-Id: Ide529895760fd6e1b207611729e1da5e250cbafb

commit_message:
Split the module lines in openstack-common.conf

update.py was changed to support this format recently. It makes it
much easier to review changes to the list of modules.

Change-Id: I0f86f65e107ab54231bd48182947d5799e8a460f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-02 20:37:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fix architecture filter.

If we are using uname to collect the name of the architecture, we need
to filter its output to make it consistent with dpkg. This is now
happening in the right place to avoid a spurious warning on i386 builds.

Change-Id: Iae80dbfb757fc068155730686841c742acb7a6a2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix architecture filter.

If we are using uname to collect the name of the architecture, we need
to filter its output to make it consistent with dpkg. This is now
happening in the right place to avoid a spurious warning on i386 builds.

Change-Id: Iae80dbfb757fc068155730686841c742acb7a6a2

commit_message:
Replace deprecated :rubygems source

Fix deprecation warnings thrown by bundler:

  The source :rubygems is deprecated because HTTP requests are insecure.
  Please change your source to 'https://rubygems.org' if possible,
  or 'http://rubygems.org' if not.

Fixes: bug #1175767
Change-Id: I75e2f79fecac49e7e0d9a94e604368489214b7c9

subject: Fix up the conflict between audit and glibc packages.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-02 19:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27487/1/check/gate-diskimage-builder-pep8/370 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27487/1/check/gate-diskimage-builder-python26/363 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27487/1/check/gate-diskimage-builder-python26-rhel6/123 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/27487/1/check/gate-diskimage-builder-python27/364 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 6449, 'date': '2013-05-02 19:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm curious why this isn't covered by the full package upgrade that the "base" element runs from install.d/99-up-to-date.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-05-02 19:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The problem is in the order. The base/install.d/99-up-to-date will run at the end of the install.d process and if one elment triggers the update of the glibc before the audit update the process will fail with a:

Transaction Check Error:
  file /usr/lib64/audit from install of glibc-2.16-30.fc18.x86_64 conflicts with file from package audit-2.2.2-2.fc18.x86_64

E.g Building a Fedora 18 image with the keystone element will fail because the keystone/install.d/05-keystone will call os-svc-install that will install libc6-dev and trigger the update of the glibc.

Another fix would be changing would be making the full package update run earlier. What you think would be the best?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-02 19:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27487/2/check/gate-diskimage-builder-pep8/373 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27487/2/check/gate-diskimage-builder-python26/366 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27487/2/check/gate-diskimage-builder-python26-rhel6/126 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/27487/2/check/gate-diskimage-builder-python27/367 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-02 19:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-05-02 19:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 6449, 'date': '2013-05-02 19:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-05-02 19:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-02 19:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27487/2/gate/gate-diskimage-builder-pep8/405 : SUCCESS in 00:00:09

package on a fresh Fedora 18 install.

[{'created': '2013-05-01 22:34:02.000000000', 'message': 'Cut over to grizzly -> havana

* change BASE_RELEASE and TARGET_RELEASE in grenaderc
* remove work-arounds from devstack.localrc.target
* remove upgrade steps from the upgrade-* scripts
* change references to release names in variables to BASE_ and TARGET_
* fix check-sanity for proper credentials

Fixes bug 1175340

Change-Id: Iff137039f4ac1d252c661fb945ce9d7b356e8f61
'}]
commit_message:
Cut over to grizzly -> havana

* change BASE_RELEASE and TARGET_RELEASE in grenaderc
* remove work-arounds from devstack.localrc.target
* remove upgrade steps from the upgrade-* scripts
* change references to release names in variables to BASE_ and TARGET_
* fix check-sanity for proper credentials

Fixes bug 1175340

Change-Id: Iff137039f4ac1d252c661fb945ce9d7b356e8f61

associated with a migration before updating usage.

Baremetal driver get_available_nodes was incorrectly returning only a
list of unprovisioned nodes, leading update_availabile_resources to
sometimes delete a baremetal node that had an instance provisioned
to it -- sometimes even while the provisioning was still in process.

Fix bug 1174952

Change-Id: I4f08a2f6539a5b6cd12245ac6b4dc308767ae0cd
(cherry picked from commit 75568fe6309d0e89f829bc15f14536506e58a152)

commit_message:
Fix baremetal get_available_nodes

Baremetal driver get_available_nodes was incorrectly returning only a
list of unprovisioned nodes, leading update_availabile_resources to
sometimes delete a baremetal node that had an instance provisioned
to it -- sometimes even while the provisioning was still in process.

Fix bug 1174952

Change-Id: I4f08a2f6539a5b6cd12245ac6b4dc308767ae0cd
(cherry picked from commit 75568fe6309d0e89f829bc15f14536506e58a152)

When someone runs nova as root, and sysfsutils is not installed
an exception was being thrown when a volume attach call was made.
This wouldn't happen when being run as non-root because of the
rootwrap would trap for the missing sysfsutils app (systool).

Change-Id: Icc852fa7fd7a137cc7df86b8b96aeb629639ffad
Fixes: bug 1172486
(cherry picked from commit 001961ed495a33cc944407888a2797f8a600e091)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix attach when running as root without sysfsutils

When someone runs nova as root, and sysfsutils is not installed
an exception was being thrown when a volume attach call was made.
This wouldn't happen when being run as non-root because of the
rootwrap would trap for the missing sysfsutils app (systool).

Change-Id: Icc852fa7fd7a137cc7df86b8b96aeb629639ffad
Fixes: bug 1172486
(cherry picked from commit 001961ed495a33cc944407888a2797f8a600e091)

[{'created': '2013-05-01 20:08:40.000000000', 'message': 'Convert the cache key from unicode to a string.

The memcached API expects string format, not unicode.
Convert the key passed to the memory cache to a string
before sending it to memcached. Since both the function
name and the id that form the key are ascii format, a
simple conversion from unicode to str is sufficient.

Change-Id: I9d15858ad4e10aa183444cccda9c33676059e55a
Fixes: bug #1174487
(cherry picked from commit 37fbfad813e12d00da8f9d3e9f6f13256d5bb7c1)
'}]
commit_message:
Convert the cache key from unicode to a string.

The memcached API expects string format, not unicode.
Convert the key passed to the memory cache to a string
before sending it to memcached. Since both the function
name and the id that form the key are ascii format, a
simple conversion from unicode to str is sufficient.

Change-Id: I9d15858ad4e10aa183444cccda9c33676059e55a
Fixes: bug #1174487
(cherry picked from commit 37fbfad813e12d00da8f9d3e9f6f13256d5bb7c1)

[{'created': '2013-05-02 18:36:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add RabbitMQ and QPID HA support flags to quantum.conf

Since Quantum supports HA queues with RabbitMQ (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/13760/),
quantum.conf should provide new flags for explain how to configure multiple RabbitMQ servers and enable HA.

New flags :
rabbit_hosts=$rabbit_host:$rabbit_port
rabbit_ha_queues=false
qpid_hosts = localhost:5672

Fix Bug #1160369
Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25389/

Change-Id: I35903b1b7b66fde8d70ac7e8076e0def2a1f2d04
'}]
commit_message:
Add RabbitMQ and QPID HA support flags to quantum.conf

Since Quantum supports HA queues with RabbitMQ (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/13760/),
quantum.conf should provide new flags for explain how to configure multiple RabbitMQ servers and enable HA.

New flags :
rabbit_hosts=$rabbit_host:$rabbit_port
rabbit_ha_queues=false
qpid_hosts = localhost:5672

Fix Bug #1160369
Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25389/

Change-Id: I35903b1b7b66fde8d70ac7e8076e0def2a1f2d04

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-01 15:43:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix regression on running manage command.

Options on the manage command (./run_tests.sh) is getting shuffled,
this is due to the logic how testopts and testargs are extracted.

For example, the command "./run_tests.sh -m startdashboard test
--target test" is being translated into "startdashboard --target
test test".

The options after the "-m" should be passed as is as argument to the
manage command.

Fixes bug 1164505.

Change-Id: Id1a0699050390014487459757b3bda9c7fcca405
(cherry picked from commit 44f2275c69c2b4f3637d888f82ff0b5cc232e4bc)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix regression on running manage command.

Options on the manage command (./run_tests.sh) is getting shuffled,
this is due to the logic how testopts and testargs are extracted.

For example, the command "./run_tests.sh -m startdashboard test
--target test" is being translated into "startdashboard --target
test test".

The options after the "-m" should be passed as is as argument to the
manage command.

Fixes bug 1164505.

Change-Id: Id1a0699050390014487459757b3bda9c7fcca405
(cherry picked from commit 44f2275c69c2b4f3637d888f82ff0b5cc232e4bc)

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-04-25 16:43:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

So you can't reproduce this on the command line.  When you pass in invalid preauth without keys you just get a clean failure after the retry because:
a) if you don't set -A -U -K bin/swift assumes you're auth v2.0
b) get_auth's handling of v2.0 seems to prefer returning preauth creds if available rather than passing None's into it's auth methods.

I'm not sure if either of those is a bug separately, or if changing get_auth's approach to preauth values for v1.0 style auth would be preferable?

This actually seems betterish simply because it avoids the retry in most cases?

v1.0 with keys and preauth will make an auth request same as before.
v1.0 without keys and preauth will give better error.
v2.0 with keys and preauth will prefer preauth and fail after retry same as before.
v2.0 without keys and preauth will give same 401 error, but sooner w/o retry."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-05-02 18:34:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-18 20:29:51.000000000', 'message': "Confirm we have auth creds before clearing preauth

If you use the API and supply only preauth values (preauthurl and
preauthtoken), and if either of these are incorrect, a non-descriptive
AttributeError will be thrown and uncaught:

 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'find'

The _retry() will fail on the first pass (getting 401), then try
to reauthenticate with non-preauth values. If those are not given,
particularly the auth url, then the urlparse() call will be supplied
None for the url in http_connection() causing the exception above.

This change makes sure that we have an auth url, user and key before
clearing the preauth values. Given the situation above, a '401 Unauthorized'
ClientException will now be thrown instead of the AttributeError
after all retry attempts using only preauth values.

Change-Id: Ie1b5bde1e8ff321aa18c0f23dbd2960d6e482236
"}, {'created': '2013-04-25 11:45:43.000000000', 'message': "Confirm we have auth creds before clearing preauth

If you use the API and supply only preauth values (preauthurl and
preauthtoken), and if either of these are incorrect, a non-descriptive
AttributeError will be thrown and uncaught:

 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'find'

The _retry() will fail on the first pass (getting 401), then try
to reauthenticate with non-preauth values. If those are not given,
particularly the auth url, then the urlparse() call will be supplied
None for the url in http_connection() causing the exception above.

This change makes sure that we have an auth url, user and key before
retrying authentication. Given the situation above, a '401 Unauthorized'
ClientException will now be thrown instead of the AttributeError.

Change-Id: Ie1b5bde1e8ff321aa18c0f23dbd2960d6e482236
"}]
commit_message:
Confirm we have auth creds before clearing preauth

If you use the API and supply only preauth values (preauthurl and
preauthtoken), and if either of these are incorrect, a non-descriptive
AttributeError will be thrown and uncaught:

 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'find'

The _retry() will fail on the first pass (getting 401), then try
to reauthenticate with non-preauth values. If those are not given,
particularly the auth url, then the urlparse() call will be supplied
None for the url in http_connection() causing the exception above.

This change makes sure that we have an auth url, user and key before
retrying authentication. Given the situation above, a '401 Unauthorized'
ClientException will now be thrown instead of the AttributeError.

Change-Id: Ie1b5bde1e8ff321aa18c0f23dbd2960d6e482236

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-30 21:55:32.000000000', 'message': 'Raise rather than generating millions of IPs.

Fixes bug #1163394

Formerly if we tried to create many millions of floating IPs with a
range like "192.168.2.224/2", address_to_hosts would happily iterate
over all of them (which would take a long time) and then nova-manage
would eventually crash with an OutOfMemoryError when we tried putting
all of them in a list.  Or, if the initial list wasn't quite big
enough to use all memory, it would blow up later (even more slowly)
when we tried to put them in the database via SQLAlchemy.

Now, raise exception.InvalidInput if the number of IPs is a million
or more.  (A million is erring on the side of caution.)

Change-Id: Ifc6b6a8faadc2e97e09f9f6c975e52229f705789
(cherry picked from commit 34de8d1529fb9a2e7fad096a6967b9a483ab0cb0)
'}]
commit_message:
Raise rather than generating millions of IPs.

Fixes bug #1163394

Formerly if we tried to create many millions of floating IPs with a
range like "192.168.2.224/2", address_to_hosts would happily iterate
over all of them (which would take a long time) and then nova-manage
would eventually crash with an OutOfMemoryError when we tried putting
all of them in a list.  Or, if the initial list wasn't quite big
enough to use all memory, it would blow up later (even more slowly)
when we tried to put them in the database via SQLAlchemy.

Now, raise exception.InvalidInput if the number of IPs is a million
or more.  (A million is erring on the side of caution.)

Change-Id: Ifc6b6a8faadc2e97e09f9f6c975e52229f705789
(cherry picked from commit 34de8d1529fb9a2e7fad096a6967b9a483ab0cb0)

commit_message:
Mark LDAP password and admin_token secret

Add secret=True to LDAP password and admin_token
of keystone configuration.

Fix bug #1172195

Change-Id: I8ef7f705e3f6b374ff427c20eb761892d5146a75
(cherry picked from commit d43e2a51a1ed7adbed3c5ddf001d46bc4a824ae8)

commit_message:
Allow listing fixed_ips for a given compute host.

nova.db.fixed_ip_get_all_by_instance_host was removed in commit
bb867ce3948ddc23cf928ca3dda100a1a977896a, but was still used in
nova-manage. This patch works around the removal of the foreign
key that led to this method being removed.

Resolves bug 1163660.

Change-Id: Ieccd37c752e245558827615c098604d11ad3d945

[{'created': '2013-05-02 08:28:57.000000000', 'message': 'Wrong proxy port in nova.conf for Spice proxy

If we look at nova/cmd/spicehtml5proxy.py, we use 6082 port for Spice proxy.

In nova.conf, the default port for html5proxy_base_url is 6080 which fails console
service.

Fix bug #1172957
Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27524/

Change-Id: I52ca37f76e7a6abd085b079ae42e7914cb619ad5
'}]
commit_message:
Wrong proxy port in nova.conf for Spice proxy

If we look at nova/cmd/spicehtml5proxy.py, we use 6082 port for Spice proxy.

In nova.conf, the default port for html5proxy_base_url is 6080 which fails console
service.

Fix bug #1172957
Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27524/

Change-Id: I52ca37f76e7a6abd085b079ae42e7914cb619ad5

[{'created': '2013-05-01 20:07:56.000000000', 'message': 'Catch glance image create exceptions

Catch exception from glance when image creation fails because the
requested name is too long. Currently the exception is not caught
in the api which results in an 400 Bad Request correctly being
returned, but also leaving a traceback in the logs. Correctly catching
the exception and explicitly raising an HTTPBadRequest removes
the production of the traceback.

Fixes bug #1169560

Change-Id: I511da79cb0b1b4578bf43f0819b2ac64fb6e5fb3
(cherry picked from commit 09c7fc3b694ab401d42c9e59b17e24bbe4383588)
'}]
commit_message:
Catch glance image create exceptions

Catch exception from glance when image creation fails because the
requested name is too long. Currently the exception is not caught
in the api which results in an 400 Bad Request correctly being
returned, but also leaving a traceback in the logs. Correctly catching
the exception and explicitly raising an HTTPBadRequest removes
the production of the traceback.

Fixes bug #1169560

Change-Id: I511da79cb0b1b4578bf43f0819b2ac64fb6e5fb3
(cherry picked from commit 09c7fc3b694ab401d42c9e59b17e24bbe4383588)

Thanks, Eoghan!'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-02 15:18:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

A tiny nitpick and a more general comment:

In the patch you're passing the policy enforcer to all instances requiring it. I recently shared some comments with Doug in this review[0] and we agreed that having globals in the main policy lib isn't a good thing but I think that having a global enforcer might make sense in the app side.

Having multiple enforcers will require loading rules multiple times and keeping them in memory. Enforcers will automatically reload the rules every time the file is modified.

I think that an enforcer per policy (json) file makes sense and could be imported and used as a global instance. 

That being said, I'm not a fan of global instances but I think it makes sense in this case.

What do you guys think? 

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27721/"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-02 15:21:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

AFAICT, the code here would only instantiate the policy enforcer once (when the ContextMiddleware is instantiated), and it would only load the policy rules from disk once (on the first call to "check()"). So how would a global help?'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-05-02 15:50:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Thanks for the review Flavio,

Docstring added as requested in the latest patch set.

I agree in general with your comments about minimizing the number of policy enforcers. Hence the idea of creating just one in the context middleware to share among all request contexts. I originally intended to go further and use this in the controllers also, but while this worked out neatly in the v1 case, it was a tad awkward for the v2 controllers.

BTW I, too, am a bit leary of globals, though since we've gone down that route for config, it could be sensible to do so for the policy enforcer also. Orthogonal to the current patch of course.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-02 16:17:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Use RBAC policy to determine if context is admin.

Fixes bug 1152716

If the context roles do not match the configured admin_role,
fall back to determining if admin via the "context_is_admin"
RBAC policy rule (for consistency with the approach used by
the other projects).

Note this requires that the "context_is_admin" rule *must*
be set in the policy.json if the out-of-the-box default rule
is used (as this default is so open, the net effect of omitting
the "context_is_admin" rule is for every request to acquire
admin status).

Change-Id: Ide2cf604b48f24bd759ce2d65091ff546cd9d22e

commit_message:
Adds examples of CLI and API queries to the V2 documentation.

This patch includes additional reST-formatted text that will add new/expanded examples of v2 API use to the existing documentation.
Fixes: bug #1160929

Change-Id: I63fa9dd8b050a63f005c4a5b35399355fdeb7605

commit_message:
Prevent rescuing a VM with a partially mounted volume.

If a VM goes into rescue mode with a partially mounted volume, the
volume won't re-appear after the VM is unrescued.

Fix bug 1158942

Change-Id: I1e104236c41c59e67a0f0e9ef26143c57f6e0094

of setup_require

subject: Rename EventFilter to SampleFilter.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 688, 'name': 'Sandy Walsh', 'email': 'sandy.walsh@rackspace.com', 'username': 'sandy-walsh'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 4715, 'name': 'Angus Salkeld', 'email': 'asalkeld@redhat.com', 'username': 'asalkeld'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-04-29 21:01:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-04-29 21:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-29 21:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27751/3/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/2167 : SUCCESS
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/27751/3/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/974/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27751/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/2101 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27751/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python26-rhel6/234 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/27751/3/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/2102 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-04-29 23:06:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

I like the new terminology, but it might be worth scratching the head to see if we can come up with a non-conflicting name instead of "event".'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-04-30 02:11:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks for the review Angus. 

Yeah, event can be generic, but it really does represent what it is. This did come up in the mailing list a while ago and Event was what people wanted. Most monitoring applications refer to them as events and even Nova calls it Event Notifications.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-04-30 13:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-04-30 14:10:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

QueryFilter is pretty generic. Is the intent to make this class work for filtering other things, or should we call it SampleFilter to make clear how it is used?'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-04-30 17:42:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I considered that at first, but the same structure appears to be used by samples, volumes, stats and meters.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-05-01 16:30:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Samples, statistics, and the old volume API all use the class because they work on the sample data.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-05-01 18:51:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

right ... so can we merge this? :)

(more branches coming that depend on it)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-05-01 18:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

My point was, SampleFilter says "this thing filters the sample table." All of the uses of the class are doing that. Calling it "QueryFilter" doesn't say what it actually does.'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-05-01 19:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

well, I guess this gets us into terminology again. 

The fact that Meter/Sample/Counter are used interchangeably causes no end of confusion. 

Even the API uses the /meter part, while the docs refer to them as a Sample, but the keys returned in the payload use "counter_xxx". Hopefully in V3 we're standardizing on one of these? 

How about I change it to MeterFilter, which best matches the code and the API?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-05-01 19:17:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think we're trying to move toward "sample" to mean "the measurement" and that's what this is filtering on. We've got the table named poorly, and the Counter class is only part of a sample but it should probably be renamed, too. The /meter/foo API endpoint returns sample data for a "foo" meter, so I think that's actually consistent now, isn't it?'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-05-01 19:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

It's hard to tell. There's no delineation in the code or API where Meter ends and Sample begins. 

QueryFilter is a mish-mash of Meter and "Sample" fields. The API response bodies return duplicate data from both (project id, resource_id, unit/counter_unit, type/counter_type, etc)

https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/storage/__init__.py#L84

Personally I find it makes the code very hard to understand when new terms are thrown around ad-hoc. 

Perhaps the move from Meter->Sample or Meter + Samples should be left for another branch since it's a larger refactor that will require db migrations and api breakage?'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-05-02 13:14:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Yeah, the terminology is a pain, but I agree with Doug analysis on this.
Let's rename this to SampleFilter so we clear the namespace for events. QueryFilter is indeed too generic, as soon as we'll get query on anything else like alarm or events, it's going to be confusing."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-05-02 14:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-02 14:29:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Rename EventFilter to SampleFilter.

With the new Event tables entering ceilometer, having this EventFilter
class is going to cause confusion. Renaming this to SampleFilter.

Change-Id: I537ddaa79f1d28b4608518a2048be7c33c1b5acf

On a more general point, I'm wondering if the alarm API should be versioned independently of the main metering API? revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-02 10:23:24.000000000', 'message': "Don't duplicate networks list on keypair import

In the Launch Instance modal, if the user clicks on the button to import
a keypair, the networks listed in the Networking tab get duplicated.

The import keypair button calls `workflow_init` which in turn calls
`generate_networklist_html` which appended the networks to the list, not
clearing it beforehand.

This makes sure both Selected Networks and Available Networks lists are
emptied before the networks are added.

Fixes bug 1170193

Change-Id: Icb750caa08673068c509af6c8df1ad57a2a30d93
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>
"}]
commit_message:
Don't duplicate networks list on keypair import

In the Launch Instance modal, if the user clicks on the button to import
a keypair, the networks listed in the Networking tab get duplicated.

The import keypair button calls `workflow_init` which in turn calls
`generate_networklist_html` which appended the networks to the list, not
clearing it beforehand.

This makes sure both Selected Networks and Available Networks lists are
emptied before the networks are added.

Fixes bug 1170193

Change-Id: Icb750caa08673068c509af6c8df1ad57a2a30d93
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

commit_message:
Checks if volume can be attached

This patches makes a boot fail fast if one of the volumes cannot
be attached at boot time. Currently the request is accepted but
spawning fails in addition to leaving the volume state as
available which is an inconsistent state

Change-Id: I35b2034f8aa9574fcb8a34b58ead9f5e9ef27664
fixes: bug 1166770

commit_message:
Move db.fixed_ip_* tests from DbApiTestCase to FixedIpTestCase

During bp db-api-tests we will create for each model
ModelNameTestCase that contains tests for all methods that works
with this model..

So we shouldn't have DbApiTestCase at all. This patch will move
from DbApiTestCase methods that tests fixed_ip_* methods to already
existing FixedIpTestCase and a little bit improve it.

blueprint db-api-tests

Change-Id: I914c448d26c2b04a9fc3aa9614b7adf6f35b54d0

method to be testable and adds tests for each of the smaller

commit_message:
Make _build_network_info_model testable

This restructures the quantumapi _build_network_info_model()
method to be testable and adds tests for each of the smaller
components. It also provides verification for bug 1171636 by
ensuring that ports returned from the client that are not in the
set of networks passed don't cause the failure detailed in that
bug.

Change-Id: I82f20f68122fc38e72c31e52283529614252c174

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-30 16:18:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix building quantumapi network model with network list

Bug 1171636 occurs when _build_network_info_model() receives a list
of networks that does not fully map all of an instance's ports.
It crashes in _ensure_requested_network_ordering() when the list of
all ports is sorted by the subset of networks provided.

This change simplifies the early part of that function to only
consider ports within the networks provided, and to always sort those
ports in network order. This allows us to remove some error path
code from the loop below that iterates over the ports (which contained
a fatal typo, by the way) which is now dead code.

The affected code is really untested at the moment, due to the
structure of the method, making it hard to add a unit test to cover
this fix. In order to make the change clear from the existing code,
this fix is provided here first, and the following patch restructures
the method and add tests for this change and the rest of the surrounding
code.

Fixes bug 1171636

Change-Id: Idf519a88415844451b18959b38cc48ce92c090d1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix building quantumapi network model with network list

Bug 1171636 occurs when _build_network_info_model() receives a list
of networks that does not fully map all of an instance's ports.
It crashes in _ensure_requested_network_ordering() when the list of
all ports is sorted by the subset of networks provided.

This change simplifies the early part of that function to only
consider ports within the networks provided, and to always sort those
ports in network order. This allows us to remove some error path
code from the loop below that iterates over the ports (which contained
a fatal typo, by the way) which is now dead code.

The affected code is really untested at the moment, due to the
structure of the method, making it hard to add a unit test to cover
this fix. In order to make the change clear from the existing code,
this fix is provided here first, and the following patch restructures
the method and add tests for this change and the rest of the surrounding
code.

Fixes bug 1171636

Change-Id: Idf519a88415844451b18959b38cc48ce92c090d1

commit_message:
Fix tests which were broken by incomplete changes.

1. Switch from utcnow_ts to utcnow in mongo driver;
2. Add the strict expiration filtering back.

It makes sense to relax the TTL restriction on messages, but in
the current version, get msg & list msgs behavior differently.
So at this point of time, this 'feature' should be regarded as a
bug, and the tests should be fixed before we land this 'feature'.

Change-Id: I3606b9d6459ab6cfc91b431fa66acdbaa2874e1e

Enumerate the meter type in the API Meter class

This uses the counter definitions as this is how the db
is populated and thus will be consistent.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-28 00:16:21.000000000', 'message': "Update Horizon for Django 1.5 compatibility

Changes made:
- Changed template url tags: {% url myview %} to {% url 'myview' %}
- Import json instead of django.utils.simplejson
- Import django.utils.encoding.force_unicode instead of
  django.utils.translation.force_unicode
- Fixed error in tables/base.py for CheckboxInput, pass a callable
  check_test. Django 1.5 does not silently fail on this now.
- Set SECRET_KEY in test/settingspy, Django 1.5 refuse to start if it
  is not set.

Fixes bug 1147329

Change-Id: I6ac1e81498f41141dea99760922991feb310a326

commit_message:
Update Horizon for Django 1.5 compatibility

Changes made:
- Changed template url tags: {% url myview %} to {% url myview %}
- Import json instead of django.utils.simplejson
- Import django.utils.encoding.force_unicode instead of
  django.utils.translation.force_unicode
- Fixed error in tables/base.py for CheckboxInput, pass a callable
  check_test. Django 1.5 does not silently fail on this now.
- Set SECRET_KEY in test/settingspy, Django 1.5 refuse to start if it
  is not set.
- Added notes about ALLOWED_HOSTS when running Horizon in Production

Fixes bug 1147329

Change-Id: I6ac1e81498f41141dea99760922991feb310a326

messages:

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27918/1/check/gate-heat-pep8/2770 : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-05-01 23:38:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

In the conversion we have lost some checking. The properties
gave use some explicit check to make sure the user didn't
provide anything besides Delete and Retain. Can you put in
some check so that the following is still checked:

 'AllowedValues': ['Delete', 'Retain']},"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-05-02 08:47:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is an improvement, but it doesn't resolve the bug, which is that *all* resources need to respect the deletion policy.

So, the logic should be in Resource.delete, such that it doesn't call handle_delete() at all if the DeletionPolicy is Retain, and if the deletion policy is 'Snapshot' then it should probably call handle_snapshot() or something instead.

I'm not against this patch going in as an intermediate step, but it shouldn't mark the bug as fixed, unless you're also raising a separate blueprint to solve for the general case."}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2013-05-02 09:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-05-02 09:59:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Make DeletionPolicy a resource attribute instead of a property.

This improves validation of the different values, and make the Retain
policy works for all resources.

Fixes: bug #1160779
Change-Id: Idb0d275c44661db341f693d9d80629661d66c7ac

[{'created': '2013-05-02 09:33:09.000000000', 'message': "Allow admin to delete default security groups

Previously there was no way to delete a default security groups which
isn't ideal if you want to clean up after deleting a tenant. This patch
allows default security groups to be deleted by the admin.

Change-Id: I2214c7dabf0f2ec960ce10ebbbcdc513bc73664c
"}]
commit_message:
Allow admin to delete default security groups

Previously there was no way to delete a default security groups which
isn't ideal if you want to clean up after deleting a tenant. This patch
allows default security groups to be deleted by the admin.

Fixes bug 1175393

commit_message:
Avoid initialization of policy engine before extensions are loaded

Bug 1174877

For a particular NVP extension, a database entry was being populated
in the plugin's __init__ method. The entry was added with an admin
context. Grabbing the context caused the policy engine to load before
all the extension were loaded, so rule on extended attribute
were not being parsed correctly.
This cause checks on external networks to fail always.

Change-Id: Icbc759773acab2a7687883d8d2844272c8ea55a3

commit_message:
Fix test_dbinstance not running by itself

This test seems to need a clean copy of the db like many others. Call
setup_dummy_db to initialize so it runs reliably by itself.

Change-Id: I60fcd6b5c94659f16ef85ca3bdbd61417c59322b

commit_message:
Remove unused jenkins arguments from tox.ini

These do not match the established testing patterns for OpenStack and
seem to be quite redundant. They also mention nosetests which is no
longer used.

Change-Id: I874a226b515f1a8ad24136eba81a40fc170435b9

Verified that the test_access_key_no_user testcase
was valid for bug/1155824 and made a small enhancement
to verify the final resource state.

Change-Id: I63c6d1b37166b24cedd18bf6cae3d0aae0b18fa6
Implements: failed resource deletion testcase
Fixes: bug #1156375

commit_message:
Remove all references to nose

Now that testtools and testr have replaced nose, trims all references
and removes nose from test-requires.

Change-Id: I0aae8fe2c09c5b25741226555838dc330d5c4d91

One thing I noticed, though, is that the old test dependency was on pep8==<specific version>, while the new dependency is just on flake8 without a version specifier.

We added in the pep8 version specifier around the time 1.3 came out and got a whole lot stricter and broke the swiftclient gates; are we going to have similar problems with flake8 if we don't lock down the version?"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-05-01 13:30:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Ensure that qpid connection is closed.

Fixes bug 1172922

When reestablishing a session and a connection already exists the
existing connection will be closed prior to opening the new one.

Change-Id: I9a25800fe4b56eba89d550e3461ce095bf902f0a

(1 inline comment)

Why is all the logic of preserving the counter values placed in the database API layer - surely it belongs in the  virt driver."}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-05-01 15:42:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

We have to keep a persistent copy of the volume usage statistics in order to keep a consistent totals count of how a user uses a volume. We don't want lose information about how a user used a volume for when a volume reboots, detaches, etc. for whatever reason. This would lead to a case of under billing the customer.

As seen form this patch and this code the management of these statistics has a few edge cases that need to be well tested and managed. This is also common to all the virt drivers.

The virt drivers are responsible for producing the raw statistics in the first place, that is the rd_req, rd_bytes, wr_req, wr_bytes and errors numbers.

Hope that answers your question."}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-05-01 16:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-05-01 16:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Volume IO usage gets reset to 0 after a reboot / crash

Check for reset of block device stats before updating volume usage cache.

If an instance is reboot or crashes, the results of block device stats for
that domain get reset. Add check that if block device stats are lower than
the current stats in the database, then add current values to totals and
update.

Change-Id: I3011872f8d80a1519771f8423001650dcbcc7f5b
Fixes bug: 1169097

'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-04-20 14:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-04-20 15:23:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am not sure that this is bug and should be changed in this way. I will try to explain you on current situation in Nova. This thing has very deep background.


We have a problem with Unique Constraints (UC), because when you are using soft_delete instead of delete you are not able to make UC on some field. (If you delete it then you will be not able to create it one more time with the same value in this field.) 
So the solution was to change type of deleted column from boolean to type of ID. And when you are trying to delete something we will store to delete column id value. (And then we are able to create UC on column adding UC on (column, deleted)). 
This patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/16940/

The second thing is that we are using  our subclass of sqlalchemy.org.query.Query that have soft_delete method and that uses model.id. 
This patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/18439/

In your patch you are changing only behavior of model.soft_delete. 

And one more thing what I would to say is that if we are using models with SoftDeleteMixIn it means that they are actually not deleted from DB, and to be able to use UC we should add it and have models.id column.

So there are 2 possible situation:
1) We don't use soft delete so we don't need this thing
2) We are using soft delete so we should have models.id column

If we are using soft delete and don't have model.id column we should do db migration to add it."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-04-20 15:44:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Boris, I think you've misunderstood this patch because what I intend to do is provide a new mixinclass to have deleted=True for models which do not need UC.

I'm not changing the behavior of SoftDeleteMixin class which is setting "deleted" to self.id'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-04-20 16:41:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Pls read one more time end of my review. I didn't say anything about old Mixin (except why it is used) just to clarify situation and explain why we shouldn't add your Mixing"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-04-20 23:51:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Boris, yes I do understand your comments and thank you for the recap of the history of this part. However there are two points I would like to mention.

First, the supporting UC on a specific column should be tested from the projects that use oslo's model.py module by running unit and integration tests. Oslo's responsibility is only to allow the functionality of marking of True to deleted because there is a usecase where we don't want to add records of a particular column we've set UC.

Second, you said if a table does not have a UC, then we should not use soft delete and use hard delete. I do not share the same thought since the role of tenant users should be prohibited from hard deleting a record and should only using soft delete for security issues. Maybe some OpenStack projects would choose to hard delete on a record but that shouln't prevent oslo from providing softdelete functionality of setting deleted to True.

Did I understand your argument correctly or am I still missing something?"}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-04-21 06:39:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Probably I was not enough clear, I will try to say what are the problem points in points:

1) If you add BooleanSoftDeleteMixin for example I will think that table allows me to do session.query(ThisTable).soft_delete() and it doesn't allows me to do this, but should. Take a look at this file common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py (find class Query)
In nova this couldn't be covered by unit tests, because unit tests are runed only with sqlite and this thing won't work only with postgresql. 
So this code could produce very nasty errors.

2) I didn't say that if you are not using UC -> don't use soft_delete. I said that there should be only 2 situation: 
a) we would like to use soft_delete (we are using SoftDeleteMixin and have id column)
b) we would like to delete from DB we don't need soft_delete at all.

3) I am not sure that avoid possibility of creating UC on table is good long term solution."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-23 14:10:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Just to be clear here - my impression is that Boris has done a tonne of carefully considered work around soft deletion like I6059982b83648133b6d8becf94ad8980b056c6ff

I haven't looked to carefully at your patch or the discussion because I'm assuming Boris has a valid concern

Do let me know (here) if you think Boris is missing something, but I'll need a very simple explanation :)"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-04-24 09:15:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Boris,
Sorry for the late reply. I totally misunderstood you with what you meant by "don't use soft delete". I understand what you are trying to say now and I'll prepare another patch next week. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-02 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-02 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Implements BooleanSoftDeleteMixin

Let tables to set deleted=True instead of deleted=self.id

Fixes bug #1119697

Change-Id: I8dcbda364f467faa8533ecdd3d09864402610eb1

commit_message:
Properly list tokens with a null tenant

We store the tenant as a null value in json, so checking to see
if it exists is not sufficient. This makes the check safer, checking
for existance and not null before continuing.

Fixes bug 1078497

Change-Id: Ida1b958e5df6f93a30efae0d3f71df668751ff81

I think I buy the idea, but we should wait until Havana to land this.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-02-20 14:12:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> 1) A security issue, since anyone who gets access to the  database will
be able to see the credentials.

FYI: If you use the 'metadata_encryption_key' option this is not the case."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-02-20 14:28:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Doesn't the code currently also support having a location that points to 'another' swift instance? (eg an old 'full' swift instance, or a swift in another region, or from another cloud provider). So all the credentials in the database may not necessarily be the same as what's in the config file."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-02-20 14:36:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Good point about `metadata_encryption_key`, honestly, I didn't know it.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-18 12:40:29.000000000', 'message': "Swift store shouldn't save credentials in the database

Swift's Store saves swift credentials in the database  This turns out to
be:

1) A security issue, since anyone who gets access to the database will
be able to see the credentials.

2) An issue when the credentials change, since they'll be updated in the
config file but there's no way to update the existing images.

This patch removes the use of stored credentials and fallsback to the
ones present in the config file.

Fixes bug: 1100220

Change-Id: Iea533fa6d029d7b3675fba332b499c60fdb5f825
"}, {'created': '2013-02-18 14:53:19.000000000', 'message': "Swift store shouldn't save credentials in the database

Swift's Store saves swift credentials in the database  This turns out to
be:

1) A security issue, since anyone who gets access to the database will
be able to see the credentials.

2) An issue when the credentials change, since they'll be updated in the
config file but there's no way to update the existing images.

This patch removes the use of stored credentials and fallsback to the
ones present in the config file.

Fixes bug: 1100220

Change-Id: Iea533fa6d029d7b3675fba332b499c60fdb5f825
"}]
commit_message:
Swift store shouldn't save credentials in the database

Swift's Store saves swift credentials in the database  This turns out to
be:

1) A security issue, since anyone who gets access to the database will
be able to see the credentials.

2) An issue when the credentials change, since they'll be updated in the
config file but there's no way to update the existing images.

This patch removes the use of stored credentials and fallsback to the
ones present in the config file.

Fixes bug: 1100220

Change-Id: Iea533fa6d029d7b3675fba332b499c60fdb5f825

commit_message:
Call format_message on InstanceTypeNotFound exception

Put the exception message from InstanceTypeNotFound into the
HTTPBadRequest rather than the exception itself.  Prevents a Circular
reference error during serialization later.

Bug 1175414

Change-Id: I4811e727311af670cd964a6d16ac5fce0fe3186e

This method has functionality which doesn't seem to match what

commit_message:
Rename _check_image_size to _get_and_check_image_metadata

This method has functionality which doesn't seem to match what
it actually does (which is getting image metadata and performing
basic checks on that data).

Change-Id: I818fb5079105cca8acbdf464d47a92f7b1ebb398

commit_message:
Added a way to pin diskimagebuilder commit to redstack

We need to have a way to pin the last stable version of diskimage-builder
in case we have an unstable version on trunk that is breaking.

Fixes bug 1175408

Change-Id: Idb02aee0af3d012562c94e44e87f6ac40e0d5460

commit_message:
Fix "No handlers could be found" warnings

These warnings are caused because nothing is capturing log output in
their test cases. HeatTestCase automatically does this using the
FakeLogger fixture.

Change-Id: I7884c99cebc0c69f7675cdddd5e53de2e4b52c13

commit_message:
heat api : Update ec2token middleware for v4 signatures

Update ec2token so it can verify v4 signature formats.

Note for v4 signatures to work you currently need to install
the latest python-keystoneclient, as no release yet contains
patch ref https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26013/

This change should be backwards compatible, as older keystoneclient
versions will simply ignore the additional request keys

fixes bug #1122472

Change-Id: Iccc6be7913ab5ca5813a2e0c8f66cda0ccd85a0b

commit_message:
Fix missing kernel output via VNC/Spice on boot

Bug 1164021

Use both ttys0 and tty0 as console options to the kernel during
boot.

Change-Id: I0365ff7cad021fb6ca551651d00d58297087e95e
(cherry picked from commit b980de7cd1ac0e9085c20392bf82d1d3b12b24e8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-01 22:24:03.000000000', 'message': "xenapi: Don't swallow missing SR exception

The existing code would catch a missing SR exception and bail out of the
`update_status` method before finishing, causing required keys to be missing.
The end-result was code breaking later on when it tried to access these keys.

Since an SR is required to generate these required stats keys, we shouldn't
swallow the StorageRepositoryNotFound exception and instead should fail-fast.

Fixes bug 1175357

Change-Id: I3d65ae807fb2d86277bc0061c1967a87792b6662
"}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Don't swallow missing SR exception

The existing code would catch a missing SR exception and bail out of the
`update_status` method before finishing, causing required keys to be missing.
The end-result was code breaking later on when it tried to access these keys.

Since an SR is required to generate these required stats keys, we shouldn't
swallow the StorageRepositoryNotFound exception and instead should fail-fast.

Fixes bug 1175357

Change-Id: I3d65ae807fb2d86277bc0061c1967a87792b6662

commit_message:
Makes the guest work for more than just mysql.

* Moved code around to accomplish this
* Renamed a few msyql specific methods
* Used the guest_info config file since it contained
  the service_type already

implements blueprint reddwarf/guest-multi-impl

Change-Id: I99186ef6467c789499e8e600850bda4b4ee76ed2

commit_message:
Document the DNS driver interface.

Add doc comments for each of the methods on the driver interface.

Progresses blueprint dynamic-dns.

Change-Id: I6c36a59caf666eacae10127fa2bd5c8e9aa07447

commit_message:
One DNS manager is enough.

Previously there was a distinction between a "fixed IP DNS manager"
and a "floating IP DNS manager". Remove this distinction, and have
one manager manage everything.

DocImpact: flag names have changed and functionality is simplified.

Progresses blueprint dynamic-dns.

Change-Id: Id737ea1cea3b53bf92240d561cc48a897240267a

This code isn't something that I've looked at in detail.  However, based on discussions with Michael and Vishy, I am under the impression that this was broken to the point where there was no way anyone was using this successfully.  If that is still the case, I'm fine with just killing it off as this patch does.

If there is any chance that someone could be using this, then we should really go through a one release deprecation cycle on it.

Michael, thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-05-01 22:51:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Abandoned

Russell and I have talked about this again and we're going to be more conservative that I originally thought. I will mark this as deprecated and note it should be removed in I."}]

commit_message:
Remove the LDAP DNS driver.

No one is using this driver, and it is only supported for nova-network
users. Remove it as part of a larger cleanup of DNS support in nova.

DocImpact: the LDAP DNS driver has gone to heaven, and should be removed
from any docs it appears in.

Progresses blueprint dynamic-dns.

Change-Id: I2499aadb4e7f79284a87c4de0adea24bc014b7e5

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-04-26 04:59:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

ovs_use_veth is configured in quantum_plugin_setup_interface_driver in each plugin file
(lib/quantum_plugins/xxxx) and some plugins (ryu, nicira, nec) require ovs_use_veth is set to True.
Your patch directly configures ovs_use_veth via Q_OVS_USE_VETH and does not honor each plugin configurations.
It is no problem if ovs_use_veth is forced to set to true when Q_OVS_USE_VETH is True,
but Q_OVS_USE_VETH=False should not disable ovs_use_veth.

I believe ovs_use_veth=True works for all OVS based plugins,
so if there is no problem it may be a good chance to discuss which is
the better default value of ovs_use_veth True or False."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-26 05:59:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Akihiro: Unless I'm missing something, this patch does honor each plugin's desired configuration.  In each case, I was careful to ensure that the value for ovs_use_veth was set to Q_OVS_USE_VETH before to a call to _quantum_setup_interface_driver so that plugins would be able to override the value set for Q_OVS_USE_VETH."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-04-26 06:45:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Maru,
Thanks for the clarification. When I commented the last time, I haven't checked the exact order. I agree the your patch honor the order of setting ovs_use_veth carefully.
My remaining concern is this order can be broken easily.

How about moving "iniset $QUANTUM_TEST_CONFIG_FILE DEFAULT ovs_use_veth $Q_OVS_USE_VETH" to _quantum_setup_interface_driver in lib/quantum? ovs_use_veth is related to the interface driver configuration and we can configure it in one place. By configuring interface related parameters in one place the risk can be redueced.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-04-29 21:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-04-30 03:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-30 05:57:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-30 06:01:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Akihiro: Hopefully the latest patch addresses your concerns.  I've moved the ovs_use_veth config in lib/quantum to the plugin setup call, and added a comment to make it clear it should appear first.  I've also added the same comment to the lbaas agent setup - I wasn't sure that it could use the same 'private' function."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-30 06:41:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Add configurable use of veths with Quantum+OVS.

 * This patch adds the ability to configure use of veths with
   OVS via the Q_OVS_USE_VETH variable.  The use of veths with OVS
   is required to support namespaces on RHEL.
 * Supports bug 1171727

Change-Id: I5f557d659684ead99a3e5e2b4df787699d9d3f05

commit_message:
Remove redundant arping package from apts/nova

Nova is dependent on arping because 'arping -U' is used.
Arping package doesn't provide 'arping -U'. Let iputils-arping
do the arping job.

Change-Id: Iad4cbf823881de4656fb6a4e32285cf2a49b1d2a

commit_message:
Create package for registry's client

Currently, Registry's client doesn't have a version and It's being
imported from glance.registry.(__init__|client).

As part of the blueprint registry-api-v2 the registry's client will be
modified. That for, it is necessary to keep backward compatibilities
with older versions until the db-registry-driver is completed.

This code might be removed / re-factored in the future once glance's api
v1 will be migrated to use the db-registry-driver.

Change-Id: I3f27cec5b6e5f857d7aa94731305629190ae642e

commit_message:
Redirects requests from /v# to /v#/

Added an APIMapper to catch routemaps when the url is ''
because routes.Mapper returns an error if this is the case
but we want a redirect

Refer to the Nova code at:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/886/

Change-Id: I74011d14a02a3bc8767fab559ada4c2d82dc5d6e
Fixes: bug #1166957

"}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-04-03 18:21:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-04-03 18:27:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

Don't let the -2 fool you, I'm very happy to have this refactoring. A few notes:

- Not sure what's up with pep8 there. Is it trying to check the now-deleted binaries? Maybe you have already fixed that issue in patchset 3.
- Having to install glance control to test glance seems like something we should avoid if possible (though I know other OS projects have similar requirements.) Can you think of another way to access glance control but still make this awesome change?"}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-04-03 18:55:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ideally I would like to be able to import the glance-control (and all programs) for most of the tests (thus they would not need to be installed).  In fact this re-factor came about specifically to be a step in that direction.  However, we cannot do that because of the global nature of cfg.CONF.  The problem being that there is 1 cfg.CONF in the process space thus we cannot safely import multiple CLI programs, nor can we use the same one twice and expect sanity.  Hopefully that can be fixed soon.

That said, glance-control is a bit of a special case because even if we import it, it will fork out the other programs and thus expect them to be executable and in the path.  Can you tell me more specifically your objection to this so I have some parameters to work with?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-03 19:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/26018/3/check/gate-glance-pep8/4364 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26018/3/check/gate-glance-docs/2395 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26018/3/check/gate-glance-python26/3813 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26018/3/check/gate-glance-python26-rhel6/72 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/26018/3/check/gate-glance-python27/3844 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26018/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/11484 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26018/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/11199 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26018/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/17187 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-04-03 21:11:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ah, yes. I just don't like to require installing a project in order to test it. But maybe we already require that?"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-04-08 17:15:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@mark, I don't think that requiring to install glance in order to test it is a big deal. People cloning glance are, most likely, going to hack on it and so they will, most likely, have a virtualenv where they can just run python setup.py develop and have everything installed. 

I agree with John here and I think that having entry_points is cleaner and easier to debug.

If having scripts in bin/ is important then I guess we could just import what is in glance/cli/*.py and call it from the external script. 

A good example where this could come handy is: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26074/

Cheers!"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-04-12 14:02:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi!

I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PATCH - thank you. Small nit - could you call it glance/cmd instead of glance/cli? We called it cmd in nova and oslo-incubator and there's just no real good reason to introduce divergence in the project at this point.

As for the install it question - yeah, setup.py develop in a virtualenv I think is the win.

For glance-control - once we get the process-space cfg global issue sorted - what if, instead of doing an os level fork, it imported the desired module and ran it using a subprocess? Just a thought..."}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-04-12 18:14:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-12 19:00:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Convert scripts to entry points

The executable programs used by Glance have historically been scripts
in the ./bin directory.  This patch converts all of the scripts to
entry_points.  This change makes these programs python modules.  Thus
they can be imported and methods in them can be called just like any
other module.  This will allow the tests to call into these programs
directly instead of having to fork out a process.

The conf.py file in the doc tree was causing a name collision with
the python module cmd.  The glance/glance directory was being added
to sys.path which made glance.cmd import with the name cmd.  This
patch also fixes that problem.

blueprint: refactoring-better-faster-stronger-functional-tests
Change-Id: I67ae14b7403af31a5944befcd2ec27a690e81f15

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-01 19:19:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'null' response on router-interface-remove operation

To avoid a 'null' response body, the delete operation returns a response
that is consistent with its add counterpart, i.e. we return the router
id with details about the interface being affected by the operation, as
well as the tenant id.

A unit test is added to ensure that the right body is returned and minor
adjustments have been made to the plugins affected by the change.

Long-term, a delete operation should really return 204 w/o a body, but
this requires some major rework of the WSGI handling within Quantum.
This is an interim solution that deals with an 'ugly' response body,
whilst keeping backward compatibility.

Fixes bug 1173284

Change-Id: Icaab87ad0c8561c0690c8f0a14db815d8886bc71
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'null' response on router-interface-remove operation

To avoid a 'null' response body, the delete operation returns a response
that is consistent with its add counterpart, i.e. we return the router
id with details about the interface being affected by the operation, as
well as the tenant id.

A unit test is added to ensure that the right body is returned and minor
adjustments have been made to the plugins affected by the change.

Long-term, a delete operation should really return 204 w/o a body, but
this requires some major rework of the WSGI handling within Quantum.
This is an interim solution that deals with an 'ugly' response body,
whilst keeping backward compatibility.

Fixes bug 1173284

Change-Id: Icaab87ad0c8561c0690c8f0a14db815d8886bc71

commit_message:
Remove run_tests.sh and associated files

Bug 1172012

This patch removes test runners which have now been replaced with tox.
It does not remove a test runner in the cisco plugin, as it seem that
directory still have unit tests not executed with tox.

Change-Id: I90d476163606564252ef92e94a9a19460b2631a2

The code looks good here, though I haven't gone and reviewed the virt drivers myself to verify the claim about when MigrationError is raised.

However, as you point out in the commit message, this is only safe because of where MigrationError is currently raised.  The name of the exception sounds like something that a driver writer can raise from pretty much anywhere in the migration process, including when it fails in such a way that the instance is truly left in a broken state.

This change limits MigraitonError such that it can *only* be raised in cases where the instance is left in an operable state afterwards.  This needs to be clearly documented (perhaps in the virt driver interface for the method in question?)."}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-04-30 10:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Maybe it makes sense to split this exception into two with one for raising errors for pre-checks, before the running instance is being touched.

Besides being used in live-migrations, this same exception is raised during resize operations and here it looks like it should actually error out the instance.'}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-04-30 10:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-04-30 11:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Reset migrating task state for MigrationError exceptions

Create an exception type for pre-check errors and add it to the list
of exceptions for which instance task state is reset to ACTIVE to
avoid cases where an instance get stuck in MIGRATING state.

Convert existing instances of raise MigrationError in scheduler and
driver pre-checks to have them raise the new MigrationPreCheckError
exception instead.

In addition, also make sure that expected exceptions are passed over
RPC silently.

Resolves bug 1171526.

Change-Id: I00fa0962e555f895dd98861684ec7767fed3b37b

So we need to set up the default MTU size of veth interfaces by 1504.

Fixes: bug #1075336
Change-Id: I05011718baad996419f5acfc541f176e4d2dc98d

commit_message:
Allow OVS default veth MTU to be configured.

For both 'flat' and 'vlan' network type, a tagging mechanism is used now.
So we need to set up the default MTU size of veth interfaces by 1504.

Fixes: bug #1075336
Change-Id: I05011718baad996419f5acfc541f176e4d2dc98d

are no functional changes in this review.

commit_message:
Use optparse for install_venv_common

In order to bootstrap a virtualenv from an unmodified 2.6 Python environment,
we need to use optparse instead of argparse or openstack.common.cfg.

Fixes bug 1174926

Change-Id: Iad636c7adf7b184756eeba5ca760d8a76fc0e354

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-30 22:09:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix baremetal get_available_nodes

Baremetal driver get_available_nodes was incorrectly returning only a
list of unprovisioned nodes, leading update_availabile_resources to
sometimes delete a baremetal node that had an instance provisioned
to it -- sometimes even while the provisioning was still in process.

Fix bug 1174952

Change-Id: I4f08a2f6539a5b6cd12245ac6b4dc308767ae0cd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix baremetal get_available_nodes

Baremetal driver get_available_nodes was incorrectly returning only a
list of unprovisioned nodes, leading update_availabile_resources to
sometimes delete a baremetal node that had an instance provisioned
to it -- sometimes even while the provisioning was still in process.

Fix bug 1174952

Change-Id: I4f08a2f6539a5b6cd12245ac6b4dc308767ae0cd

commit_message:
Ensure that qpid connection is closed.

Fixes bug 1172922

When reestablishing a session and a connection already exists the
existing connection will be closed prior to opening the new one.

Change-Id: I9a25800fe4b56eba89d550e3461ce095bf902f0a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-01 04:03:22.000000000', 'message': 'Convert the cache key from unicode to a string.

The memcached API expects string format, not unicode.
Convert the key passed to the memory cache to a string
before sending it to memcached. Since both the function
name and the id that form the key are ascii format, a
simple conversion from unicode to str is sufficient.

Change-Id: I9d15858ad4e10aa183444cccda9c33676059e55a
Fixes: bug #1174487
'}]
commit_message:
Convert the cache key from unicode to a string.

The memcached API expects string format, not unicode.
Convert the key passed to the memory cache to a string
before sending it to memcached. Since both the function
name and the id that form the key are ascii format, a
simple conversion from unicode to str is sufficient.

Change-Id: I9d15858ad4e10aa183444cccda9c33676059e55a
Fixes: bug #1174487

[{'created': '2013-04-16 13:35:07.000000000', 'message': 'Catch glance image create exceptions

Catch exception from glance when image creation fails because the
requested name is too long. Currently the exception is not caught

Fixes bug #1169560

commit_message:
Catch glance image create exceptions

Catch exception from glance when image creation fails because the
requested name is too long. Currently the exception is not caught
in the api which results in an 400 Bad Request correctly being
returned, but also leaving a traceback in the logs. Correctly catching
the exception and explicitly raising an HTTPBadRequest removes
the production of the traceback.

Fixes bug #1169560

Change-Id: I511da79cb0b1b4578bf43f0819b2ac64fb6e5fb3

commit_message:
Tie the pep8/pyflakes/flake8 versions.

Even though flake8 is wonderful, it still uses pep8 under the covers,
which means we want to tie it for the cycle.

Change-Id: Ia84bd7655aaa3497055024815200be8a2ad52384

Import oslo periodic tasks support.

I'll move nova across to this in the next review, I just want to
make the import clearly separate.

subject: Just ran oslo-incubator's update.py
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1528, 'name': 'Stanislaw Pitucha', 'email': 'viraptor@gmail.com', 'username': 'stanislaw-pitucha'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4419, 'name': 'Matthew Sherborne', 'email': 'msherborne+openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'msherborne+openstack'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-05-01 12:09:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-05-01 12:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Second patch adds the new files that oslo-incubator gives us. I forgot to add them in the initial patch.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-01 12:16:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

I'm really not a fan of big all-in-one syncs like this

For big changes, I'd prefer to see people who are familiar with the change be the one syncing it - see e.g. https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/MAINTAINERS#L34

Also, one big sync means that if we figure out this commit broke something later, it's hard to identify what exact part of the sync broke the thing

I'll comment inline what changes could be in a "sync the small, safe changes from oslo" commit and what changes should be synced as individual commits

Also, note you can do e.g.:

  $> python update.py --base nova --dest-dir ../nova --module log'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-05-01 12:26:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (20 inline comments)

Dims - could you sync log.py please?

Thierry - could you sync rootwrap please?

Stan - could you sync jsonutils please?

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-05-01 12:35:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd rather let Monty sync the rootwrap entrypointization part, since it requires some setup.py changes and removal of bin/nova-rootwrap. Should have his name on it :)"}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2013-05-01 12:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I6b0e7baeb24951ce3c0bc129d20c65daa0d8fa61 is for the jsonutils sync'}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-05-01 12:45:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Will push a "sync small and safe changes from oslo" patch shortly.

Thanks Mark for the detailed review :)'}]

commit_message:
Just ran oslo-incubator's update.py

This is in preparation for a second run but I'll add oslo's scheduler
library too.

The scheduler will be used to continue work on
blueprint entrypoints-plugins

Change-Id: I7ac373643feb0213988f5af23516dd1aab42f0bb

commit_message:
Added 'scheduler' oslo module and re-ran update.py

This is in preparation for making host scheduler filters and weights use
the blueprint entrypoints-plugins

import and install gettext in vm_vdi_cleaner.py

importing some nova modules expects _() to be defined, so lets define it
before we start importing them.

commit_message:
Add delete_net_interface function

This commit adds a new function that deletes a specific
tap device. This bug fix is targeted for Havana.

Change-Id: I26be5d94550db35358caae642fb9000953346826
fixes: bug #1138408

commit_message:
Use sql alchemy to fetch a scalar for the max tunnel id

Bug 1174998

Change-Id: I6cb4cb90134f6e6b17054a9bafaaa8166d2a229a
