commit_message:
Nova has 'y' as a valid bool.

In order to move toward using these functions in nova for boolean
and string to boolean operations we need to add this 'y' case into
the allowed set of boolean strings.

Change-Id: I6cb4cb90134f6e6b17054a9bafaaa8166d2a229a

subject: Fix unicode decode error when servers timeout
messages:
[{'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-04-10 12:22:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I try to begin to add a test in unittest suite of swift
and it seems that test/unit/proxy/test_server.py is the good place try to trigger the Unicode decode error exception in _make_request but the following code do not fire this
exception :
diff --git i/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py w/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py
index e1ed81a..42c9064 100644
--- i/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py
+++ w/test/unit/proxy/test_server.py
@@ -351,6 +351,11 @@ class TestController(unittest.TestCase):
             self.controller._make_request(
                 nodes, partition, 'POST', '/', '', '',
                 self.controller.app.logger.thread_locals)
+            set_http_connect(201, raise_timeout_exc=True)
+            path = 'a/cont_\xc2\xb5'
+            self.controller._make_request(
+                nodes, partition, 'POST', path, '', '',
+                self.controller.app.logger.thread_locals)
 
     # tests if 200 is cached and used
     def test_account_info_200(self):

nosetests -v -w test/unit/ proxy.test_server:TestController.test_make_requests
test_make_requests (proxy.test_server.TestController) ... ok

So i think i need some help to add unittest with this fix, someone can help me maybe ?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-10 12:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/26599/1/check/gate-swift-pep8/2096 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26599/1/check/gate-swift-docs/1924 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26599/1/check/gate-swift-python26/2172 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26599/1/check/gate-swift-python26-rhel6/117 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/26599/1/check/gate-swift-python27/2174 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26599/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/12156 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26599/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/17964 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26599/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/11871 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-04-11 00:09:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can you mock out the http_connect() method to make it raise an error?'}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-04-11 08:42:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As far as i understand the unittest code in unit/proxy/test_server.py the set_http_connect already mock the http_connect method and the arg raise_timeout_exc forces the FakeConn getresponse to raise a Timeout exception so the failing code of _make_request in proxy/controller/base.py is really executed:

except (Exception, Timeout):
 self.exception_occurred(node, self.server_type,
  _('Trying to %(method)s %(path)s') %
  {'method': method, 'path': path})

Maybe the way I construct the path is not accurate to trigger the expected UnicodeDecodeError exception ?"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-04-23 18:42:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think you're on the right track with the test...

I think you'll need to update swift's gettext install to pass in the unicode flag, and then remove the __builtin__ monkeypatch in test/__init__.py.

I added some notes to the bug."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-01 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-01 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-10 11:43:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unicode decode error when servers timeout

An unicode decode error occured when
a timeout is triggered when proxy-server is
connecting to object-server or container-server
and object or container name are unicode.

Convert path to unicode with errors handling
replace strategy.

Change-Id: I26e37bbf14cadc234cf56aee22e9c39ca1821ad0
Fixes: bug #1167263
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unicode decode error when servers timeout

An unicode decode error occured when
a timeout is triggered when proxy-server is
connecting to object-server or container-server
and object or container name are unicode.

Convert path to unicode with errors handling
replace strategy.

Change-Id: I26e37bbf14cadc234cf56aee22e9c39ca1821ad0
Fixes: bug #1167263

@dhellmann

That's a good point on error handling when the old-style router.interface.{create|delete} notification from quantum is missing the tenant & resource IDs.

The net effect is just that an unsightly KeyError is reported (but that doesn't impact on future ability to consume quantum notifications).

So I could easily special-case the logic to check if the required fields are present, wondering though whether best not to pollute ceilo code with fallout from a quantum bug ...

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-04-05 20:41:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Meter router.interface.{create|delete} notifications

Fixes bug 1060985

Consume quantum notifications relating to the creation and
deletion of router interfaces.

Requires a version of quantum with the corresponding fix to
flesh out these notifications with the data required by the
ceilometer notification handler:

  https://github.com/openstack/quantum/commit/1daf927c

Change-Id: I805ba23987db22d7c8beb26f578441a296ae51fa

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-10 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-04-10 07:12:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored'}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-04-10 07:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 5215, 'date': '2013-04-10 09:38:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

As I understand it, this adds the functionality of copying a Glance image onto an existing volume.

First off, we need to think of virtual resources as being disposable rather than recyclable. If you want a bootable volume, why not create a new one with the current code base rather than reuse an existing volume? Afterwards, you can delete the existing volume and throw it away, if you so wish.

Second, we're adding a facility to blow away data on an existing volume by typing the wrong thing, for the dubious benefit of recycling an existing volume.

I also think it's wrong to submit this as a bug fix, because what it's trying to do is actually a new 'feature' and should be submitted as a blueprint for discussion at the design phase, rather than back-ended as a fait accomplis under the guise of a bug fix."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-18 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-18 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-04-18 22:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored'}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2013-04-18 22:37:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This simply adds another choice for the user to create a bootable volume. 

The needs to be checked if it could be a proper destination for the image to be download into. This is something I have been considering.'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-04-23 23:04:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Dermot makes a valid point, there is some doubt regarding the value considering the fact that this would result in deleting all the data on the volume anyway, so he's got a point regarding the limited benefit.

I also have to agree that this is not a bug, it's for sure a feature enhancement."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-01 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-01 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

commit_message:
Add the support of copying an image into an existing volume to volume API.

By providing an image id and a volume id, one can copy the image into the volume.
Fix Bug1155509.

Change-Id: Ifcafb47a5166a6d1769e7c36cf8790b139ca68dc

This relies on backporting lockutils and such, which is a rather large patch.  I have no problem with this, but want to emphasize it in case someone else does.'}, {'account_id': 161, 'date': '2013-03-21 16:37:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 161, 'date': '2013-03-21 17:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It looks like there may be an issue in the lockutils.py.

If you do not have lock_path set in your cinder.conf, it attempts to use "../" (from line 41 of lockutils.py):

    cfg.StrOpt('lock_path',
               default=os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__),
                                                    '../')),
               help='Directory to use for lock files')

In most cases this directory is owned by root, and cinder cannot write to it, resulting in the following error when you attempt to do anything with a volume:

2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 ERROR cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp [-] Exception during message handling
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp Traceback (most recent call last):
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cinder/openstack/common/rpc/amqp.py", line 276, in _process_data
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp     rval = self.proxy.dispatch(ctxt, version, method, **args)
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cinder/openstack/common/rpc/dispatcher.py", line 145, in dispatch
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp     return getattr(proxyobj, method)(ctxt, **kwargs)
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cinder/volume/manager.py", line 163, in create_volume
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp     volume_ref['id'], {'status': 'error'})
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 24, in __exit__
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp     self.gen.next()
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cinder/volume/manager.py", line 135, in create_volume
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp     model_update = self.driver.create_volume(volume_ref)
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cinder/volume/netapp.py", line 479, in create_volume
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp     self._provision(name, description, project, ss_type, size)
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cinder/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 215, in inner
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp     with lock:
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp   File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cinder/openstack/common/lockutils.py", line 75, in __enter__
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp     self.lockfile = open(self.fname, 'w')
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp IOError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/cinder/openstack/cinder-netapp_dfm'
2013-03-21 16:19:06 3013 TRACE cinder.openstack.common.rpc.amqp 

Adding lock_path=/var/lock/cinder and ensuring that directory exists and is owned by cinder:cinder resolves the issue.'}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2013-04-04 12:07:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-04 12:09:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-05 12:36:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

Ok, this is a small patch but it has the potential to complete hose the driver

Also, the lock_path permissions issue is a concern - i.e. if packagers update to 2012.2.4 and don't notice they need to include this directory with the correct permissions, then any users of this driver will see breakage when they update

I'm inclined to -2 this because it's too risky and I'd prefer to ensure we don't regress the current state of the driver for lots of users when trying to fix a race condition that current users must not be seeing too much or they wouldn't use the driver

If you think I'm missing something, please add some more justification for the fix here

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 7220, 'date': '2013-04-05 16:42:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

A point of information on the lock_path directory and permissions. When using packages 2012.2.1, /var/lock/cinder already exists, with correct permissions. Our issue was just configuration.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-05 18:26:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ok, that's good info. Thanks.

Care to give your POV on how serious the bug is and how likely this is to cause regressions for existing users of this driver?"}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2013-04-16 10:22:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

As far as I can see, a simple 'for' loop to create multiple volumes (say for example that the admin wants to create 10 new volumes) is bound to fail for majority of the volumes. Also, as the waiting period is dependent on an external software (DFM), he will have to wait till a volume comes in 'available' state before he can start creating another volume.

Abel can provide a better, user-facing scenario I think."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-01 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-01 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

[{'created': '2013-03-12 12:43:30.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp: Fix race condition in 7-mode iSCSI driver with DFM.

A race condition was discovered in the driver while creating
or deleting multiple volumes in a very short interval of time
(can be reproduced by making successive API calls to Cinder).
This fix decorates the methods responsible for race condition
with a synchronized() decorator. The problem was with the
management software: DFM, and in principle, there should not
be two processes trying to modify the DFM dataset object at
the same time. This patch prevents from such a possibility.

Fixes bug 1091480 and bug 1135619

Change-Id: Ibc645cb5f705b7a85f9f0b6df2f9fae65428196a

commit_message:
NetApp: Fix race condition in 7-mode iSCSI driver with DFM.

A race condition was discovered in the driver while creating
or deleting multiple volumes in a very short interval of time
(can be reproduced by making successive API calls to Cinder).
This fix decorates the methods responsible for race condition
with a synchronized() decorator. The problem was with the
management software: DFM, and in principle, there should not
be two processes trying to modify the DFM dataset object at
the same time. This patch prevents from such a possibility.

Fixes bug 1091480 and bug 1135619

Change-Id: Ibc645cb5f705b7a85f9f0b6df2f9fae65428196a

commit_message:
Support the logging configuration.

We use logging.config.fileConfig() to read an INI file to setup the
logger, where the path of the file is read from the new config
variable, `fileconfig`, which is under the [logging] namespace.

Change-Id: I55f29a2366980caf9044cb1b9f91805e33d0dacb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-01 00:09:56.000000000', 'message': 'Convert the cache key from unicode to a string.

The memcached API expects string format, not unicode.
Convert the key passed to the memory cache to a string
before sending it to memcached. Since both the function
name and the id that form the key are ascii format, a
simple conversion from unicode to str is sufficient.

Change-Id: I73f26014776020163e8a4aa4f5fa97fc95a0259c
Fixes: bug #1174487
'}]
commit_message:
Convert the cache key from unicode to a string.

The memcached API expects string format, not unicode.
Convert the key passed to the memory cache to a string
before sending it to memcached. Since both the function
name and the id that form the key are ascii format, a
simple conversion from unicode to str is sufficient.

Change-Id: I73f26014776020163e8a4aa4f5fa97fc95a0259c
Fixes: bug #1174487

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-01 02:48:17.000000000', 'message': 'Source img-functions into common-functions.

A recent commit added a call to function cleanup_dirs to
the common-functions file, but this function is not in scope
for all code paths.

The problem can be reproduced like so:
  bin/ramdisk-image-create deploy -o /tmp/foo

Which results in the error:
  bin/../lib/common-functions: line 35: cleanup_dirs: command not found

This change causes cleanup_dirs to be in scope when calling ramdisk-image-create.

Change-Id: Iaf01beb9dd42a9d810d8aed1aa4ce19a5854c09b
'}]
commit_message:
Source img-functions into common-functions.

A recent commit added a call to function cleanup_dirs to
the common-functions file, but this function is not in scope
for all code paths.

The problem can be reproduced like so:
  bin/ramdisk-image-create deploy -o /tmp/foo

Which results in the error:
  bin/../lib/common-functions: line 35: cleanup_dirs: command not found

This change causes cleanup_dirs to be in scope when calling ramdisk-image-create.

Change-Id: Iaf01beb9dd42a9d810d8aed1aa4ce19a5854c09b

commit_message:
Update boot-stack element's README.

Remove some outdated instructions, which have by now
been better realized in incubator/notes.md, and document
the first-boot process, and boot-stack specific command
line utilities.

Change-Id: I50950ea1411e1ad57dabaf3f6667f7fd5c45d6be

commit_message:
Remove unused and outdated heat/testing dir

The descriptions of testing are not in line with the test suite as it is
today, and none of the code there is actually used.

Change-Id: I717015184fea53d40fc8bd6782dcf4eb8a8520d4

commit_message:
Re-work run_tests.sh to call testr instead of nose

Running testr directly or running the tests in tox are the preferred
method at this point, but developers may still have automation around
run_tests.sh.

Change-Id: I5cd8a0e6bcee192440bdbc072dbd560615130def

commit_message:
Remove broken --doctest call from run_pep8.sh

It does not seem to actually be required and causes the script to fail
when not running inside tox.

Change-Id: Ib5be301054b08623ea31a97c1b2d6c341e7fdd3e

Looks good but minor nitpick re @skip_if which might me marginally cleaner'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-04-29 14:02:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Re using skip_if decorator, I feel pretty strongly that we shouldn't be writing our own testing utilities if we can avoid it. Those decorators should be done in testtools or not at all since they are just sugar.

My hope is that we can delete the skip_if decorator. I would like to remove all of the skip_if's and skipIf's for optional python modules, hence this bug that I filed:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/heat/+bug/1174005"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-04-30 08:54:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Re using skip_if decorator, I don't really mind which approach we use, I just want it to be consistent - another patch aligning the existing tests which use the skip_if decorator with the pattern here (and removing it) will be fine."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-04-30 20:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-30 21:01:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Remove use of nose attrib plugin and most unittest

Some simple cases that do not use mox still use unittest directly.
Replacing unittest.TestCase with HeatTestCase has the added benefit of
capturing all logging for reporting during failure.

Change-Id: I76192bdb91822055f1e2f7d2e806bf094d399304

commit_message:
Removing all prints and capturing logging

A new base class for tests is used to reduce repetitive steps used in
a majority of tests. This new base class also uses fixtures.FakeLogger
to suppress logging, though it will be shown on any failures to aid in
debugging the failure.

Prints that happen on normal operation of the test suite are all removed
as they are not needed and only clutter the output.

Change-Id: I0365283ce415c5390fd68bdf1f0b3c8038b1b9af

commit_message:
Remove functional tests in preferece for tempest

These tests are not unit tests, and take a long time. They are being
moved into tempest, which is where integration/functional tests live in
OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ida7792a00a8565f812c55da448d8c50a8b8a90b9

commit_message:
Remove examples and update testing-overview.txt

With the migration to testrepository, many of the instructions are
obsolete. Also the examples are not needed as we have plenty of fine
examples available in the code itself.

Change-Id: I87524eaab4c39ea75d7e53fb11ffe103d5339cc3

I actually think setup_dummy_db might be better off in heat/tests/common.py anyway.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-04-29 14:29:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

A comment inline, but also:

* Is copying-and-pasting code from one place into 50 different places actually an improvement?
* This doesn't appear to modify run_test.sh to actually use testr, and I don't see a patch in the queue to do so. Is that coming later, or ???e"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-04-29 14:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Oops, found the run_tests.sh patch.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-04-29 23:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Its not clear to me what I need to fix. ?'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-04-30 08:47:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Its not clear to me what I need to fix. ?

Remove the unused _dummydb = True and you get my +2

Zane's objections appear to be due to the existing test_cls variable name, which is not touched by this patch, hence we should fix it in a different patch IMO (it's actually my fault since I was the originator of the stack_delete_after decorator, I'll send a patch later addressing Zane's concerns, which appear to be that wrapped_test looks a bit like a classmethod due to the arguably dodgy variable naming)"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-04-30 13:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

commit_message:
Enable running tests via testr

This also disables the functional tests from running. The code is still
left here for posterity. These are intended to be moved into tempest
test cases and thus will be removed entirely at that time.

Change-Id: I294671baead6e83a8312b41681e99d395f861209

commit_message:
Migrate to PBR for build tooling.

pbr is the library-ified version of the code that was in
openstack.common.setup and version. It builds on top of d2to1 to
provide declarative build configuration.

Change-Id: Ic264fa33e17fe5fdc71d8c53412495b069ab74a4

[{'created': '2013-05-01 01:52:10.000000000', 'message': "Improve Fedora build host support: architectures.

Instead of blindly calling dpkg, we will now perform an appropriate test
and fall back on uname with some subsequent massaging of uname's output
on amd64 and ARM build hosts.

Change-Id: I363addd9f8b4d748d50b69f4509ce627aa5676aa
"}, {'created': '2013-05-01 01:52:10.000000000', 'message': "Improve Fedora build host support: architectures.

"}, {'created': '2013-05-01 01:52:10.000000000', 'message': "Improve Fedora build host support: architectures.

Instead of blindly calling dpkg, we will now perform an appropriate test
and fall back on uname with some subsequent massaging of uname's output
on amd64 and ARM build hosts.

Based on a patch from Lucas Alvares Gomes

Change-Id: I363addd9f8b4d748d50b69f4509ce627aa5676aa
"}]
commit_message:
Improve Fedora build host support: architectures.

Instead of blindly calling dpkg, we will now perform an appropriate test
and fall back on uname with some subsequent massaging of uname's output
on amd64 and ARM build hosts.

Based on a patch from Lucas Alvares Gomes

Change-Id: I363addd9f8b4d748d50b69f4509ce627aa5676aa

(1 inline comment)

I think restructuring the if statements would simplify the checks required.  Pick out the specific exceptions (fedora < 18 and opensuse < 12.3) then let the common fall to the last else clause.  Something like:

 if fedora || suse then
     if opensuse < 12.3 then
         # Old suse polkit bits
     else if fedora < 18 then
         # Old Fedora polkit bits
     else
         # everything that reaches here is either suse > 12.2 or fedora > 17
     fi
 fi"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-22 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

commit_message:
Fix nova compute failing to start on openSUSE 12.3

The syntax of polkit authorization rules is different now. Using the same code
as for Fedora 18 now.

Change-Id: I4f66d8fc65c90a309aab478a4df35c77c7669314

commit_message:
lib/database: Fixed a bug in database_connection_url

The changes from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23364/ simplified
the usage of database_connection_url_mysql and
database_connection_url_postgresql without making the proper changes
to database_connection_url.

Fixes: bug #1167668
Signed-off-by: Tal Kain <tal.kain@ravellosystems.com>
Change-Id: I5115d123ad794f2eb2e144b76932031af5248f26

commit_message:
Grab upstream nodejs for RHEL6

RHEL6 has no nodejs in main packages or in EPEL.  The easiest way is
to just install the upstream binary version which works fine for the
very minimal usage by lesscss.

Change-Id: Ia35e7dbaf4c7add43797d6b7d0c846bab1cf0cb0

commit_message:
RHEL6 support rpms

Install some rpms required for operation on RHEL6.  Additionally,
remove some system packages that interfere with pip installs.

Change-Id: I273ce59d7bf066e73d524f61b8ad048599101dab

commit_message:
Add a warning about __init__ to periodic_tasks.

This is just to make sure a change later doesn't break nova.

Change-Id: Idf0035ec896b4ef95b03399954ed19b95cb3a029

The boot-stack element contains a utility, wipe-openstack,
which clears all openstack databases, and restarts all services.

Before this change, wipe-openstack would not complete sucessfully
when run again after the first time, due to some networking config
and service restarts not being fully idempotent.

This change causes wipe-openstack to work as intended, and renames

purposes.

Change-Id: I8aeca8b21201cf12bcd1c9e6b97dc61a7b102921
'}]
commit_message:
Make `wipe-openstack` correctly reset all services.

The boot-stack element contains a utility, wipe-openstack,
which clears all openstack databases, and restarts all services.

Before this change, wipe-openstack would not complete sucessfully
when run again after the first time, due to some networking config
and service restarts not being fully idempotent.

This change causes wipe-openstack to work as intended, and renames
reset-keystone, reset-nova, etc. to init-*, to better capture their
purposes.

Change-Id: I8aeca8b21201cf12bcd1c9e6b97dc61a7b102921

qemu-nbd does not perform well with older versions of qemu due to
the lack of writeback caching mode. It also only builds qcow2 images
and there is a desire for raw image support. Finally, qemu-nbd makes
it very difficult to build images concurrently due to the somewhat
opaque nature of how it selects a /dev/nbd# device. losetup, on
the other hand, makes this process very straight forward.

commit_message:
Build images using loopdev instead of qemu-nbd.

Qemu-nbd does not perform well with older versions of qemu due to
the lack of writeback caching mode. It also only builds qcow2 images
and there is a desire for raw image support. Finally, qemu-nbd makes
it very difficult to build images concurrently due to the somewhat
opaque nature of how it selects a /dev/nbd# device. losetup, on
the other hand, makes this process very straight forward.

Change-Id: I309fad8af4fd1e8d1720c17b65e1897a76d5e897
Co-Author: Clint Byrum <clint@fewbar.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-29 20:57:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix attach when running as root without sysfsutils

When someone runs nova as root, and sysfsutils is not installed
an exception was being thrown when a volume attach call was made.
This wouldn't happen when being run as non-root because of the
rootwrap would trap for the missing sysfsutils app (systool).

Change-Id: Icc852fa7fd7a137cc7df86b8b96aeb629639ffad
Fixes: bug 1172486
"}, {'created': '2013-04-29 20:59:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix attach when running as root without sysfsutils

When someone runs nova as root, and sysfsutils is not installed
an exception was being thrown when a volume attach call was made.

commit_message:
Fix attach when running as root without sysfsutils

When someone runs nova as root, and sysfsutils is not installed
an exception was being thrown when a volume attach call was made.
This wouldn't happen when being run as non-root because of the
rootwrap would trap for the missing sysfsutils app (systool).

Change-Id: Icc852fa7fd7a137cc7df86b8b96aeb629639ffad
Fixes: bug 1172486

commit_message:
Updates book files to point to grizzly.

Preparation for a stable/grizzly branch cut.

Updated sitemap.xml, removes /essex/.

Release Candidate for Grizzly docs release.

Change-Id: Iceca183bf8da667b002987c238bc9e0a9082d305

[{'created': '2013-04-11 11:53:54.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused configure_db function

DB drivers currently implement a configure_db function that is supposed
to be used for seting up the environment and getting an engine back from
it. Since it is not being used anywhere in the code but tests, I removed
it and modified tests in order to call both functions (setup_db_env and
get_engine) where/ when needed.

As pointed out in another bug, it is important to just call setup_db_env
when instantiating the db_api in order to keep it lazy. AS for
sqlalchemy get_engine will be called when a session is requested.

Fixes bug 1167770

Change-Id: I2ebeb5e8424a4857df21f7c2d5b33e8ae0100c6a

commit_message:
Remove unused configure_db function

DB drivers currently implement a configure_db function that is supposed
to be used for seting up the environment and getting an engine back from
it. Since it is not being used anywhere in the code but tests, I removed
it and modified tests in order to call both functions (setup_db_env and
get_engine) where/ when needed.

As pointed out in another bug, it is important to just call setup_db_env
when instantiating the db_api in order to keep it lazy. AS for
sqlalchemy get_engine will be called when a session is requested.

Fixes bug 1167770

Change-Id: I2ebeb5e8424a4857df21f7c2d5b33e8ae0100c6a

[{'created': '2013-04-27 10:42:38.000000000', 'message': "Don't raise HTTPForbidden on a multitenant environment

When getting public images in a multi-tenant environment, Swift raises
HTTPForbidden for chuncked images.

Based on swift documentation, rlistings directive turns listings on,
which is the desired behavior in this case.

Fixes bug 1170156

Change-Id: I149f702d5b3ebae73b04deed4809939ab43c6adc
"}]
commit_message:
Don't raise HTTPForbidden on a multitenant environment

When getting public images in a multi-tenant environment, Swift raises
HTTPForbidden for chuncked images.

Based on swift documentation, rlistings directive turns listings on,
which is the desired behavior in this case.

Fixes bug 1170156

Change-Id: I149f702d5b3ebae73b04deed4809939ab43c6adc

commit_message:
Make Resource.create() a co-routine

At the moment, we will just run each co-routine to completion, but in
future we can use this to return control to the caller so that resources
may be created in parallel.

Change-Id: I5c2daf3839e53d855acb73fc4288b5be76794c7f

commit_message:
heat docs : Update jeos building documentation

Replace references to heat-jeos with documentation describing the
use of the new heat-templates/tools/heat-jeos.sh example script

fixes bug #1171602

Change-Id: I88fd2a5667cccd79a77c4a663c782fb537279fac

[{'created': '2013-04-29 09:29:13.000000000', 'message': 'Restore compatibility with PrettyTable < 0.7.2

PrettyTable 0.7.2 defaults to print a table even if
the resultset is empty. Restore previous behavior
to be in line with older prettytable releases.

Change-Id: Iaa9e1cf5444c8daa229aad53e3a3c15038a7d57e
'}]
commit_message:
Restore compatibility with PrettyTable < 0.7.2

PrettyTable 0.7.2 defaults to print a table even if
the resultset is empty. Restore previous behavior
to be in line with older prettytable releases.

Change-Id: Iaa9e1cf5444c8daa229aad53e3a3c15038a7d57e

commit_message:
Add the availability_zone to the volume.usage notifications

The volume.usage notifications are used to enable traffic based billing
on volumes. The availability_zone of the instance is an important piece of
information that can enable more specialized billing of customers.

This makes the volume.usage events consistent with the volume.create.start/end
snapshot.create.start/end, etc. emitted from cinder, which contain the
availability_zone field.

Change-Id: I9b6b03174cd03235d0e6cf01e34a6da13bd9bb70

commit_message:
Compress response's content according to client's accepted encoding

Currently Glance ignores the Accept-Encoding header and returns
responses as they are regardless the client accepts gzip or other type
of compression.

This patch adds this capability to glance (by using a middleware)
supporting just gzip for now.

Important note:
    - The patch uses a lazy compression for Content-Type
    application/octet-stream but in order to do that, the
    content-length has to be unset which means that when an image is
    downloaded the content-length will be unknown to the client.

Fixes bug: 1150380

Change-Id: Ieb65837d4e3fe310f97d9666882ecc572b14956a

[{'created': '2013-04-30 16:24:48.000000000', 'message': "Uses None instead of mutable lists for function param defaults

Addressing bug 1174809, changes use of mutable lists as as default
arguments and defaults them within the function. Otherwise, those
defaults can be unexpectedly persisted with the function between
invocations and erupt into mass hysteria on the streets.

To my knowledge there aren't known cases of the current use causing
specific issues, but even stylistically needs addressing to avoid
problems in the future. I couldn't find any comments or related
historical commit messages indicating the current use is meant to take
advantage of this behavior in Python.

Change-Id: I4a89afada08b2ce220724f585631a9e2072bf1bd
Fixes: bug 1174809
"}]
commit_message:
Uses None instead of mutable lists for function param defaults

Addressing bug 1174809, changes use of mutable lists as as default
arguments and defaults them within the function. Otherwise, those
defaults can be unexpectedly persisted with the function between
invocations and erupt into mass hysteria on the streets.

To my knowledge there aren't known cases of the current use causing
specific issues, but even stylistically needs addressing to avoid
problems in the future. I couldn't find any comments or related
historical commit messages indicating the current use is meant to take
advantage of this behavior in Python.

Change-Id: I4a89afada08b2ce220724f585631a9e2072bf1bd
Fixes: bug 1174809

commit_message:
Allow paste deploy flavor to be passed for glance api

Some users may want to pass in one of
keystone, keystone+caching or keystone+cachemanagement
depending on their caching needs

Change-Id: Ia13cc2f1d8ec43074b114edf1b2366b85ca77aa0

commit_message:
Bump the testtools lower bound.

We have put several bugfixes into upstream testtools that are important.

Specifically:

0.9.29 includes clarified error messages on upcall exceptions
0.9.28 includes support for labels/attrs used in tempest

Change-Id: Ia3c40723780fd3b8cf5ab2d71a3367e3a47ae803

verified that this works with keystone tests & for real use cases on the CLI'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2013-01-24 21:39:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hey Julien,

I moved this out of TokenManager for a specific purpose related to caching and using the cached token. I haven't read this in depth to verify that those mechanisms are still working and have relevant tests - that may not be relevant any more. 

The core issue was around dealing with a lack of auth_url when using a cached token token reference or one from the commandline, and the crazy shit that the two URLs had together."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-01-30 13:55:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Joe,

Got it. I just checked, and I don't see a case where that change would fail. The auth_url is retrieve from the cached token anyway, and the auth_url used is always the one from the Client, so I don't see a case where it could be wrong.

If such a case exist, it'd be nice to have a unit test about it."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-07 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-07 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-02-07 09:07:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2013-02-08 18:21:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

sorry for the delay in responding Julian

I think the issue is in trying to support keystone activity through the client when using the --os-token and --os-endpoint together. In those cases, there isn't a self.auth_url, and all of the calls through the TokenManage *require* there to be one to pull the relevant data through the REST interfaces.

somewhere (that I'm not spotting) did some creative swapping of mgmt_url and auth_url for underlying code in _cs_request() or the like, and it shat all over itself previously. 

There it is - in TokenManager authenticate() un keystoneclient/v2_0/tokens.py

Maybe I'm misremembering how this all plugged together, but that's why I was wanting to steer clear - you can't pass in the os-token from the commandline into that kit"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-02-11 10:18:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure I follow you entirely. I think the best way to do is to write a unit test that pass with master and fails with this patch -- I'll understand what this patch break and will be able to fix it. :)"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-11 15:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Use TokenManager to get token

Instead of implementing token retrieval twice, let's use the code provided
by the TokenManger to get a token in raw format from Keystone.

Change-Id: I769be118ee137580cabd5cabcf7843e7afe1e456
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Measurements documentation update

Nova measurements:
- add cpu_util
- del disk.io.requests, disk.io.bytes
- add instance unit to instance:*

+fix some errors on type and unit

for all measurements add new column 'Origin' :
notification|pollster|both

tag : DocImpact
Fixes: bug #1164032

Change-Id: I0046032b8835168772fc7fff6c34a9be99ddbd56

I'm open to suggestions how to fix this in better way."}, {'account_id': 6683, 'date': '2013-04-26 10:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-04-26 11:42:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

@psedlak: We have many many status wait function in the tempest code, the better way would contain:
- remove wait functions from the tempest/services codes
- using the python functional capabilities and define a reusable wait skeleton

Moving the status_timeout to a more generic base class sounds better, but IMHO we will need a more generic wait function in the future.

This change fixes an immediate problem, more generic solutions are welcome.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-04-30 16:10:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

commit_message:
Fix status_timeout incorrectly referencing self

After commit fbf40fdf status_timeout is not an class method anymore
and so it can't reference self.
To properly report test failure it needs to call TestCase.fail so
this change adds that argument and changes all usages appropriately.

Change-Id: Icab49794c8c52340e850d7574f633c99452ca7be

'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-04-29 19:48:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-04-30 14:22:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm not sure how to handle this. Even when that topic is merged, there will still be plenty of unittest.TestCase subclasses, and MoxTestBase is just an enhanced version of that. I can't see that anything will actually break with both sets of patches in.

BTW MoxTestBase not only sets up self.mox for you (with a meaningful name, even), but also ensures that method calls are verified. I don't really have any interest in doing that manually - it's both pointless and error-prone."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-04-30 16:52:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Indeed, I like MoxTestBase, and I would suggest we migrate all of our tests to do that.

What I'm suggesting that this test will deviate from an already established pattern by using self.mox rather than self.m.

In the TESTR topic, you'll see that I've introduced a HeatTestCase that sets up self.m and tears it down. It also captures logging output. I suspect there may be other mundane tasks that we will want to add that most test cases need. So we will be left with the choice of either using self.m and having self.mox be another mox object, or making things uniform, which means more churn.

I'll flip to +2 though, as I can see that this isn't really a "problem", just something to think about.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-04-30 16:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-30 16:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

commit_message:
Kill off usage of locals() in the filter_scheduler.

We decided we don't like this syntax, so I figured I'd clean up this
file while I was playing with it.

Change-Id: I861b9bfcb98782a2f0b46ac5bff09664a13d339c

commit_message:
Fixes volumes cleanup in base class

The tearDown method was not cleaning up the environment but failing
silently because of 'pass' statement

Change-Id: I75dde195ff162d0be27d971a551d3618c852e688
Fixes: bug #1172497

[{'created': '2013-04-30 16:14:37.000000000', 'message': "The is_node_template_associated function added.

It provides an ability to take an information about node template usages. It's needed for node template termination validation.

Change-Id: I49eeadf24417d2a6636804a71f6208e8577431d9
Fixes: bug #1174780
"}]
commit_message:
The is_node_template_associated function added.

It provides an ability to take an information about node template usages. It's needed for node template termination validation.

Change-Id: I49eeadf24417d2a6636804a71f6208e8577431d9
Fixes: bug #1174780

* Get the details of the action in a specified instance.
* Negative test to fail with an invalid value.

Partially Implements: blueprint missing-tempest-tests

Change-Id: Iadca953e2e9f2bda13a808f3c9fdcf0684ce7d34

commit_message:
Add tests list actions on a specified instance

* List the actions that were performed on the specified instance.
* Get the details of the action in a specified instance.
* Negative test to fail with an invalid value.

Partially Implements: blueprint missing-tempest-tests

Change-Id: Iadca953e2e9f2bda13a808f3c9fdcf0684ce7d34

commit_message:
Call os.kill for each child instead of the process group

The patch sets the process group id to its process id. Note that this
change raises an OSError in Glance's tests because they are run under
Popen and using glance-control, which changes children's session ids and
other parameters. That for, setpgid is inside a try / except and falls
back to 0.

Fixes bug 1068051

Change-Id: Ie9ed044e08053d0067396138de0bd124326aa1a5

Since the change merged from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27383/
ec2token auth no longer works, because there is a mismatch between
the config file section name and the section specified in ec2token

fixes bug #1174673

Change-Id: I5c0465de5c023f587b677b10717ca3a08ba411b7
'}]
commit_message:
heat api: fix ec2token authentication

Since the change merged from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27383/
ec2token auth no longer works, because there is a mismatch between
the config file section name and the section specified in ec2token

fixes bug #1174673

Change-Id: I5c0465de5c023f587b677b10717ca3a08ba411b7

commit_message:
Allow user to set the number of api workers

Defaults to ::processorcount
Also reseting puppet 2.6 compat in spec/classes/nova_db_postgresql_spec.rb
so that unit tests pass, it looks like our 2.6 unit test runner is using
puppet 2.7

Change-Id: I521679ce497a6d9f39a88a6e1d16d5a4ca67255a

commit_message:
Remove local variable only used in logging.

Kill off the locals() call as well. Just directly calculate the value.

Change-Id: I6b96d08a16feb125d1eb9162ca186bf37b429cd6

commit_message:
Added default values for JT, NN, TT, DN processes

 * Basic xml configs were added for provisioning cluster with different parameters
 * Added validation that user cannot create NodeTemplate with not allowed configs

Fixes bug: #1169211

Change-Id: I12e9c3ba20849b77dc0b502958aa2a8622ed7ce0

fixes bug 1174195

commit_message:
Restore compatibility with PrettyTable < 0.7.2

PrettyTable 0.7.2 changed the default to print
also tables when the result set is empty. Revert
to previous default.

Change-Id: I22ab7522227ef70929d31dd2c4aaff93c4c518c2

'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-04-26 16:21:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Are the users of this routine safe against the differences though? If so, what is the point of this test in the first place?"}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2013-04-26 22:21:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Duncan,

Good questions.  First, a quick bit of history.  It appears that this test case was pulled over from Nova.  The change I have implemented here is the same as the code change that was made there to account for the differences in minidom.

Second, the purpose of the test is to just verify the ability to parse XML, not to verify consistency in minidom implementations.  Whether there are '\n' characters in the XML returned is irrelevant.  The XML is valid with or without it.  The problem, however, is that assertEqual doesn't know that the '\n' aren't an issue and so it considers the parsed XML to be different.  I am just helping it out by removing the uninteresting differences to make sure the rest is the same.

Hope this explanation helps!  :-)"}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-04-30 12:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Thanks for the explaination'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-30 12:22:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-30 13:06:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-24 18:04:37.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid using whitespace in test_safe_parse_xml.

Updates the test_safe_parse_xml test case in
cinder.tests.test_utils.GenericUtilsTestCase to avoid using
whitespaces and to ignore extraneous newlines returned in the
parsed XML.  This is required to work around differences in
the output from minidom in python 2.6.

Fixes LP Bug #1172352.

Change-Id: I48bdf3cb8eed3e65f7ceaeb1c2b19aa529c930d0
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid using whitespace in test_safe_parse_xml.

Updates the test_safe_parse_xml test case in
cinder.tests.test_utils.GenericUtilsTestCase to avoid using
whitespaces and to ignore extraneous newlines returned in the
parsed XML.  This is required to work around differences in
the output from minidom in python 2.6.

Fixes LP Bug #1172352.

Change-Id: I48bdf3cb8eed3e65f7ceaeb1c2b19aa529c930d0

+1 because it seems innocuous, but arguably pointless. Do you see a substantial improvement over the way it was, such that introducing a new DB API method is necessary?'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-04-24 20:12:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Matt,

If we are speak in global.

I don't think that we should avoid using of DB for things that should be done in DB, even if there is no critical performance reasons. It is bad pattern at all.

What is bad in previous solution: 
1) Getting more unnecessary data from DB
2) More network trafic
3) A lot of work around row data that was get from db:
a) convert into list of sqlalchemy objects
b) A lot of work to get dictionary from sqlalchemy models
c)  And then work to find in this dictionary right value

So 2 points:
1) Bad for Nova architecture (critical for me) 
2) Bad for performance reasons (in this moment in this current situation is not principel)

Also this is very bad example for new developers. If they saw that it is ok to make filtering in nova not in DB, they will do for they purpose also filtering in nova (avoiding the creation of new methods) and they will probably have a real big data => cause problems only in real deployments...."}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-04-24 20:22:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2013-04-24 20:23:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Performance optimization for contrib.flavorextraspecs

In method FlavorExtraSpecsController.index():
This method calls FlavorExtraSpecsController._get_extra_specs()
that returns all extra_specs that has flavor.
In db.api layer we are returning already extra_specs as plain object,
so there is no reason to make one more time copy of extra_specs.

In method FlavorExtraSpecsController.show():
This method should return extra_spec that corresponds to specified
key and flavor_id.
Was:
Get all extra_specs by flavor_id and filter by key locally
Now:
Filter by flavor_id and key in db.

Change-Id: I4c39f5f56511e67e37482cda1b4e9771ee9c7d7d

commit_message:
Create instance with deleting image

If we attempt to create a new instance with an image that has just now
been deleted in glance, (ie. status="DELETED", but deleted=False).

The server should throw a 4XX error rather than a 5XX error.

This commit just adds tests.

Tests bug 1155458
Change-Id: Ifae470e96ddc4526ef67581a1d7171ccc5fd32b7

commit_message:
Use Query instances as iterables when possible

A Query.all() call creates a list of a DB query results.
We can actually use a Query instance as an iterable and
thus avoid creation of a list if we just need to iterate
over those values only once.

Fixes bug 1173133

Change-Id: I06d8eaa9eaba4c71aa0c98000735cb9d83ea19a3

commit_message:
Set hbase table_prefix default to None

...table_prefix default value was empty string which fails the connection to hbase thrift server. it should be set to None instead...

Fixes: bug #1173205

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-29 23:04:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix ec2 CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes status

In admin context CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes returns
extraneous information such as project_id, host, instance
data etc. This results in output which is not compatible
with the ec2 API. This change removes the addition
of the extra information.

This only partially fixes bug #1074901 as mapping the internal
volume states to ones specified by the ec2 api results in the devstack
euca.sh exercises to fail. But that can't be fixed until the fix
in this patch is through as the extraneous information returned by DescribeVolumes
causes euca-describe-volumes to not to show the attachment state for
a volume which is needed by the euca exercises.

Change-Id: I48a96fbfe4bb2e3da9514d688638ecdf3a168303
(cherry picked from commit c62d7636b6ba1c36a96119a87fff8495c5a1dc21)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ec2 CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes status

In admin context CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes returns
extraneous information such as project_id, host, instance
data etc. This results in output which is not compatible
with the ec2 API. This change removes the addition
of the extra information.

This only partially fixes bug #1074901 as mapping the internal
volume states to ones specified by the ec2 api results in the devstack
euca.sh exercises to fail. But that can't be fixed until the fix
in this patch is through as the extraneous information returned by DescribeVolumes
causes euca-describe-volumes to not to show the attachment state for
a volume which is needed by the euca exercises.

Change-Id: I48a96fbfe4bb2e3da9514d688638ecdf3a168303
(cherry picked from commit c62d7636b6ba1c36a96119a87fff8495c5a1dc21)

commit_message:
Add create volume snapshot test

A new test called 'test_snapshot_create_get_delete' is added into
test_volumes_snapshots.py , the test uses (and fixes a typo in) the
wrapper functions create_* and clear_* from base class.
It does not use the wrapper functions for the actual snapshot
manipulation to have some more control over the resp code and body.
Also this updates the existing test_volume_from_snapshot test.

Change-Id: I207ec61717368a13142ab357c82db8462d0c9c4f
Implements: blueprint add-snapshot-creation
Fixes: bug #1172497

We definitely need to solve the problem reported in the bug but I'm pretty opposed to just having the daemon exit. revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-02 03:54:09.000000000', 'message': 'Stop nova-compute when libvirtd goes down

During driver status update from periodic tasks, if we find that
the libvirtd is down then we just stop nova-compute and send
notifications. We need to do this because create/terminate instance
tasks cannot execute and we need to avoid nova-scheduler from
scheduling any requests to this node

Fixes LP #1011087

Change-Id: I447f24e4ac719d2d550810509f72be6f270ce326
'}, {'created': '2012-12-03 13:12:48.000000000', 'message': 'Add notifications when libvirtd goes down

During driver status update from periodic tasks, if we find that
the libvirtd is down then we should send send notifications and
log an error.

Fixes LP #1011087

Change-Id: I447f24e4ac719d2d550810509f72be6f270ce326
'}]
commit_message:
Add notifications when libvirtd goes down

During driver status update from periodic tasks, if we find that
the libvirtd is down then we should send send notifications and
log an error.

Fixes LP #1011087

Change-Id: I447f24e4ac719d2d550810509f72be6f270ce326

subject: Remove pyflakes_bypass
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-22 18:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27284/1/check/gate-heat-pep8/2636 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27284/1/check/gate-heat-python26/2591 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27284/1/check/gate-heat-python26-rhel6/78 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/27284/1/check/gate-heat-python27/2590 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27284/1/check/dev-heat-coverage/1147 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-04-22 18:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-04-22 18:21:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

The big issue here is that if you run *all* of the unit tests it works fine, because all of this stuff gets imported somewhere.

However, if you run some unit tests individually (e.g. heat.tests.test_common_policy) then they won't work. So this doesn't really work for development.

Then you have the really big issues, like that fact that without importing heat.engine.resources in heat.engine.service you won't be able to create any resources when you go to actually run Heat... and the unit tests can't tell you, for the same reason. In that sense, I like the big ugly pyflakes_bypass comment, because it should be a clue to reviewers not to let it get deleted without close examination."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-04-23 16:01:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Ok, I see that there are *much* bigger issues here.

IMO this is a difficult design to work with, as we have made the order of imports magic behavior that a test suite cannot reliably isolate and verify. Global state isn't entirely evil always, but it certainly needs to be handled delicately and isolated as much as possible.

I will look at a refactor which implements a resource loader rather than relying on these rather unimportant looking imports."}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-04-23 16:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

See last comment. Refactor in progress.'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-04-23 22:55:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-23 22:58:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
Remove pyflakes_bypass

There are valid pythonic ways to address all of the complaints that
pyflakes made in the past.

Fixes bug #1171420

Change-Id: Idf145185ebb4df237fff887365fa0c48d3603025

(3 inline comments)

Hey, 

Thanks for the patch, I left some comments in-line.

Cheers."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-04-19 17:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-04-19 17:19:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Okay, I made some changes to address your comments, and also made a few more to address some things I changed my mind about. :-)

I refactored the code to make it easier to handle errors in a granular fashion.  I'm still only catching generic exceptions though, because we ran into a problem with Qpid where some errors (incorrect password, for example) will leave open connections and eventually fill up the server's connection limit.  Exceptions in that case are thrown right from the connection.open() call, so we need to handle that the same way as any other error.  I did add a check to avoid closing a connection that wasn't opened though, so it should be fine.

I also decided to re-raise the exception instead of swallowing it.  That doesn't strictly address the user issue that prompted this change, but the more I think about it the less I like hiding that exception from all users.  If it is determined that our user still needs the exception to be swallowed I'd rather do that as a configurable option than an always-on thing.  If qpid goes down, a lot of other stuff is going to break anyway so I'm not sure it makes sense to go out of our way to allow Glance to keep working.  I can follow up with a later change if we determine there is a need for that."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-19 18:04:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/26132/3/check/gate-glance-pep8/4456 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/26132/3/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/926 : FAILURE (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-04-22 07:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Hey,

LGTM, just a small question in-line. 

As for now, I think exceptions should be re-raised, however, here are some cases where I would prefer to see exceptions handled in the implementation, i.e. incorrect password, or some qpid specific errors. It would be awesome if you could add that in this patch.

Thanks for working on this, again, it looks good! :D'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-04-22 16:49:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for the feedback.  I responded to your comment inline.

What did you have in mind as far as Qpid-specific handling?  Maybe just separate except blocks for the Qpid exceptions?  I'm not sure we can really do anything but log and re-raise for something like a bad password right now.  I'm open to suggestions though."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-04-26 16:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

It was more related to a "cosmetic" thing. If we know the credentials are incorrect we could print a more specific message and (either re-raise or go on based on the exception).

TBH, that's the one I can think of right now, perhaps they could be added later on.

Thanks for your contribution.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2013-04-26 17:02:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-04 20:06:45.000000000', 'message': 'Gracefully handle qpid errors

Notifications via qpid are an optional part of Glance, but if the qpid
server goes down it will currently cause Glance to stop working.
This change handles qpid errors so Glance is still usable even if qpid is not.

Be aware that for this change to be useful, qpid_reconnect_limit must be
set to a non-zero value (preferably small like 1 or 3) or the qpid code
will hang indefinitely trying to connect to the server.

Fixes bug 1164681

Change-Id: Ica3ef54b958e4efe3932b90d721324e7860b1ea4
'}, {'created': '2013-04-09 21:15:46.000000000', 'message': 'Gracefully handle qpid errors

Notifications via qpid are an optional part of Glance, but if the qpid
server goes down it will currently cause Glance to stop working.
This change handles qpid errors so Glance is still usable even if qpid is not.

Be aware that for this change to be useful, qpid_reconnect_limit must be
set to a non-zero value (preferably small like 1 or 3) or the qpid code
will hang indefinitely trying to connect to the server.

Fixes bug 1164681

Change-Id: Ica3ef54b958e4efe3932b90d721324e7860b1ea4
'}, {'created': '2013-04-19 17:19:32.000000000', 'message': 'Gracefully handle qpid errors

If a qpid error occurs when Glance is sending notifications, the
qpid connection may not be cleaned up properly.  This change catches
qpid exceptions to allow proper error handling.

Fixes bug 1164681

Change-Id: Ica3ef54b958e4efe3932b90d721324e7860b1ea4
'}]
commit_message:
Gracefully handle qpid errors

If a qpid error occurs when Glance is sending notifications, the
qpid connection may not be cleaned up properly.  This change catches
qpid exceptions to allow proper error handling.

Fixes bug 1164681

Change-Id: Ica3ef54b958e4efe3932b90d721324e7860b1ea4

commit_message:
Adds extended status fields to nova list

The nova list command now includes 'Task State' and 'Power State' fields to
bring parity with the dashboard.

	* Add helper function _translate_extended_states()
	to convert extended states to human

Fixes: bug #954750

Change-Id: I564b7f88e9e2524d8e4ffe21a51608c5e3b23d2d

commit_message:
Update NovaBase model per changes on oslo.db.sqlalchemy

Fixed NovaBase to inherit from models.TimestampMixin
Added metadata attribute
Added db.sqlalchemy to openstack-common.conf

Oslo sync command:
python update.py --modules db.sqlalchemy --base nova --dest-dir ../nova

Change-Id: Ie4ad8e8b235e146ddb946cdf7f15d74e060ee4a3

'}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2013-03-26 20:33:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2013-03-26 20:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

I discovered a problem that often causes errors in this code. Conductor vol_usage_update() saves the instance uuid to the instance id column in the volume_usage_cache table. The uuid is sometimes truncated to an integer, and works, but billing records would record the wrong instance id.

This patch set updates conductor/manager.py to save the instance_id to the volume_usage_cache table.'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-03-26 20:42:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So, the instance 'id' column will not uniquely identify an instance in a multi-cell environment.  Also, use of 'id' is generally discouraged throughout Nova.

Sorry to be a pain, but I think modifying the volume usage table to use the uuid instead of an integer id would be ideal.  And unfortunately, once you go to that trouble, you might as well save the tenant and user id directly in the volume usage table.  (Then you could skip all the lookups through conductor when the notifications actually need to be sent)

What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-26 21:13:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2013-04-03 12:33:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

The existing entries cannot be updated sensibly. The values in the 'instance_id' column are not valid, they represent the instance uuid formatted into an integer. This is true even for very long lived attachments, where the device was attached using diablo code, because the value in the 'instance_id' column is updated every time conductor_api.vol_usage_update() is called. So even if the 'instance_id' was correct sometime in the past, it is not now.

So it is not possible to use the instance id to look up the instance uuid or the two new fields, user id and project id.


As far as I can see the only consumer of this table is the periodic task _poll_volume_usage(), which is broken at the moment, because the instance_id that is being sent in notifications is not correct. So I can't see that existing consumers will be hindered.

Currently entries in this table are never deleted, this may be a flaw, but I 
don't think it's relevant to this change. And it does not cause a problem as far as generating billing records is concerned, records are selected based on two 'last_refreshed' fields, so when they are no longer updated the records will no longer be selected.

If you think it's worth raising a bug related to this I would be happy to address that in another change."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-04-03 15:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

OK, then.  Yeah, it sounds like there are more issues to work out here, but they can be addressed separately…'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-04-03 16:06:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Doesn't this patch leave the volume_usage_cache in a broken state because insatnce_id value is just completely dropped?!"}, {'account_id': 1773, 'date': '2013-04-30 07:35:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

I'm 100% sure what you're saying here, but if you are pointing out that the instance_id is dropped from the table volume_usage_cache during the migration then this isn't an actual problem and is addressed in comments above.

Briefly, before this patch the value being stored in the field instance_id was invalid. The column is of type integer, but the uuid was being stored there, so the value being stored was a corruption of the uuid and was therefore useless. I don't think it would have made sense to maintain that invalid data, and so we agreed to discard it."}]

commit_message:
Add tenant/ user id to volume usage notifications

Volume usage notifications are generated to enable traffic based billing
on volumes. Include tenant id and user id to make these notifications
more useful to billing systems.

Fixes bug # 1158292

Change-Id: Ic71c10f0fc5d9e8c5a0e2f538de072e7ccca20ee

commit_message:
Improve Python 3.x compatibility

Replace the deprecated except x,y: construct with
except x as y:, as that one works with all Python
versions starting with 2.6.x

Change-Id: I13080cfdad32eaef21aa2707fe5d2818bda68535

messages:
[{'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-04-19 18:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just a note about why I submitted this even though Sam submitted the thread-pool patch.

We ran into a customer problem that we needed to solve quickly where a few requests were preventing other requests from progressing.

This was a simple and expedient fix, and useful for other situation requiring high IOPs on large systems, but we also found it useful for debugging and testing.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-19 19:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27185/1/check/gate-swift-pep8/2160 : SUCCESS
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/27185/1/check/gate-swift-docs/1988/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27185/1/check/gate-swift-python26/2236 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27185/1/check/gate-swift-python26-rhel6/164 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/27185/1/check/gate-swift-python27/2238 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27185/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/13031 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27185/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/18912 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27185/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/12746 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27185/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/928 : FAILURE (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-04-24 03:50:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Oh boy. The day we rid ourselves of eventlet's WSGI can't come soon enough. Note that if you set max_size to 1, then only 1 additional request is blocked by a long-running request: the one that the loop in eventlet.wsgi.py took with accept() while it's blocking on the sem in greenpool.spawn_n(). It's not a ton of outstanding requests being blocked.

I don't see how this conflicts with Sam's stuff, so +1."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-04-24 19:15:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I mostly like it. There's just one tiny change I want: please put the "max_clients" setting in the [app:$KIND-server] section of the sample config files instead of in [DEFAULT]?

It does work where it is now; I just think it'd be clearer to have it in the more-specific location since it only affects the WSGI-using processes, not all the background workers.'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-04-25 03:35:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, I'll apply those changes and re-post. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-04-26 14:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

http://paste.openstack.org/show/9WpIvkAjtPFZSUweo0lO/'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-04-29 15:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

I looked at the (client) port numbers in that tcpdump more carefully.  So it's a second connection which "hangs" so that makes sense.  The one proxy-server still thinks the auth socket is "active".

So I think this behavior results from a "bug" in the swift command-line tool where it doesn't shutdown its auth socket when it's done, despite the fact that the subsequent HEAD, in this case, utilizes a new connection.

It seems like the swift command-line client should either

 * reuse the auth socket, or
 * close the auth socket when it's done authenticating

Does that sound reasonable?  Changing this back to "0 No score".'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-04-29 18:56:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

So how should we handle this? Document, or first submit a patch to the command line client?'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-04-29 19:50:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Maybe two-prong: document this pathological case somewhere so that there's at least plausible deniability if someone runs into this (they /could/ have seen it coming if they're read the docs).

Then file a bug against python-swiftclient pointing out that if the proxy-server is only accepting one socket at a time (for whatever reason), the swift command-line tool will hang."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-04-29 23:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Hrm... I hacked python-swiftclient to close its auth connection, and this allowed my first "stat -v" to succeed.  But subsequent attempts hung.

I ran with "workers = 2" and "max_clients = 1" and same thing... without restarting the proxy-server(s), I get client hangs.

Are you seeing okay behavior, on an ongoing basis with "max_clients = 1"?  I have a suspicion that the waitall() may be a tarpit...'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-04-29 23:30:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I can't duplicate Darrell's issue, either with the swift CLI or with my own custom client (eventlet-wrapped httplib).

The patch lgtm"}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-04-30 01:19:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Okay, should I still file a bug and document when Darrel is seeing? I have not seen this either, since there is a listen backlog, unless of course, the server takes so long to handle one request that it appears the client is blocked.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-04-30 05:11:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

I can't seem to reproduce any problems, myself, when the swift client is hacked to close connections.

Incidentally, the swift client is really bad, all over the place, about not closing connections when it's done with them.  I had to add some funky close() calls to get upload to work (with one uploader thread) against a single proxy-server with max_clients=1.

So I think it's still worth filing a bug against python-swiftclient that it should close http connections more explicitly (either they're delayed getting garbage-collected or some kind of reference is being held on them).

I'm less concerned with any doc change as part of this patch... I don't know what was going on with me and my saio..."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-04-30 05:13:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I think my saio was crazy and the patch is fine.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-30 05:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

[{'created': '2013-04-19 18:24:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add the max_clients parameter to bound clients

The new max_clients parameter allows one full control over the maximum
number of client requests that will be handled by a given worker for
any of the proxy, account, container or object servers.

Lowering the number of clients handled per worker, and raising the
number of workers can lessen the impact that a CPU intensive, or
blocking, request can have on other requests served by the same
worker.

If the maximum number of clients is set to one, then a given worker
will not perform another accept(2) call while processing, allowing
other workers a chance to process it.

DocImpact
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ic01430f7a6c5ff48d7aa349dc86a5f8ac463a420

commit_message:
Add the max_clients parameter to bound clients

The new max_clients parameter allows one full control over the maximum
number of client requests that will be handled by a given worker for
any of the proxy, account, container or object servers.

Lowering the number of clients handled per worker, and raising the
number of workers can lessen the impact that a CPU intensive, or
blocking, request can have on other requests served by the same
worker.

If the maximum number of clients is set to one, then a given worker
will not perform another accept(2) call while processing, allowing
other workers a chance to process it.

DocImpact
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ic01430f7a6c5ff48d7aa349dc86a5f8ac463a420

commit_message:
Deleting a backup removed the backup record from database

Instead we should be marking the backup as deleted so that we have an audit
of all the backups. Backups are now marked deleted in the way that volumes
are.

Fixes bug: 1169943
Fixes bug: 1169857

Change-Id: I52c603be138c0f1d6d411d167977041255ac9053

commit_message:
Call db_sync before starting volume srvc.

Updates the cinder::volume class so that we db sync before
starting the volume service.

Fixes LP Bug #1174055.

Change-Id: I73a030806c1de993cad3f9de725a510a4e9e8315

commit_message:
Require the HTTP config file on all OS.

This is required on newer versions of puppet
otherwise it will automatically remove it.

Change-Id: I1f64ca0d2df497b0da565340b31ce091472ffe76

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-29 23:31:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix rspec tests to support latest apache module

Latest apache module requires new dependencies: concat and firewall.

It now requires those facts:
* operatingsystemrelease
* concat_basedir (required by concat)

Change-Id: Ic561ec756c844c3b3cbe0c441a3d9a0d8c1abe9b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rspec tests to support latest apache module

Latest apache module requires new dependencies: concat and firewall.

It now requires those facts:
* operatingsystemrelease
* concat_basedir (required by concat)

Change-Id: Ic561ec756c844c3b3cbe0c441a3d9a0d8c1abe9b

commit_message:
s/OpenStack LLC/OpenStack Foundation/ in Copyright.

Update Copyright statements that previously said 'OpenStack LLC' to now
say 'OpenStack Foundation'.  Note that the files under openstack/common/
were not updated, as those changes should be brought in by syncing with
oslo-incubator.

Change-Id: I22db9858e899cff72053a4b48100fcc039f5d9dd

commit_message:
Allow deleting multiple images from shell

Adds nargs to image-delete to allow deleting
multiple images through cli.

Adds shell test for multiple image-delete.
Also makes a small correction in fakes to
correct image id of the second image to 2.

Fixes bug #1173511

Change-Id: I167a97cab75a6df544901e965d2cfa3c10a3958e

commit_message:
Add quantum_region_name parameter

This parameter configures the region to use with Quantum. It defaults
to "RegionOne" which is the default used by quantum::keystone::auth.

Change-Id: Ice528825fb2e35016f6fdf68ff5b3beb0ce45d85
