[{'created': '2013-04-29 17:32:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix update snapshot-quotas on delete.

The merge from stable to RC of the snapshot quota
fixes missed the new CONF usage and as a result the
setting was always ignored on delete and therefore
quotas were not decremented on delete.

This patch changes CONF back to FLAGS for that call and
resolves the issue.

Fixes bug: 1173365

Change-Id: I7af69d5078ebcc5547e08d543a2dcfd0ca3f6c4b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix update snapshot-quotas on delete.

The merge from stable to RC of the snapshot quota
fixes missed the new CONF usage and as a result the
setting was always ignored on delete and therefore
quotas were not decremented on delete.

This patch changes CONF back to FLAGS for that call and
resolves the issue.

Fixes bug: 1173365

Change-Id: I7af69d5078ebcc5547e08d543a2dcfd0ca3f6c4b

This changeset seems to squash many unrelated changes together, so I -1 because of that, and also, I don't like adding query.one() like this, so that also gets a -1.

I would prefer to see this as a few separate patches:

- "Move instance_type_extra_specs_* to other instance_type methods" should be a separate (and trivial) patch
- "Remove session parameter from public methods" should be separate if possible.
- All the performance optimizations can be lumped together. This probably depends on the "remove session parameter" patch.
- "Change first() to one()" should definitely be a separate patch, since this is a substantial behavioral change -- I agree with it in principle, but not as presently implemented. Let's talk about that once it is in a separate review.


I know it's a bit of extra work, but it will make the history easier to understand.'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-04-24 09:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-24 10:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-04-04 22:18:48.000000000', 'message': "Refactor work with db.instance_type_* methods

Move instance_type_extra_specs_* to other instance_type methods

Remove session parameter from public methods:
  *) instace_type_get
  *) instance_type_get_by_name
  *) instance_type_get_by_flavor_id

instance_type_destroy performance optimization:
  Get instance_type_ref without unnecessary extra specs

instance_type_destroy fix bug:
  We didn't delete instance_type_projects when we destroy instance_type

instance_type_access_get_by_flavor_id performance optimization:
was:
1 query get instance_type with joined extra_specs
1 query lazy load instance_type_projects
now:
1 query get instance_type id
1 query get all instance_type_projects that correspond to id

instance_type_access_add performance optimization:
was:
1 query get instance_type with extraspecs
1 query add instance_type_access
now:
1 get only instance_type id
1 query add instance_type_access

instance_type_access_remove performance optimization:
Same as in instance_type_access_add

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: I6d1456289a97c46d7e8c9345474396c08e053970

commit_message:
Refactor work with db.instance_type_* methods

Remove session parameter from public methods:
  *) instace_type_get
  *) instance_type_get_by_name
  *) instance_type_get_by_flavor_id

instance_type_destroy performance optimization:
  Get instance_type_ref without unnecessary extra specs

instance_type_access_get_by_flavor_id performance optimization:
was:
1 query get instance_type with joined extra_specs
1 query lazy load instance_type_projects
now:
1 query get instance_type id
1 query get all instance_type_projects that correspond to id

instance_type_access_add performance optimization:
was:
1 query get instance_type with extraspecs
1 query add instance_type_access
now:
1 get only instance_type id
1 query add instance_type_access

instance_type_access_remove performance optimization:
Same as in instance_type_access_add

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: I6d1456289a97c46d7e8c9345474396c08e053970

commit_message:
Destroy conntrack table on source host during migration

If a VM migrates from hostA to hostB, there will still be connections
in the conntrack table of the hostA. If, for any reason, VM is migrated back
to the hostA, while those connections are still in conntrack table, persistent
connections (such is ssh) to VM, from outside, will get dropped. They get
dropped cause hostA was expecting different packets and cause of that requires
establishing new connection. By dropping conntrack table entries for VM
we make sure that connection flow is not interupted by old packets.

Change-Id: If8e146e05914e9febd6fc40a1d8085306c1244ea

[{'created': '2013-04-17 14:34:19.000000000', 'message': 'Use ttl indexes as message scrubber

This patch makes use of mongodb's ttl collections as a way for cleaning
expired messages. In order to implement a "dynamic ttl" collection, the
expires field is literally hacked.

When a new message is creted, it's expire field is set to:
    now + ttl - MAX_TTL

The above makes the message last at most `TTL` seconds.

As for claims, the expires management didn't change, however, it now
uses datetime's instead of TS to be consistent with messages ttl.

Implements blueprint storage-mongodb

commit_message:
Use ttl indexes as message scrubber

This patch makes use of mongodb's ttl collections as a way for cleaning
expired messages. In order to implement a "dynamic ttl" collection, the
expires field is literally hacked.

When a new message is creted, it's expire field is set to:
    now - ttl

The above makes the message last at most `TTL` seconds.

As for claims, the expires management didn't change, however, it now
uses datetime's instead of TS to be consistent with messages ttl.

Implements blueprint storage-mongodb

Change-Id: Ia1c5c2ca37a5fb3732d6cfa99ce13da7d376b02c

[{'created': '2013-04-22 01:27:32.000000000', 'message': "ec2 CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes status mapping

'attaching' and 'detaching' are not valid ec2 API volume status
values. Instead map them both to 'in-use'.

Note this will not pass the devstack exercises until
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27244/ goes through

Fixes bug #1074901

Change-Id: Id3dfd525d24d622aab5e350e42713fdb7671b31e
"}]
commit_message:
ec2 CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes status mapping

'attaching' and 'detaching' are not valid ec2 API volume status
values. Instead map them both to 'in-use'.

Note this will not pass the devstack exercises until
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27244/ goes through

Fixes bug #1074901

Change-Id: Id3dfd525d24d622aab5e350e42713fdb7671b31e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-18 06:23:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ec2 CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes status

In admin context CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes returns
extraneous information such as project_id, host, instance
data etc. This results in output which is not compatible
with the ec2 API. This change removes the addition
of the extra information.

Also fixes the bug where the status returned can
be detaching or attaching which are not valid
in the EC2 API. Maps them to in-use instead.

Fixes bug #1074901

Change-Id: I48a96fbfe4bb2e3da9514d688638ecdf3a168303
'}, {'created': '2013-04-19 03:36:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix ec2 CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes status

In admin context CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes returns
extraneous information such as project_id, host, instance
data etc. This results in output which is not compatible
with the ec2 API. This change removes the addition
of the extra information.

This only partially fixes bug #1074901 as mapping the internal
volume states to ones specified by the ec2 api results in the devstack
euca.sh exercises to fail. But that can't be fixed until the fix
in this patch is through as the extraneous information returned by DescribeVolumes
causes euca-describe-volumes to not to show the attachment state for
a volume which is needed by the euca exercises.

Change-Id: I48a96fbfe4bb2e3da9514d688638ecdf3a168303
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ec2 CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes status

In admin context CreateVolumes/DescribeVolumes returns
extraneous information such as project_id, host, instance
data etc. This results in output which is not compatible
with the ec2 API. This change removes the addition
of the extra information.

This only partially fixes bug #1074901 as mapping the internal
volume states to ones specified by the ec2 api results in the devstack
euca.sh exercises to fail. But that can't be fixed until the fix
in this patch is through as the extraneous information returned by DescribeVolumes
causes euca-describe-volumes to not to show the attachment state for
a volume which is needed by the euca exercises.

Change-Id: I48a96fbfe4bb2e3da9514d688638ecdf3a168303

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-20 21:55:31.000000000', 'message': "Speed up scheduler filters a tiny bit (isolated_hosts_filter)

If the isolated_hosts_filter is badly configured, it'll run a little
faster now.

It's faster to do that single CONF.lookup and find things are bad, than
to do all those other dict lookups first, then find we're badly
configured.

Change-Id: Ibe6725e39a771b31fdf49513335275deba33e96b
"}, {'created': '2013-04-23 00:59:53.000000000', 'message': "Speed up scheduler filters a tiny bit (isolated_hosts_filter)

If the isolated_hosts_filter is badly configured, it'll run a little
faster now.

It's faster to do that single CONF.lookup and find things are bad, than
to do all those other dict lookups first, then find we're badly
configured.

Change-Id: Ibe6725e39a771b31fdf49513335275deba33e96b
"}, {'created': '2013-04-23 01:08:01.000000000', 'message': "Speed up scheduler filters a tiny bit (isolated_hosts_filter)

If the isolated_hosts_filter is badly configured, it'll run a little
faster now.

It's faster to do that single CONF.lookup and find things are bad, than
to do all those other dict lookups first, then find we're badly
configured.

Change-Id: Ibe6725e39a771b31fdf49513335275deba33e96b
"}, {'created': '2013-04-23 01:51:17.000000000', 'message': "Speed up scheduler filters a tiny bit (isolated_hosts_filter)

If the isolated_hosts_filter is badly configured, it'll run a little
faster now.

It's faster to do that single CONF.lookup and find things are bad, than
to do all those other dict lookups first, then find we're badly
configured.

Also the behaviour has been changed:
 * In the past if there was a list of isolated_images in the config, and
   no hosts, it would never allow a build with one of those images.
 * After this patch, ommitting a list of hosts is assumed to be a bad
   configuration, and the filter will allow all builds

Change-Id: Ibe6725e39a771b31fdf49513335275deba33e96b
"}, {'created': '2013-04-23 02:45:33.000000000', 'message': "Speed up scheduler filters a tiny bit (isolated_hosts_filter)

If the isolated_hosts_filter is badly configured, it'll run a little
faster now.

It's faster to do that single CONF.lookup and find things are bad, than
to do all those other dict lookups first, then find we're badly
configured.

Also the behaviour has been changed:
 * In the past if there was a list of isolated_images in the config, and
   no hosts, it would never allow a build with one of those images.
 * After this patch, ommitting a list of hosts is assumed to be a bad
   configuration, and the filter will allow all builds

Change-Id: Ibe6725e39a771b31fdf49513335275deba33e96b
"}, {'created': '2013-04-26 02:36:05.000000000', 'message': "Adds tests for isolated_hosts_filter

The isolated_hosts_filter takes two configuration options. This patch
adds three tests defining the behaviour for when one or more of these
variables are missing.

This patch speeds things up a bit when the isolated_images option is
missing, making it do less dict lookups to come up with the same answer.

Matrix of isolated_hosts_filter changes:

+----------------------+--------------------+--------------+
| Config options       | Before patch       | After        |
+----------------------+--------------------+--------------+
| 0        + 0         | No filtering       | Same as B4   |
|                      | no tests           | Tested       |
+----------------------+--------------------+--------------+
| 0        + iso_image | Block iso'd images | Same as B4   |

+----------------------+--------------------+--------------+

+----------------------+--------------------+--------------+

Change-Id: Ibe6725e39a771b31fdf49513335275deba33e96b

commit_message:
Adds tests for isolated_hosts_filter

The isolated_hosts_filter takes two configuration options. This patch
adds three tests defining the behaviour for when one or more of these
variables are missing.

This patch speeds things up a bit when the isolated_images option is
missing, making it do less dict lookups to come up with the same answer.

Matrix of isolated_hosts_filter changes:

+----------------------+--------------------+--------------+
| Config options       | Before patch       | After        |
+----------------------+--------------------+--------------+
| 0        + 0         | No filtering       | Same as B4   |
|                      | no tests           | Tested       |
+----------------------+--------------------+--------------+
| 0        + iso_image | Block iso'd images | Same as B4   |
|                      | no tests           | Tested       |
+----------------------+--------------------+--------------+
| iso_host + 0         | Block iso'd images | Same as b4   |
|                      | no tests           | Tested       |
+----------------------+--------------------+--------------+
| iso_host + iso_image | Block matched h+i  | Same as b4   |
|                      | Tested             | Tested       |
+----------------------+--------------------+--------------+

Change-Id: Ibe6725e39a771b31fdf49513335275deba33e96b

commit_message:
Improve Python 3.x compatibility

Some mechancical replacement of the deprecated except x,y:
construct with except x as y, which works with any Python
version >= 2.6

Looks fine to me.

Musings on the change, none-the-less, please do not take with any weight...

It seems that generating a uuid() already involves getting the time, so fetching the time again becomes yet another drag on request handling (albeit small).  Additionally, relying on uuid1 would be one less bit of code to maintain, though perhaps the act of getting the node and sequence value offset that ...'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-20 04:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Given that the other referenced review is in the "Abandoned" state at the moment, I'm happy to make progress on reviewing this one.

This mostly looks good to me; my one concern is the use of a dot in the transaction ID. They used to be matchable with /tx[0-9a-f]+/, but now they're not. (Yes, it's still /tx\S+/, but people might not realize it.)

Personally, I don't have any code that'll break if that format changes, and it provides a nice visual separation between the random part and the time-based part, so I like it. I just want to raise it as a possible concern to see if anyone would actually be affected and give them a chance to bikeshed^Wspeak up.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-04-24 18:19:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-20 04:00:07.000000000', 'message': 'Included time inside trans_id

Including the time inside the trans_id can be very useful for knowing
which logs to scan. I made this so the trans_id will still be the
same length (the randomness of the remaining uuid4 should be enough
for this use). I also added a convenience function for retreiving the
time information from a trans_id:

    $ python -c 'from swift.common.utils import trans_id_info; print trans_id_info("tx1df4ff4f55ea45f7b2ec2.0051720c06")'
    1366428678 Sat Apr 20 03:31:18 2013 UTC

If you're wondering why I just didn't use uuid1 that embeds the time,
it's because it also embeds uuid.getnode() which "The first time this
runs, it may launch a separate program, which could be quite slow."
We could supply our own getnode value, but then we have to guarantee
its uniqueness, yada yada yada.

Change-Id: Ie33caf1e839fd1a21b01a928a8b301126bef7396
'}, {'created': '2013-04-29 13:57:43.000000000', 'message': 'Included time inside trans_id

Including the time inside the trans_id can be very useful for knowing
which logs to scan. I made this so the trans_id will still be the
same length (the randomness of the remaining uuid4 should be enough
for this use). I also added a convenience function for retreiving the
time information from a trans_id.

If you're wondering why I just didn't use uuid1 that embeds the time,
it's because it also embeds uuid.getnode() which "The first time this
runs, it may launch a separate program, which could be quite slow."
We could supply our own getnode value, but then we have to guarantee
its uniqueness, yada yada yada.

Change-Id: Ie33caf1e839fd1a21b01a928a8b301126bef7396
'}]
commit_message:
Included time inside trans_id

Including the time inside the trans_id can be very useful for knowing
which logs to scan. I made this so the trans_id will still be the
same length (the randomness of the remaining uuid4 should be enough
for this use). I also added a convenience function for retreiving the
time information from a trans_id.

If you're wondering why I just didn't use uuid1 that embeds the time,
it's because it also embeds uuid.getnode() which "The first time this
runs, it may launch a separate program, which could be quite slow."
We could supply our own getnode value, but then we have to guarantee
its uniqueness, yada yada yada.

Change-Id: Ie33caf1e839fd1a21b01a928a8b301126bef7396

commit_message:
Define the new pagination API in storage base.

1. Listing operations interactively yield an iterator and a marker;
2. Listing queue now only support forward listing.

Change-Id: I6fe57228344518c16757b2a4175abb7bf529b513
Implements: blueprint storage-base

commit_message:
Base-36 encode UID's

This effectively makes the string lengths of UID's shorter while
maintaining the existing amount of entropy in the result.

- a base 16 encoded uuid.uuid4() value is 32 chars
- a base 36 encoded uuid.uuid4() value is 25 chars

Change-Id: I543a2feeaae03ef06b2b506f39726a0b665e0264

"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-04-29 16:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Do not merge

There is a problem the way this implemnted WRT to minimum.  If you have a length of 1, and geenrate a uuid.uid4)_  then chop off the last three bytes, you may always get the same value of the uid:  you may end up getting the MAC address portion, or some other machine fixed piece.

In general, it is not wise to cut up UUIDs.  I would suggest that we limit the length values to multiples of 4, and only provide appended complete UUID4 values.  If we need some thing more granular, we should use a different approach, and we should provide a separate API for it that the user can chose via paste.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-04-29 17:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-25 09:28:17.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes race condition of deleting floating ip

Fixes bug #1172599
reproduce steps:
1. create an instance
2. get a floating ip from pool
3. associate the ip to instance created at step 1
4. delete the instance and the ip at a very little interval

reason may be that:
1. the action of delete ip find the ip is associated to a fixed ip at
   first(at api level)
2. and then the fixed ip is released when the instance is deleted
3. so nova-network manager findes this issue and raises
   exception.FloatingIpNotAssociated(address=floating_address)

Change-Id: I253d0b240451e8a728532639e9857894f6fc6870
'}, {'created': '2013-04-26 02:17:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes race condition of deleting floating ip

Fixes bug #1172599
reproduce steps:
1. create an instance
2. get a floating ip from pool
3. associate the ip to instance created at step 1
4. delete the instance and the ip at a very little interval

reason may be that:
1. the action of delete ip find the ip is associated to a fixed ip at
   first(at api level)
2. and then the fixed ip is released when the instance is deleted
3. so nova-network manager findes this issue and raises
   exception.FloatingIpNotAssociated(address=floating_address)

Change-Id: I253d0b240451e8a728532639e9857894f6fc6870
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes race condition of deleting floating ip

Fixes bug #1172599
reproduce steps:
1. create an instance
2. get a floating ip from pool
3. associate the ip to instance created at step 1
4. delete the instance and the ip at a very little interval

reason may be that:
1. the action of delete ip find the ip is associated to a fixed ip at
   first(at api level)
2. and then the fixed ip is released when the instance is deleted
3. so nova-network manager findes this issue and raises
   exception.FloatingIpNotAssociated(address=floating_address)

Change-Id: I253d0b240451e8a728532639e9857894f6fc6870

commit_message:
Fix missing kernel output via VNC/Spice on boot

Bug 1164021

Use both ttys0 and tty0 as console options to the kernel during
boot.

Change-Id: I0365ff7cad021fb6ca551651d00d58297087e95e

commit_message:
Improved autocreate testing

Increase testing coverage and make some of the test more accurate
(Some of the tests included too many responses from the account
servers that were not used by the test)

Change-Id: Ide2e0fcb89d5905e70d3111f7ac57b1cff23a99c
Fixes: Bug #1172152

Some general comments.

I withheld the time originally because it just doesn't look good.  I see no reason not to display it, but it would also be nice to format it a bit more nicely.

Also, the output is sorted by the db query in Nova that retrieves the actions.  I see no problem with sorting it in the client, but it is already sorted."}, {'account_id': 6761, 'date': '2013-04-23 02:03:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Andrew, thanks for your review.

The output is using print_list in utils.py, and the default value is specified sortby_index=0.
Therefore it is sorted of 'Action' by the client at present.
I think that it is necessary to specify the 'sortby_index'."}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-04-23 14:53:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

leo-toyoda: Thanks for pointing out the default sort behaviour.  I was not aware of that, and think that's actually a poor design.

But as others have mentioned, a test for ensuring it's sorted properly would be good, otherwise it looks good(except for the formatting I wish could be nicer)."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-04-29 11:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Since no one else has -1'd for the test, I'll go ahead and approve, and if we decide we really must have a test, that can be done as a separate patch :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-29 15:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

and time of the specified instance actions.
This patch fixes the sort of 'Start_time' and add field.

Change-Id: If9e6aaf8eb631819bf8e1c915cb1da64d6fcd2f4

commit_message:
Fix nova instance-action-list output field and order

'instance-action-list' is not possible to identify the order
and time of the specified instance actions.
This patch fixes the sort of 'Start_time' and add field.

Change-Id: If9e6aaf8eb631819bf8e1c915cb1da64d6fcd2f4
Implements: blueprint instance-action-list-output

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-24 21:07:04.000000000', 'message': "Make it easier to debug badly broken tests.

If you manage to break a proxy server so badly that it can't even
return headers, then in test/unit/proxy/test_server.py,
readuntil2crlfs() will spin forever, killing your laptop battery and
providing zero help figuring out what's wrong.

This test-only change makes it so that, should readuntil2crlfs() run
out of data before getting its two CRLFs, it raises an exception that
tells you what it did manage to get, and does so in a finite amount of
time.

Change-Id: Ieacd18ce7f4d35a4960100d5fc3a0f910cb406ac
"}]
commit_message:
Make it easier to debug badly broken tests.

If you manage to break a proxy server so badly that it can't even
return headers, then in test/unit/proxy/test_server.py,
readuntil2crlfs() will spin forever, killing your laptop battery and
providing zero help figuring out what's wrong.

This test-only change makes it so that, should readuntil2crlfs() run
out of data before getting its two CRLFs, it raises an exception that
tells you what it did manage to get, and does so in a finite amount of
time.

Change-Id: Ieacd18ce7f4d35a4960100d5fc3a0f910cb406ac

subject: Bug # 1172337 - Consolidated common files to "common" directory.
messages:
[{'account_id': 6772, 'date': '2013-04-27 19:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6772, 'date': '2013-04-27 20:21:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This one is a bit more invasive than the first. I discovered that while the VNC content is shared between both guides (and as such is moved to common in this patch) the content relating to Cinder is not actually included into the compute administration guide (or any other guide except the install guide).

Based on this I've moved these files into the openstack-install directory rather than common content."}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-04-28 00:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Looks OK.

The configuring nova volume content probably needs a look over for pre-cinder stuff anyway.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-04-29 14:01:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Are you planning to get this through before release tomorrow? I'd prefer less disruption on a planned release candidate branch, if possible."}, {'account_id': 6772, 'date': '2013-04-29 14:33:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ideally yes, though obviously I would have liked to get this change together earlier than I did so my apologies for that. If I'm honest I was somewhat hesitant to submit patches primarily targeted at making life easier for Publican users in the first place and have been doing my best to avoid it.

That said this change, combined with the other one submitted and merged under this bug, removes a fairly complicated edge case from the transforms required to get things building under Publican (being able to assume/hope that all common content is under "common" makes life a lot easier :)). If it can't be merged I will have to revisit the transforms and see if I can come up with something to handle it and/or maintain the patch downstream. Ultimately you are in a much better position than I to judge if the change is too disruptive or not given the timing :).

We're a bit behind the curve here but will be trying to get ahead of it and contribute more meaningful changes in the Havana cycle.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-04-29 14:55:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Okay, I'm fine with getting this into the stable/grizzly branch as it sure makes it easier to continue refactoring. Let me review and I'll merge today."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-04-29 15:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-29 15:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Starting gate jobs.

commit_message:
Bug # 1172337 - Consolidated common files to "common" directory.

Consolidated XML files, and their dependencies, used by both the install and
compute admin guides in the "common" folder. Where a file was identified
as being used by only one of the two guides it was moved to that guide.

Change-Id: I2b6a8e711f08883a1565d671b8292c9ce5778237

commit_message:
heat engine : register options before using them

Fix regression caused by the __init__.py refactoring, which means
we try to use cfg.CONF.host before registering it.

fixes bug #1174302

Change-Id: Iff4d75f53e242d7df8c7071cbeeead034a7ad9b0

messages:

'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-04-28 00:30:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(36 inline comments)

Comments inline about :

- white spaces
- Why do you change IP addresses ?
- Why do you delete Hypervisor page ?

Thank's for the work !"}, {'account_id': 6859, 'date': '2013-04-28 00:47:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'll clean up the white spaces, thanks. 

The hypervisor page was removed because it was not needed. Live migration is not needed in this guide and a lot of the packages installed were redundant as the nova-compute package handles them. All relevant info that was on the hypervisor page was transferred to the next page. 

IP addresses were changed to use more sane subnets. 7.7.7.x isn't the best subnet to use for illustrative/example purposes. Plus, the chances of someone following this guide in a lab environment where they can use the same subnets is more likely than them owning the 7.7.7.x subnet. 

The redhat/fedora stuff is not my work. If I have time, I will review it. But it's already been merged in. 

Please let me know if you have any other questions!
Joe"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-04-28 04:35:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (11 inline comments)

Wow Joe, great work. I have some typos noted throughout and a question (HVM, is that a real thing?) I can test more but this is a great update.'}, {'account_id': 6859, 'date': '2013-04-28 06:07:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Thank you for the corrections! I have a small patchset coming up.

I also just figured out how to properly cleanup/format blocks in Oxygene, so my docs from here on out will be a bit more conforming.

I will be away at a conference until mid-week, so if anyone can get to the typos, whitespaces, consistency, etc that have been pointed out, I'd really appreciate it."}, {'account_id': 6859, 'date': '2013-04-28 06:08:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-28 06:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

The ops guide originally discouraged block-based live migration.
However, there is now an improved implementation of block-based
live migration, so the wording has been changed to no longer

the authors don't have firsthand experience with it.

commit_message:
New block-based live migration

The ops guide originally discouraged block-based live migration.
However, there is now an improved implementation of block-based
live migration, so the wording has been changed to no longer
actively dissuade people from using it, while acknowledging that
the authors don't have firsthand experience with it.

Change-Id: Ie9ec49aa3b31f41b5e65087cac5037c78c021c69

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-29 10:54:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix flakey TestS3ImageService bug

test_show_translates_image_state_correctly sometimes fails
on some systems. This is caused because the ec2utils cache
is reset after the test rather than before the test (but after
the images are manually added to the db in setUp). This change
resets the ec2utils cache in the correct place

Fixes bug 1174266

Change-Id: I2ff9b71c932c913ca0423b1de4c04ca7d9de59cf
'}]
commit_message:
Fix flakey TestS3ImageService bug

test_show_translates_image_state_correctly sometimes fails
on some systems. This is caused because the ec2utils cache
is reset after the test rather than before the test (but after
the images are manually added to the db in setUp). This change
resets the ec2utils cache in the correct place

Fixes bug 1174266

Change-Id: I2ff9b71c932c913ca0423b1de4c04ca7d9de59cf

commit_message:
Add heat-jeos TDL files and oz wrapper script

Import heat-jeos oz TDL files, and a utility script which wraps the
commands required to process them.

The heat-jeos.sh script is a simple (if not quite as fully featured)
replacement for the heat-jeos tool, meaning we can deprecate it.

fixes bug #1171602

Change-Id: I23416d1e3c7a5329c2076db6fbe6f51d44720766

2 things.

1. Needs a bug associated with this patch.

2. I think we should approach this differently. We should keep the debug statement there incase we need to manually recreate the issue with a single command. This will include the auth token in the header for the curl command that is printed in debug mode.

I agree that the token is too large but this is because the keystone defaults to PKI and not UUID. This can be changed with a configuration in keystone.conf.

commit_message:
Do not display the contents of X-Auth-Token

* This replaces the debug output of the client headers
  with ******* in place of the actual token. Cutting
  down on verbose debugging output from failed tests.

Change-Id: I36c4d37bba118edb78198aa297bbaf096f0793eb

[{'created': '2013-04-23 22:55:01.000000000', 'message': 'Do not initialize anything during import phase

The structure of the program is compromised by doing too much logic in
the import phase. We can read the code more cleanly if we can see where
the intended initialization code is called. This may make tests slightly
more tedious to write, but that should be handled by writing generic
fixtures which can be reused for exactly this purpose.

Change-Id: I1d221e2f90d1f6e89717a37d2128caabd077d30a
'}, {'created': '2013-04-24 18:25:02.000000000', 'message': 'Do not initialize anything during import phase

The structure of the program is compromised by doing too much logic in
the import phase. We can read the code more cleanly if we can see where
the intended initialization code is called. This may make tests slightly
more tedious to write, but that should be handled by writing generic
fixtures which can be reused for exactly this purpose.

Change-Id: I1d221e2f90d1f6e89717a37d2128caabd077d30a
'}]
commit_message:
Do not initialize anything during import phase

The structure of the program is compromised by doing too much logic in
the import phase. We can read the code more cleanly if we can see where
the intended initialization code is called. This may make tests slightly
more tedious to write, but that should be handled by writing generic
fixtures which can be reused for exactly this purpose.

Change-Id: I1d221e2f90d1f6e89717a37d2128caabd077d30a

commit_message:
Remove calls to policy.enforce from plugin and db logic

Blueprint make-authz-orthogonal

This patch implementes item #2 of the blueprint
Remove calls to policy.enforce when the policy check can be performed
safely at the API level, and modify policy.json to this aim.
This patch does not address enforce calls in the agent scheduler
extension, as that extension is currently not defined as a quantum.v2.api
resource class.
This patch also adds an API-level test case for the provider networks
extension, which was missing in Quantum and was necessary to validate
the API behaviour with the default policy settings.

Change-Id: I1c20a5870279bc5fce4470c90a210eae59675b0c

Hi. Just so you know, situations like this (but not this specific example) were just discussed in the oslo session at the design summit. The feeling from the oslo team is that batch imports are a bad idea, and that it is the responsibility of the person who changes an oslo file to send out reviews to fix all of the users...

Thus, this sort of review is going to become more common if moniker enters incubation. I would think that having a good history of landing this sort of update would be something that the TC would consider when deciding whether to move a project to integrated status.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-29 11:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

strutils imports openstack.common.log that depends on
notifier, rpc, eventlet, etc. This import was inherited
from old utils.py and is not used in strutils.

All these numerous dependencies are not desirable in such
small projects as novaclient that needs strutils only.

Change-Id: I7761fb53ab58bd8801448c56648dace14ca7dc89
Fixes: bug #1174215
'}]
commit_message:
Do not import openstack.common.log in strutils

strutils imports openstack.common.log that depends on
notifier, rpc, eventlet, etc. This import was inherited
from old utils.py and is not used in strutils.

All these numerous dependencies are not desirable in such
small projects as novaclient that needs strutils only.

Change-Id: I7761fb53ab58bd8801448c56648dace14ca7dc89
Fixes: bug #1174215

commit_message:
Add tests for LinuxBridge and OVS agents

Fixes bug 988067

Patch introduces some more unit tests for LinuxBridge
and OVS agents.

Change-Id: I95b8856e75b303520af654b08854c6bd0bc5d7ea

Matthias: I wonder if you need to have the exact boundary defined in the pip-requires to match the value in openstack/requirements?

I think having the pip-requires to be updated would be really nice.  If the keystone-client being installed is old, I want it to fail early during setup rather hitting it at runtime.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-04-26 07:01:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

lin-hua, 

I absolutely agree, I will ask on openstack-devel list. We have the same issue for the django-1.5 update as well.

Still, is looks painful to have requirements set at two separate places. Currently, they differ (at least for python-keystoneclient)'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-04-26 19:05:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Remove workaround for keystone

This was required for an ancient keystone version, we can consider
this as solved in H release.

Fixes bug 1174194

Change-Id: Iecee7f3af01cc18ce44d3cf1ecc1b72be8fa765b

commit_message:
Adds xml hadoop config generating

 * Xml config provisioning is done for core, hdfs, mapred xmls
 * Removed xslt transformations from data nodes
 * At now Savanna contains default configs for Hadoop in resources/
 * This version of default configs is applied for Hadoop 1.1.1
 * No needs to distribute new cloud image

Change-Id: Ia13e9231d75bbac3cff6291d477b72d727e21c71
Fixes: bug #1169900

subject: Allow allocating specific floating ip for admins
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 261, 'name': 'Salvatore Orlando', 'email': 'salv.orlando@gmail.com', 'username': 'salvatore-orlando'}, {'_account_id': 447, 'name': 'dan wendlandt', 'email': 'dan@nicira.com', 'username': 'danwent'}, {'_account_id': 490, 'name': 'Sumit Naiksatam', 'email': 'sumitnaiksatam@gmail.com', 'username': 'snaiksat'}, {'_account_id': 1119, 'name': 'Christoph Thiel', 'email': 'ct@kki.org', 'username': 'cthiel-suse'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2031, 'name': 'Nachi Ueno', 'email': 'nati.ueno@gmail.com', 'username': 'nati-ueno'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 2874, 'name': 'yong sheng gong', 'email': 'gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gongysh'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/1/check/gate-quantum-pep8/5273 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/1/check/gate-quantum-docs/4570 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/1/check/gate-quantum-python26/4950 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/1/check/gate-quantum-python27/4957 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/11412 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I think this is more of a spec bug than a code bug.  We've talked about allowing an admin users to request a specific floating IP, but definitely not regular users.  There's also the fact that we're making an API behavior change extremely late in the release cycle.  I'd like Salvatore to comment here, but until then, I'm not ok with this merging."}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't believe the existing test cases will test this change. Can you please confirm that no new test cases are required?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/2/check/gate-quantum-pep8/5338 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/2/check/gate-quantum-docs/4634 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/2/check/gate-quantum-python26/5014 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/2/check/gate-quantum-python27/5021 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/11706 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dan, Sumit, I have updated the patch set with unit tests and also made sure that only admins can request a specific floating_ip_address. For us, this is an important fix that would have helped a lot in the past, where we had to use very hacky workarounds. Looking forward to your comments & reviews!'}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/3/check/gate-quantum-pep8/5341 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/3/check/gate-quantum-docs/4638 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/3/check/gate-quantum-python26/5018 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/3/check/gate-quantum-python27/5025 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/23327/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/11715 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

API-wise, this change is backward compatible, and so it's ok to propose it.
Still, this isn't really a bug fix, but a mini-feature, which should have been proposed by Feb 26th, I think.

The current patch does not return an error if the requested IP is already allocated. Also, admin-only check should probably not be performed using context.is_admin but we should rather leverage the policy engine as the other extensions do.

Summarizing, even if this change i not extensive, I think it should be oved to Havana."}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2013-04-29 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Salvatore, how can the policy framework be used on a per-parameter basis?

floating_ip_address attribute is specified in the request body.  If the
requested floating IP address does not fall in the external network's subnet
range, a 400 error will be returned.  If the requested floating IP address
is already in use, a 409 error code will be returned.

commit_message:
Allow allocating specific floating ip for admins

bug 1138730

As https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Quantum/APIv2-specification documents: An
address for the floating ip will be automatically allocated, unless the
floating_ip_address attribute is specified in the request body.  If the
requested floating IP address does not fall in the external network's subnet
range, a 400 error will be returned.  If the requested floating IP address
is already in use, a 409 error code will be returned.

Change-Id: I273a6c73e591d60eb660565bfc654d277e9f7771

commit_message:
Ensure polkit config is written for RHEL6 as well

Separate F18 polkit config and ensure it's written out for RHEL6, or
you get authentication errors with libvirt

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-18 22:07:50.000000000', 'message': 'Push fallocate() down into mkstemp(); use known size

Towards defining the DiskFile class, or something like it, as an API
for the low level disk acesses, we push the fallocate() system call
down into the DiskFile.mkstemp() method. This allows another
implementation of DiskFile to decide to use or not use fallocate().

Change-Id: Ib4d2ee1f971e4e20e53ca4b41892c5e44ecc88d5
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-04-19 04:34:41.000000000', 'message': 'Push fallocate() down into mkstemp(); use known size

Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-04-23 20:09:46.000000000', 'message': 'Push fallocate() down into mkstemp(); use known size

for the low level disk acesses, we push the fallocate() system call
down into the DiskFile.mkstemp() method. This allows another
implementation of DiskFile to decide to use or not use fallocate().

Change-Id: Ib4d2ee1f971e4e20e53ca4b41892c5e44ecc88d5
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Push fallocate() down into mkstemp(); use known size

Towards defining the DiskFile class, or something like it, as an API
for the low level disk acesses, we push the fallocate() system call
down into the DiskFile.mkstemp() method. This allows another
implementation of DiskFile to decide to use or not use fallocate().

Change-Id: Ib4d2ee1f971e4e20e53ca4b41892c5e44ecc88d5
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

There's actually a very explicit reason we *don't* display the messages on the login screen: it can be a security hole and/or hugely confusing by way of displaying accumulated messages that should only be presented to a logged in user to whomever next lands on that login page with that browser.

Somewhere there's a ticket about having a better way to filter messages that should *only* be displayed on the login screen, but that hasn't been implemented yet. I'm open to other ideas/implementations, but for now putting the messages back into the login screen isn't an option."}, {'account_id': 6610, 'date': '2013-04-24 01:41:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-24 02:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Remove the term 'syspanel' from docs

Since the refactorization of syspanel occurred at
the very early Folsom days, the docs should reflect this too.

commit_message:
Remove engine_topic configuration option

Fixes bug #1173575

This is currently broken since heat-engine always listens to the
'engine' topic and there isn't actually a good use case for this to be
configurable, so let's kill it.

Change-Id: I35c0292c921f81857f80a7f111df5ac330d54ecf

[{'created': '2013-04-20 16:51:29.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Flags usage from cinder.volume.driver

cinder.volume.driver was using a mix of FLAGS and the
new conf options for multi-backend.  The result was failure
of multi-backend configrations to set the iscsi_helper
option.

This updates the driver.py file to use the OSLO.cfg and fixes the
check for iscsi_helper check in the initialize_connection call,
which was undefined.

Fixes bug: 1169928

Change-Id: Ia1678893f32a9d08a695f055f59f7296e17d9d78
(cherry picked from commit 168b7566a51807dfd42f873c810440472aed7171)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Flags usage from cinder.volume.driver

cinder.volume.driver was using a mix of FLAGS and the
new conf options for multi-backend.  The result was failure
of multi-backend configrations to set the iscsi_helper
option.

This updates the driver.py file to use the OSLO.cfg and fixes the
check for iscsi_helper check in the initialize_connection call,
which was undefined.

Fixes bug: 1169928

Change-Id: Ia1678893f32a9d08a695f055f59f7296e17d9d78
(cherry picked from commit 168b7566a51807dfd42f873c810440472aed7171)

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-04-03 15:23:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm a bit confused, was there something broken before? Was there a performance problem before? If the goal is just to simplify, I'm not sure that goal is reached since now there's another way to do locking so an extra block of code to understand and maintain.

That said, something like this should have its own set of tests, if nothing else to better document the expected behavior. Also, "commited" should be "committed".'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-04-10 15:32:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@gholt:

The existing mechanism does the following:
1. Create a LockFile
2. Fcntl.flock the LockFile (pooling - non blocking)
3. Creates a temporary file
4. Writes to the temporary file
5. Renames the temporary file to the real path
6. Delete the LockFile 

The new mechanism:
1. Creates a temporary file (pooling - non blocking)
2. Writes to the temporary file
3. Renames the temporary file to the real path'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-18 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-03 13:58:00.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify hashes.pkl use of path_lock

Adds support for OpenLockedFile context manager that acquires a virtual lock
on a dest file by allowing a single updater to create an updated file
(dest.new). Updaters will block until any previous updater has completed
(as signaled by dest.new being removed), or the timeout time has expired,
whichever occurs first.
If timeout, the implementation assumes the worst and removes the old
dest.new before retrying.

Once dest.new is succesfuly created by an updater, the updater may
write() new data and finally commit() it - e.g.:
    with OpenLockedFile('/my/path/to/file') as fdw:
        fdw.write(data)
        fdw.commit()

The file is "unlocked" when the context is left. If commit() was called,
the changes will also be commited at the same time. Otherwise,
the changes are discarded.

The file can be reopened for reading its original content while 'locked'
- e.g.:
    with OpenLockedFile('/my/path/to/file') as fdw:
        with open('/my/path/to/file', 'r') as fdr:
             data = fdr.read()

Change-Id: I6f10db3148451857afabeb185d473a9474b30ce0
Fixes: Bug #1163746
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify hashes.pkl use of path_lock

Adds support for OpenLockedFile context manager that acquires a virtual lock
on a dest file by allowing a single updater to create an updated file
(dest.new). Updaters will block until any previous updater has completed
(as signaled by dest.new being removed), or the timeout time has expired,
whichever occurs first.
If timeout, the implementation assumes the worst and removes the old
dest.new before retrying.

Once dest.new is succesfuly created by an updater, the updater may
write() new data and finally commit() it - e.g.:
    with OpenLockedFile('/my/path/to/file') as fdw:
        fdw.write(data)
        fdw.commit()

The file is "unlocked" when the context is left. If commit() was called,
the changes will also be commited at the same time. Otherwise,
the changes are discarded.

The file can be reopened for reading its original content while 'locked'
- e.g.:
    with OpenLockedFile('/my/path/to/file') as fdw:
        with open('/my/path/to/file', 'r') as fdr:
             data = fdr.read()

Change-Id: I6f10db3148451857afabeb185d473a9474b30ce0
Fixes: Bug #1163746

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-24 08:28:41.000000000', 'message': "Add 'flavor-list --all' admin switch

Nova gives admins public flavors and flavors from their own projects
only by default. For flavor management, admins need to see all flavors
regardless of access.

Changes:
- Adds an 'is_public' argument to flavors.list() that mirrors the
  Nova API. is_public=None can be used to see all flavors.
- Adds an --all switch to flavor-list in the CLI for use by admins
  when all flavors are wanted.

Fixes bug 1172179.

Change-Id: I915cd2d8266cb6e32c80691a6ff27d8a23488c98
"}, {'created': '2013-04-25 23:49:25.000000000', 'message': "Add 'flavor-list --all' admin switch

Nova gives admins public flavors and flavors from their own projects
only by default. For flavor management, admins need to see all flavors
regardless of access.

Changes:
- Adds an 'is_public' argument to flavors.list() that mirrors the
  Nova API. is_public=None can be used to see all flavors.
- Adds an --all switch to flavor-list in the CLI for use by admins
  when all flavors are wanted.

Fixes bug 1172179.

Change-Id: I915cd2d8266cb6e32c80691a6ff27d8a23488c98
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'flavor-list --all' admin switch

Nova gives admins public flavors and flavors from their own projects
only by default. For flavor management, admins need to see all flavors
regardless of access.

Changes:
- Adds an 'is_public' argument to flavors.list() that mirrors the
  Nova API. is_public=None can be used to see all flavors.
- Adds an --all switch to flavor-list in the CLI for use by admins
  when all flavors are wanted.

Fixes bug 1172179.

Change-Id: I915cd2d8266cb6e32c80691a6ff27d8a23488c98

Ok, so we're relying on being able to chain LoggerAdapters together by overriding the LoggerAdapter attribute - the lazy loading is done by using a @property to create the logger the first time you go to log something

Seems reasonable to me

We could switch to LazyAdapter by default for everything, but that seems a little overkill

Maybe we could have getLogger() detect that setup() hasn't been called yet and return a LazyAdapter instead of a ContextAdapter ?

In any case, I hope you'll go ahead and make nova actually use this code

Thanks for the patch dims!"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-04-23 01:33:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Support for lazily instantiated loggers

As part of code review for LP #1161031, there was a suggestion
to lazily instantiate the logger in oslo. The use case was when
creating LOG at a module level when we have not yet called
logging.setup, we needed a way to delay creating actual loggers

Added a handlers property in ContextAdapter so the existing testcase
can be used for lazy loggers as well

Change-Id: Iae2e379f8a0d2d38836645e7648294dee97deaaa

commit_message:
Completes the power_state mapping from compute driver and manager

Fixes bug 1166906

Added extra states to constants module together with test
cases checking every state map.

Also added some debug statements under blockdev and operator
to be able to spot obvious issues with images at deploy time.

Change-Id: I77ebb4d417a3875b761f5fb220d9274b79611ff0

commit_message:
Map internal S3 image state to EC2 API values

Fixes the EC2 API so it maps internal S3 image state values to
ones defined by the EC2 API rather than returning the internally
used values.

Fixes bug #1074904

Change-Id: Iabbda0e5fcbe4d572c76367c6f98d4bece050e73

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-27 12:21:25.000000000', 'message': "Send RPCs to 'engine' topic not 'engine.$host'

Fixes bug #1173573

We currently send engine RPCs to the 'engine.$host' topic means that
it is impossible to run heat-api and heat-engine on different
machines because you can't configure heat-api with the hostname of
heat-engine.

Fix this simply by sending RPCs to 'engine' which heat-engine. We have
always listened on this topic, so there is no backwards compat
concerns.

This is somewhat related to the multiple-engines blueprint, but
doesn't really help or hinder it.

Change-Id: Ibd4dc948ace4476bfa8e7fdc86e948a622416e58
"}, {'created': '2013-04-27 12:26:08.000000000', 'message': "Send RPCs to 'engine' topic not 'engine.$host'

Fixes bug #1173573

We currently send engine RPCs to the 'engine.$host' topic means that
it is impossible to run heat-api and heat-engine on different
machines because you can't configure heat-api with the hostname of
heat-engine.

Fix this simply by sending RPCs to 'engine' which heat-engine. We have
always listened on this topic, so there is no backwards compat
concerns.

This is somewhat related to the multiple-engines blueprint, but
doesn't really help or hinder it.

Change-Id: Ibd4dc948ace4476bfa8e7fdc86e948a622416e58
"}]
commit_message:
Send RPCs to 'engine' topic not 'engine.$host'

Fixes bug #1173573

We currently send engine RPCs to the 'engine.$host' topic means that
it is impossible to run heat-api and heat-engine on different
machines because you can't configure heat-api with the hostname of
heat-engine.

Fix this simply by sending RPCs to 'engine' which heat-engine. We have
always listened on this topic, so there is no backwards compat
concerns.

This is somewhat related to the multiple-engines blueprint, but
doesn't really help or hinder it.

Change-Id: Ibd4dc948ace4476bfa8e7fdc86e948a622416e58

commit_message:
Encode consoleauth token in utf-8 to make it a str

This is needed for memcached backend, because the key cannot be a
unicode object in any of the exposed functions.

Fixes bug 1164784

Co-authored-by: Stanislaw Pitucha <stanislaw.pitucha@hp.com>

Change-Id: Ieb1429116d96eefe97564fe92631063dc16117cb
(cherry picked from commit 6dadf73305c0a3d779dd625a8349b4a7341df18d)

commit_message:
Raise correct exception for duplicate networks

When using Quantum, if duplicate network ids are passed in on a
nova boot, nova-api raises a NetworkNotFound exception, which is
not correct.  This change causes it to raise a NetworkDuplicated
exception instead.

Fixes bug 1165088

Change-Id: I4f1f9aa5e1fa0e740b78e67760d924e2dd1d4d98
(cherry picked from commit 8eadd2aee9086815f9fe600d1e2d26145d7b5c16)

[{'created': '2013-04-22 19:20:19.000000000', 'message': "Make compute/manager use conductor for unrescue()

The compute_api.unrescue() call makes direct database queries, which means
it can't be called directly from compute manager. This patch adds support
in conductor for proxying this request and makes compute manager utilize
it.

Fixes bug 1167619

(cherry-picked from 188f306aa88a6a5b73959c74f1642720d7627789)
Change-Id: I158c64cabdfe436462f5669047fb930819a13c50
"}]
commit_message:
Make compute/manager use conductor for unrescue()

The compute_api.unrescue() call makes direct database queries, which means
it can't be called directly from compute manager. This patch adds support
in conductor for proxying this request and makes compute manager utilize
it.

Fixes bug 1167619

(cherry-picked from 188f306aa88a6a5b73959c74f1642720d7627789)
Change-Id: I158c64cabdfe436462f5669047fb930819a13c50

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-12 17:58:57.000000000', 'message': 'Accepts aws-sdk-java timestamp format

The aws-sdk-java timestamp format is "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'"
which contains millisecond representation. However, the current
implementation does not accept this kind of format.

References:
https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java/blob/master/src/main/java/com/amazonaws/auth/QueryStringSigner.java#L173

Adds ability to parse this format in ec2utils.is_ec2_timestamp_expired.

Fixes bug 1156445.

Change-Id: I389ff8b9c6c91b699538b889add264d66dbb8131
(cherry picked from commit 69e940c661731c8ac3cc0cf4e874929c86dcdeb2)
'}]
commit_message:
Accepts aws-sdk-java timestamp format

The aws-sdk-java timestamp format is "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'"
which contains millisecond representation. However, the current
implementation does not accept this kind of format.

References:
https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java/blob/master/src/main/java/com/amazonaws/auth/QueryStringSigner.java#L173

Adds ability to parse this format in ec2utils.is_ec2_timestamp_expired.

Fixes bug 1156445.

Change-Id: I389ff8b9c6c91b699538b889add264d66dbb8131
(cherry picked from commit 69e940c661731c8ac3cc0cf4e874929c86dcdeb2)

[{'created': '2013-04-12 17:12:20.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure only pickle-able objects live in metadata

Conductor api has been added to InstanceMetadata object, but it cannot
be serialised. This breaks storing metadata in memcache, because the
information needs to be passed through pickle.

Since the field was not used outside of the constructor, it can be
removed to fix the problem.
Also add a test that pickles a sample InstanceMetadata to catch similar
failures in the future.

Fixes bug 1160900

Change-Id: I7e8cef5a131290eaa1402d48295026bcac6baff6
(cherry picked from commit 2da5ea6e5685ae5c349fc1d175594aecbe0a0e23)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure only pickle-able objects live in metadata

Conductor api has been added to InstanceMetadata object, but it cannot
be serialised. This breaks storing metadata in memcache, because the
information needs to be passed through pickle.

Since the field was not used outside of the constructor, it can be
removed to fix the problem.
Also add a test that pickles a sample InstanceMetadata to catch similar
failures in the future.

Fixes bug 1160900

Change-Id: I7e8cef5a131290eaa1402d48295026bcac6baff6
(cherry picked from commit 2da5ea6e5685ae5c349fc1d175594aecbe0a0e23)

call is made to get instance_type info for the instance. To avoid the
db call, this should instead call instance_types.extract_instance_type
on the instance.

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary db call in scheduler driver live-migration code

When the scheduler selects a destination host for live-migration, a db
call is made to get instance_type info for the instance. To avoid the
db call, this should instead call instance_types.extract_instance_type
on the instance.

Resolves bug 1167811.

Change-Id: I2025fdf1d34e70158360ff71e8545c8e3bc6bc80
(cherry picked from commit 5f68160354d240b191bcbaabca7d3c0684758cc6)

commit_message:
Fix error message in pre_live_migration.

We are using locals() to reference a variable which doesn't exist
in this error message. Also rename the instance variable while I
am here to be more consistent with other uses.

Resolves bug 1164072.

Change-Id: I96f5e2a81ac2e97181c3e87df83e19b381f4bcd2
(cherry picked from commit 676b16bfe5ff41eb28d782c888c17dae6bdff76a)

commit_message:
set timeout for paramiko ssh connection

set powervm connection timeout to 60 seconds
to eliminate crashing if ssh server is slow in
responding.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-13 03:09:21.000000000', 'message': 'Cleans up orphan compute_nodes not cleaned up by compute manager

Fixes bug 1161193

Orphan compute_node records can cause the scheduler to pick
compute nodes that are not handled by driver anymore. This
can happen if you rename your hypervisor_hostname or in a
multi-node support where driver does not support a node
anymore for whatever reason (hardare failure for example).

Also, removing resource tracker logic to delete nodes since
resource trackers built in compute manager will never accept
nodes not reported by driver

Change-Id: I742d2e81ec0592d952ee5736aa8dce1e5598ef80
'}]
commit_message:
Cleans up orphan compute_nodes not cleaned up by compute manager

Fixes bug 1161193

Orphan compute_node records can cause the scheduler to pick
compute nodes that are not handled by driver anymore. This
can happen if you rename your hypervisor_hostname or in a
multi-node support where driver does not support a node
anymore for whatever reason (hardare failure for example).

Also, removing resource tracker logic to delete nodes since
resource trackers built in compute manager will never accept
nodes not reported by driver

Change-Id: I742d2e81ec0592d952ee5736aa8dce1e5598ef80

This makes the DB API for instance_get_all() variants able to take a
columns_to_join parameter like the base instance_get_all() function,
which provides control over whether we go to the trouble of pulling
the metadata out of the database before we return the instances.

Related to bug 1164737

(cherry-picked from ba9cd2a545a0c198990f649b6a2985a22102930f)
Change-Id: Ie7c012e2e12bb91ef4294cdc90d828af255b67c5
'}]
commit_message:
Change DB API instance functions for selective metadata fetching

This makes the DB API for instance_get_all() variants able to take a
columns_to_join parameter like the base instance_get_all() function,
which provides control over whether we go to the trouble of pulling
the metadata out of the database before we return the instances.

Related to bug 1164737

(cherry-picked from ba9cd2a545a0c198990f649b6a2985a22102930f)
Change-Id: Ie7c012e2e12bb91ef4294cdc90d828af255b67c5

commit_message:
Query quantum once for instance's security groups

This patch adds the method get_instance_security_group_bindings()
which returns all the instance_id's and security groups for a given
tenant. This method is then used to avoid querying quantum for it's
security groups when using GET /v2/<project_id>/servers/detail.

Fixes bug 1161518

Conflicts:

    nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_security_groups.py

Change-Id: Ia28d5573c264f0316ab9fb257ca8e7ae35679883
(cherry picked from commit afeb95dfc924ed7e768d76bc5ae4bd4c55e9dcb3)

commit_message:
get context from req rather than getting a new admin context

This patch removes the call to context.get_admin_context() and instead
obtains the context from the req object. Allowing the context.auth_token
to be reused.

Fixes bug 1161081

Conflicts:

	nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/security_groups.py

Change-Id: I3b104edc2966fc3263fad824b1c4c99df832672e
(cherry picked from commit 1ea02dbcf5ae3e822378a580ac1e54467f664be7)

commit_message:
Convert host value from unicode to a string.

The memcached API expects string format, not unicode.
Convert the host value to a string before creating
the cache_key and passing it to memcached.

Fixes: bug #1158958
Change-Id: I26e86b7fb61b4b3380a14686bd2faa9f58017999
(cherry picked from commit a11c41b48dff83a91eaa65630cc6aeb0e51e6461)

commit_message:
Correct disk's over committed size computing error

There's a error in the disk's over committed size computing for the
instance which using RAW type disk. This issue caused
disk_available_least resource counting increasing.

Fixes bug: 1167695

Change-Id: I4e6cf22a9cf66a757e3641e2a0be0b7699cae69d
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 32e455282250efa385984085f1ecd8847cc6be2c)

[{'created': '2013-04-19 15:06:25.000000000', 'message': "Don't swallow PolicyNotAuthorized for resize/reboot actions

Removes 'except Exception' lines in the api which were preventing
PolicyNotAuthorized exceptions from bubbling up and returning 403 to the
caller.  This addresses policy exceptions in confirmResize,
revertResize, and reboot.

The try block calls into the compute api which sends a cast to perform
to bulk of the work, so there is little chance of an exception bubbling
up which is not already being caught.

Removes a unit test for a condition that should not exist.

Bug 1170453

Change-Id: I516a19894ab3d183057c774e84c4faa7053a6463
(cherry picked from commit 7e006ca39fc57e35244f471c0f0bb6773fdbbc28)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't swallow PolicyNotAuthorized for resize/reboot actions

Removes 'except Exception' lines in the api which were preventing
PolicyNotAuthorized exceptions from bubbling up and returning 403 to the
caller.  This addresses policy exceptions in confirmResize,
revertResize, and reboot.

The try block calls into the compute api which sends a cast to perform
to bulk of the work, so there is little chance of an exception bubbling
up which is not already being caught.

Removes a unit test for a condition that should not exist.

Bug 1170453

Change-Id: I516a19894ab3d183057c774e84c4faa7053a6463
(cherry picked from commit 7e006ca39fc57e35244f471c0f0bb6773fdbbc28)

commit_message:
Support the new claim TTL semantics in SQlite.

This also fix a bug in update claim, which should
reset the age of the claim.

Change-Id: I69a31fd99bd23db87f6e77935889671c2b1c53ed
Implements: blueprint storage-reference

commit_message:
Support message deletion with claim in MongoDB.

This also fix a potential bug, a user can delete a message
not in his/her queue.

Change-Id: Iac7b0ade3a7d04e0a3cfdb799c81dc8529fd054c
Implements: blueprint storage-mongodb
